Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere - Lacking Severely in Rooms”
Reviews.Author: nyajt
Reviews.Content: The lobby is gorgeous, as many people will agree. The staff is really nice and accommodating - helpful if you need anything. BUT, for the price and reputation (we spent 300 for a king regular room)- it is disappointing. The rooms/hallways have a musty smell- almost like mildew. The bathroom/shower combo was super tiny, lacking what you would expect from a hotel of this caliber. The rooms were outdated - especially the bathroom. Also- I scheduled a mani/pedi in the salon - which felt old and outdated as well. For both services it was $100- would definitely not waste my money again on this. Thought it would be a greater experience being the El San Juan and all. Overall, is a nice location with a variety of pool space/beach space but could use a refresh!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, nasty place. Wonderful, wonderful food!”
Reviews.Author: RobKDover_MA
Reviews.Content: The El San Juan's lobby is one of the most beautiful I've seen. Think of a cross between the glass art of Dale Chihuly and classic Hemingway Key West. Great first impression. Next the room by the pool. Total econolodge motiff. Dirty towels behind the bathroom door. Black mold seeping out between ceiling tiles. Squishy bathtub(?). Filthy like I've never encountered before. An "intimacy" kit that my two kids found on the nightstand. Classy stuff. No vibrating bed though. We tried to make the best of it, kept our mouths shut and went to the pool. Totally mediocre and Spring break like. Not our type of place. We went to the beach. Overcrowded and not very pretty. Back to the room. We can't take it and pack up and leave. We tell the manager(nice lady)we're outta here and they put us in a suite in the main building. An improvement, the rooms much cleaner, but tired looking and in need of some touch ups. I call my sister in he states, whose been to San Juan several times, and tell her i need a place to eat. At this point im not risking eating here. She says there's a fabulous Italain Restaurant actually in the El San Juan. We're tired. We go there to eat. I'm absolutely floored. From beginning to end its a 10! An absolutely perfect meal. I swear I'm flying back to San Juan just for this restaurant. We had breakfast at Starbucks because Italian restaurant was closed and I just couldnt press my luck. Ok - so in short- spend the extra $150 and stay at the Ritz, but eat at the Italian Restauant in the El San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great all Around!”
Reviews.Author: Len H
Reviews.Content: The service was amazing, especially at the front desk! We walked out of our original hotel and came to the El San Juan, we were very welcomed and accomadated! We love Isla Verde, and this is a great hotel option!

Reviews.Title: “"Great Time"”
Reviews.Author: Marvin T
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to PR for her birthday. We spent 4 night at this resort and we had a blast!! When we researched the resort and saw the pics, it looked the same when we arrived. The staff was exceptionally pleasant, helpful and very friendly. We were told about the steak house in the hotel before we got there and we were looking forward to eating there but unfortunately they close the day we arrived. However Angel (staff) pointed us to the Intecontinental hotel next door at Rick's Steak house, that served fabulous steak and lobster. We went there and it was very upscaled, elegant and the food was awesome. Their Mojitos are the best we had ever had and the staff was just as firendly as the ones in our hotel.The pools at El San Juan are great and just a great environment to relax. We found the staff very helpful with questions concerning local resturants, transportation and sites. There are great local resturantsto eat, whether it be breakfast, lunch or dinner. Overall my wife and I had a great time and we are looking forward to going back soon. MT, Connecticut

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing - I can't believe this is a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Pat_R_99999
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here, you will be very disappointed. I just returned from 6 nights here and I would NEVER go back...nor would I recommend it to anyone! The place was grubby and the lobby bathrooms were filthy. They smelled disgusting and were definitely not cleaned regularly. My room was near the elevator on the 6th floor (although my Hilton Honors profile says that I prefer to be away from the elevator). There was a terribly annoying (almost like nails on a blackboard after 6 days) squeaking door behind the elevators, that sounded like it was in my room. It must have been used by the service staff because it happened all day and all night. It drove me nuts. I was told the hotel was full so I could not move. The pools were beautiful but it was very difficult to get a lounge chair. There was a sign near the towel house that said that pool staff would clear lounge chairs at 9:30 am...I assume to free up chairs that were not being used so that they would be available for others. I never saw anyone do that. As a matter of fact, there was a man's shirt sitting on a lounge chair for 2 days and no one ever moved it. The pool cleaner actually tried it on to see if he should take it but it was too big for him. He threw it back on the chair and left it there. I guess it would have been OK for him to take it if it fit, but it never crossed his mind to turn it into the Lost & Found??? The majority of lounge chairs had towels on them but were not being used. On the Saturday of my visit, it poured rain all day. I spent quite a bit of time in my room since there was not much else to do. The service staff spent hours in the hallways laughing and fooling around...they were very noisy. It was clear to me that most of the employees were more interested in socializing with their coworkers rather than doing their jobs. Guests were not their priority. Although the pools were very nice and they were cleaned every morning, on my last day at the resort, I saw some weird film/sludge near one of the filters. It was gross and I have no idea what it was. This was after the pool was cleaned...YUK! This was my first trip to PR and if I go back it will NOT be to the El San Juan. I wish I had read some of the reviews before I booked my trip. I would have gone somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Stephen B
Reviews.Content: I was troubled by some of the reveiws and wondered if it was for the same hotel. Face it it is a resort on the beach in a major city. Things are expensive if you are at the resort. Hint, there are alternatives for meals within a couple blocks that are reasonable and good if that is your issue. The lobby is spectacular and the casino very nice. Places rocks on the weekend. The staff I encountered were polite, friendly and helpful. The room was nice but somewhat worn. I can understand some of the reviews based on the quality of rooms at other Hiltons. Close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is Great... The Staff are Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Angie N
Reviews.Content: I would have given the property itself 3 or 4 stars, but I can't get over the way the staff treated us while we were there. My friends and I booked a girls trip online through the El San Juan Resort and Casino Website. When booking, they charged my credit card $900 as a deposit. When it came time to check out, they had no record of charging a deposit. Finally, after a 35 minute conversation with the front desk, they found the charge and then were supposed to put the remainder of the charges on my card. The receipt had my name, credit card number and signature on it. Traveling with six girls, I spent the time to split up the difference and each one was to pay me a sum. It is a cumbersome process. Two months after we return from our trip, one of my friends who had put down her card only to get into the room and had asked several times for it not to be charged, was actually charged the difference minus the deposit. With no signature, no conversation, nothing. Then, the hotel calls me with my friend on the line and says can we now charge your card instead of your friends with no mention of a credit card authorization form or other indication that I am in fact the owner of my credit card and can be charged. Other examples of rude staff include ladies at the Italian deli chatting with each other instead of fixing any food, even when you are standing there and waiting for your order. Water was not poured, ever, we had to get up and get it ourselves. It was all in all a good trip, because my girls and I aren't fussy, but the staff and unprofessionalism of the finance department and some of the restaurants on-site definitely took away from this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Janice R
Reviews.Content: Just took a short business trip with my husband and I really did not expect much from this hotel after reading all the negative reviews on this site. To our surprise, we loved staying at this hotel and would go there again. It was a very short trip from the airport and on a strip with other hotels....the Ritz and the Intercontinental. The El San Juan has a lot of character with its grand lobby and carved wood throughout the hotel. The restaurants on the site were pricey but had great quality food especially the Italian restaurant...great service as well. We were disappointed to learn that the Palm Restaurant had closed the end of March. The highlight of the trip was the nite life that happens in the lobby at night....great band and dancing until the wee hours in the morning....very lively and many people dancing the Salsa! The casino was also very enjoyable....completely smoke free and the offer free drinks while you are playing. Check in staff and generally all the staff were very friendly and helpful.....the hotel rooms could use a Facelift but our room was clean and comfortable. If you have any concerns prior to going there.....you can contact Susan Wilkerson at the hotel and she will be very helpful to answer any of your questions. Paul

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but I would not go back.”
Reviews.Author: NJ_200Traveler
Reviews.Content: First- a disclosure: I don't love casinos and this was my first stay in a "resort/casino' type facility. I did not go to the casino, I walked through it. The hotel itself is clean and modern - rooms were very comfortable. My room on the third floor had a cement, enclosed patio to hide a very ugly view of the flat top roof filled with vents and a/c condensers. Bedding is great and I had three good nights of sleep. Bathrooms were beautiful and modern- well lit and again, clean. We initially asked for two doubles, but they did not have a room available, so my sister and I shared a king bed - not the end of the world, but not ideal. The pool area is beautiful and well kept - give or take a few cups in the pool at the end of the day. The property itself is stunning. The average rating is because they charge ALOT for EVERYTHING. You want WiFi - there is a fee; you want a beach chair - there is a fee; you want a pad on the old, beat up beach chair - there is a fee. This is a high end resort and the room rates should include these things- don't nickle and dime me. If you want bottled water on the beach, expect to pay $8 for it. There is no coffee maker in the room, so if you want coffee, you either order room service ( a pot of coffee was like $19 or close to that) or you endure a long line at Starbucks in the lobby, where you still pay 4 dollars. Meals in the hotel are very expensive - even lunch for two at the outdoor cafe (on paper plated and with plastic cups) ran nearly $80 - for salads and a beer. The resort crowd while I was there was also a little rowdy and rude - I like to have a good time, but there were people so drunk they had to be carried out of the pool area. And if you are there during an event - like a wedding or party, expect to be ignored by the wait staff. They are busy. Also, if you want a cabana or poolside seating, you will need to get up at 5AM to 'stake it out' by putting your stuff there - kind of a bummer. People stay in these things all day long then give them to friends, so don't expect to actually USE the beautiful seating shown on the website. One upside- if you are there for a short trip, the resort is about 7 minutes from the airport, so you can land at noon and be on the beach with a drink in your hand by 12:30. The beach itself is pretty and offers good swimming (there was seaweed on two of my 4 day stay, but that goes with the territory...) Cabs are not cheap. Expect to pay about $20 in cab fare to get there from the airport, and another $20 -$25 to get to old San Juan. If you plan to leave the resort at all - which I recommend - better to rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Bad as the Reviews”
Reviews.Author: MillerOD
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here from Easter Sunday until Early Friday Morning. Overall I would stay here again. Yes the bar and restaurants at the hotel were expensive, but it is a resort, and if I was staying in NYC the cost of a drink would be similar. Pros: 1. Fantastic Lobby 2. Beach and Pool very nice 3. Casino was Small and no smoking. 4. Room was Clean 5. Room Large enough for family of 4, two being teenagers 6. Grounds were kept clean. 7. Pool Chairs were comfortable 8. USA Today and NY times highlights offer for free. 9. Live Music in the lobby Cons 1. No Coffee Maker in the room. Had to leave the room and either have 4bucks, or walk 5 minutes to another location to get a coffee. 2. Closet Space was limited 3. The Pool Restaurant Menu was expensive and not great. 4. Had to reserve Chairs at the pool very early, but plenty by the beach. 5. Internet was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankieP05
Reviews.Content: I am honestly shocked to see these negative reviews, especially on the same week that I stayed at the El San Juan. I went with my boyfriend for a week. The weekends were definitely more busy/crazy than during the week, but that is not to say that it was bad. We had a clean room with a view of the mountain, and a comfy bed. We booked the "PR Getaway", which gave us 20% off at the spa, $150 credit to use at the restaurants/bars in the hotel, as well as 2 $25 credits at the casino. The pools were nice, beach is gorgeous, and lobby was beautiful. All of the staff we saw or had questions for were very friendly and accommodating. The restaurants & bars were pricey, however it is a hotel, and you are on vacation, so what can you expect? We did not have one issue on this trip, and I would definitely recommend this hotel to any couples, families or friends looking to get away.

Reviews.Title: “puerto rico 2012!”
Reviews.Author: Maddy A
Reviews.Content: I took my 3 children and 2 of their friends who ranged from 10 to 14. I have to say they had an awesome time! I got up every morning to have my ice coffee and oatmeal at starbucks. (the only thing affordable in the hotel). then I would reserve chairs at the beach. when kids woke up, they would get their bracelets and extra towels and head for the beach. Honestly, I didn't go to an island to sit by a pool with other screaming kids, so finding all the pool chairs taken by 7:30 didn't bother me. I came to see the beautiful beach. yes, there was seaweed, but most of it was cleaned up. what bothered me was the truck that came on the beach to clean it up while people were on the beach. that kind of thing should be done at 6:00/7:00 am. not 9:30-10:00! There were also other vehicles driving up and down the beach which annoyed me. the kids favorite part of the trip was taking a break from the beach and hanging out at the hot-tubs which were next to a waterfall. my kids met other kids there and took tons of pictures. lots of fun for them. probably not fun for the adults that wanted to be there. the other thing they loved was the banana boat ride. they took endless rides with other kids. their favorite place to eat was by the barbeque cart on the beach. He had hot-dogs, hamburgers, shrimp, chicken and talapia. and water bottles for $1.00. prices for food ranged from $4.00-$12.00. all very resonable. As far as the rooms, they were outdated and yes there were some stains and rips in the upholstery and linens, but kids didn't care and i was just there to sleep and keep watch. carpet in the hallway of the rooms smelled like someone had spilled champagne on it and there were stains there too. my kids loved the lobby. they would hang out there with other kids they met and take pictures, people watch, dance a little, and horse around. it was everything they wanted. they didn't want to leave. the price per night was definitely higher than the quality of the hotel. I also priced other islands and for $250 a night, and you get less for your money, so I don't think it wasnt so over the top expensive. would i go back, absolutely not. would my kids. of course. and as far as I'm concerned, it's all about the kids! :)

Reviews.Title: “Deteriorating Hotel + ($400 per reg room) Expensive + countless Scamy billing errors”
Reviews.Author: Sagees
Reviews.Content: I flew to Porto Rico for My little brother's bachelor party. There were 10 of us staying in the hotel from Thursday March 29th - April 1, 2012 I can pretty much right a book about this one. This hotel just about got it all wrong. I give a short summery for those who dont have time to read the long review. The Good: 1. Beds are great! 2. Rooms are quite even though there is a huge party going on in the lobby every night. 3. The people giving out towels were really nice The Bad: 1. They got our reservation wrong. Both the number of rooms and the number of nights. 2. Rooms are EXTREMELY expensive for what you get. 3. The hotel is run down and falling apart. 4. Breakfast is $25 a person, its freaking porto rico. 5. Right by the airport, so planes are going over your head every 5 minutes 6. No chance of getting a pool chair after 9:00 am. 7. Hotel recommended an all day boat trip on "traveler" brand boat at $100 per person. Was the worst boat trip i have ever taken in my life. TRAP TRAP TRAP!!!!! 8. The hotel night club will not let you in without a button down shirt. 9. Really scamy charges come up from the mini bar, restaurant and other places. None of them took place and it take the hotel days to get back to you. 10. Shower cutain is 100% cotton, WTF?? it does not keep the water in and also gets soaked. 11. Any decent restaurant is a long cab away. More Details: The Bad: 1. They got our reservation wrong. Both the number of rooms and the number of nights. We booked five bed rooms with two double beds in each room. What we got was four bed rooms with some in king and some double. That meant some of our friends had to choose between sleeping in a king together, or sleeping on a cot. It could be worse, but at $400 a night, you have to be kidding me. We booked three nights and on the seconds night they came to check us out. For some reason they screwed up the reservation for several of the rooms and had them for two nights instead of three. Mind you the reservation was made as one. Actually, my dad organized everything. He confirmed and reconfirmed with the hotel several times before arrival. 2. Rooms are EXTREMELY expensive for what you get. The rooms are decent, but $400 a night is ludicrous. The bathroom is very small and the room is not that big either. The view was horrible from our window. As you can see from the photos, you can see the hotel rotting away in front of your eyes, not to mention an ugly hump is hiding the view of the ocean which is the only thing you are supposed to see in the first place. 3. The hotel is run down and falling apart. Check out the photos. This place needs a renovation ASAP. The lobby is pitch black. It's as ugly and non fitting a tropical resort as you can get. The hallways have 30 year old carpeting that smells. The rooms are in need of a serious make over, especially the curtains. The outside walls are rotting and suffer serious discoloration. 4. Breakfast is $25 a person, its freaking porto rico. Nothing more to say about this one. I didnt have it. 5. Right by the airport, so planes are going over your head every 5 minutes There is some convenience in having the resort close to the airport, but all that goes away the second you get to the pool or beach and are inundated with constant take off and landing jet noise. 6. No chance of getting a pool chair after 9:00 am. We were a group of 10 friends. Some got up early, others later. No one got to the beach before 8:00. But at 9:00 am, there is no change of getting a pool chare. They are all take. I dont know who takes them, but its seems that there are more chares than bends in the hotel. In any case, unless you want to get into a fight with someone who placed their towel on the chair at night to save a seat, sit on the floor. 7. Hotel recommended an all day boat trip on "traveler" brand boat at $100 per person. Was the worst boat trip i have ever taken in my life. TRAP TRAP TRAP!!!!! This was actually the low point of the trip. We thought it would be just the opposite, but just let the El San Juan surprise you it will not miss the opportunity to disappoint. This was not a cheap trip at $100 a person, so we thought it would be a nigh day adventure. It included transportation to and from the boat, snorkeling, all equipment, food and drinks for the entire day. The trip started at an early 7:30 am departure from the hotel. Not so night when you are on vacation. A very old large bus picked us up. We waited till people got on and then ventured further to pick some more people till all 50 spaces were occupied. Then we were off to the boat destination. The driver spoke up and let us know that i would be an hour from now to reach our point of interest. An hour?? Where is this place?? well it turns out the trip was an hour because the bus cant do over 35 MPH. I dont know how they let this automobile on the road. In any case, we arrive exhausted from an ever so slow bus ride. Some old hag gets on the bus and tells us we have to pay and sign some release from, so every person single file gets on a 50 person Q to pay and sign. That took another 45 minutes. You would think they could have freaking taken care of that on the hour bus ride!!!!???? Onwards. Some old hag greats us and starts talking in a very annoying teacher like tone. Everyone just wants to go back to the hotel at this point, lets cut out losses, and now we get this hag. She starts spitting out rules, dont sit here but sit there, do that but not this. And here is the most annoying one of all. She tells everyone that she values recycling, im sure we all do, but she continues, "please keep your plastic cut for the whole trip." Are you F%^@ING kidding me??? So get this, there are 50 people on the boat, you have to fight for a place to sit, seriously, there is room for 20 people to sit, the other 30 have to stand. So we have to find a safe place for our crappy throw away plastic cup for the next 6 hours??? Then we start sailing, that was actually kind of nice for 10 minutes as the boat was finally on its way and at a nice speed. Then it started raining, and not a drizzle, a torrential downpour. We were all freezing cold and there was not room for everyone under the cover. We were really suffering, this was not about fun not fun, this was just suffering. Then we get to the first snorkeling destination and jump in the water ASAP, as the water is warmer than the outside temp. Guess what, there is no quarrel reef here. Its a freaking joke. There are no fish here either. This is tons of dead rock and sandy water you cant see much in. Lunch: not only was it a sorry collection of cheap, stale, crappy rolls and an equivalent supply of ham cold cuts, but we had to get on line to make our own Sh#@ sandwich. It took you 40 minutes to get through. All kidding aside, they must have spent $30 USD for all the materials for the food. A royal joke. Ill spare you the rest of the trip, it just got worse and worse until there was a mutiny and all 50 of us just requested to go home ASAP. Not quite done with this one. We get on the bus, soaking wet and there are two people missing. Turns out that two gals booked a back to back trip with this company and they wanted to cancel the second trip ASAP after they experienced what "travel" brand had to offer. They did not want to get on the bus before the manager got them cash back. So one of the employees had to trive to an ATM and get them cash. That tool another 45 minutes. And then all was had was a 1.5 hour bus ride back home. Why was it an extra half hour more than the bus ride their you ask, well, we hit rush hour :). 8. The hotel night club will not let you in without a button down shirt. We reserved a $500 table at the nigh club, thats right, $500/table minimum charge. Its Porto Rico which is apparently more expensive than NYC. I came down dressed with a Polo shirt and that did not make the cut. 9. Really scamy charges come up from the mini bar, restaurant and other places. None of them took place and it take the hotel days to get back to you. We had $500 of scamy charges comes from all sorts of places. a. The restaurant at the hotel. Extra charges of $200 from what the hotel found was the table next to us. b. Room charges for internet when we didnt even have laptops. and our phones were working fine on our US carrier data. c. Charges from ordering food and drinks from the lobby, when we never did that. All the charges were refunded, but it seems like the hotel tries to get away with this, especially with large parties. 10. Shower cutain is 100% cotton, WTF?? it does not keep the water in and also gets soaked. Every time i took a shower, the curtain was soaked and the bathroom floor was flooded. Also, the shower head is very cheap and does not slay in place. You have to magiver it to stay in one position and the water pressure is also aggravatingly low. 11. Any decent restaurant is a long cab away. There is no decent local food that is walking distance away. You have to get a long cap ride to eat decent local food, which is actually pretty mediocre anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip all around!”
Reviews.Author: rochelle4881
Reviews.Content: I honestly do not know where all of these bad reviews are coming from. It almost makes me think rival hotels are having people write. I realize everyone has a different experience, but seriously, not one of the bad things in other people's reviews were a problem for us. Check In: We arrived around 3:00 pm and were able to check in no problem. The process was very quick and we were in our room within 5 minutes. The room: We had a partial ocean view room (a '35') and it was awesome. Close to the elevator, but not too close where we heard the elevator dings. Our room was super clean and airy. The bed was fabulous as well. They cleaned every day and we had no problems. There are no balconies, which is probably my only complaint! The lobby: Beautiful!! I couldn't get over the gorgeous chandeliers! Service was great - we always got served quickly and staff was friendly. Drinks were standard pricing for a resort. If you want cheap drinks, don't come to a resort. The people watching was amazing as well! There is a club in the lobby, which locals come to as well. I could have sat for hours looking at what people were wearing. The pool: Agreed, it's difficult to get chairs at the pool, but you are in PUERTO RICO people! The beach is five steps from the pool and you get fress chairs there as well! On our first day we didn't get to the beach until 3:30ish and were still able to get chairs there. How on earth can anyone complain about seaweed on a beach?! This is not the hotel's fault, it is mother nature's!! The beach was beautiful and the water was blue. There was a lot of seaweed one day while we were there, but again...how is this the hotel's fault? There is waitress service by the beach as well. And the pool is so close, we went from the ocean to the pool often. On our last day we did get the comfy chairs by the pool. I went downstairs at 8:00 am and several chairs were still open. The weekends were a lot more crowded, but it's the weekend! I will say, I did see the pool boys give aways chairs that had towels on them and nothing else, which is what should be done. You can't expect to put towels on a chair at 6:00 am and not come down until noon. The staff was all super nice at the pool and the food and drinks were tasty! Nothing seemed dirty to me and we were in the pool and hot tub. My only complaint would be that there were children in the hot tub. Brother Jimmy's: Awesome as well! Open air rooftop bar. It's a NY chain, but had a little Puerto Rican flair. The bar tenders were all super nice and funny! The Staff: Everyone I dealt with was nothing but nice! Everyone said hello when we saw them. Cabs were called in 30 seconds. My boyfriend and I mentioned to Josue when we checked in that we were there celebrating both of our birthdays and when we walked into our room Saturday night after dinner we had champagne, cake and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us! Such a nice touch - thank you Josue!! Surrounding Area: The strip is nice and safe. There are not too many authentic Puerto Rican places though. It's all chains. We weren't there to eat at Chili's or Burger King. There were a couple of mom and pop type Puerto Rican places that were really good, but if you want authentic food, spend $20 and take the short cab to Old San Juan (there is a bus too). I had my doubts about the El San Juan based on the reviews, but I seriously don't know where they are coming from! I travel a lot and have stayed at hotels/resorts all over and the El San Juan was one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraDNorthport_NY
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the El San Juan Resort and Casino for four nights, during the week. We booked through a third party, and the deal made us give it a try. I stayed at the Ritz Carlton with my family last year, so unfortunately, I did some comparing. It was not horrible, but the level of service is not up to par. My bed covering had a small blood stain on it. In my opinion, a quality hotel would not allow that to be used. It should have been discarded! On a few days, it appeared that housekeeping barely cleaned the room. They left washcloths in the shower, so I guess that means they never really washed the shower. The bathroom sink was not thoroughly cleaned. One evening we tried to get coffee in one of the restaurants that was in the Galleria, which is attached to the hotel. Although they were not supposed to close for another 20 minutes, we were told that their boss told them that they could close early, since there was no business. There was no place in the hotel to get coffee. We asked at the lobby bar if we could get coffee, and we were told that the kitchen area was closed. On another evening, we were impressed by the service at the lobby bar at the InterContinental Hotel. When we asked for coffee, the bartender went out of his way to get us a coffee, and was creative in getting us a to-go cup. We were not even guests in that hotel, but their bartender tried a little bit harder than our own hotel did. We never had the option of getting a chair by the pool, and it was not even a weekend. They do not have enough seating by the pool. There was a limited lunch menu at the pool. There was only one salad option. We inquired about where to shower if we needed to stay later on our last day, and we were told that some times you can shower at the tennis courts, but that it is not always open. You can shower at the fitness center, but there is a charge to shower and use the locker room! I have never heard of such a thing. Many folks like to go to the beach and take a later flight home. Usually the hotel offers a place to change and shower, without a fee. I know that I cannot compare this hotel to the Ritz Carlton, but at the Ritz, any time you pass an employee in a lobby, or by the pool, they give you a big smile and say hello. I often felt that some employees actually tried to avoid making eye contact. If you are on a budget, I guess you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “All poor reviews are true, sadly.”
Reviews.Author: jerzcali
Reviews.Content: Ok- where to start. I want to make this as simple as possible. I read the reviews before going to El San Juan and was nervous about the trip. Honestly, this hotel is OLD and really needs to be revamped. I bet it was a hot-spot in the 70's or 80's but WOW it sure needs some help now. If you can afford it- i STRONGLY suggest you to stay at The Ritz which is right next door. If i ever make it back to PR (which is doubtful...so many better placed to go <turks and caicos> i would stay in Ritz. We requested a "renovated" room based on reviews from other on Trip Advisors. However, "renovated" rooms are located in the towers and are prety gross. Postives on Room: -bed was very comfortable so we were happy with that. Yep, thats about the only positive. Negatives on Room: -YES (as others have said) gross moldy showers....we showered with flip flops all week. -No balcony -Scuffed furniture, dirty, old looking. Poor choice in decor!! - toilet flusher was hard to flush and shower head was also hard to turn on. If an elderly couple were in our room it would be very hard to turn shower on/off and flush toilet. -maids need to really clean in the crevices better....corners of room etc. There was hair on floor when we arrived. Skeeved me out. The concierge was very nice but other employees were not helpful. It was as if we were "bothering" them when we approached them with questions and concerns. POOL/BEACH: Postivies: -pool chairs are large and super comfortable - thats about it. Negatives: -some kids POOPED in the pool....and the guy scooped it out but there was no further chemicals put into the pool. Gross. -Weekend chair situation was A JOKE. My sister inlaw was up at 615am saving chairs. During the week you could go down at 7am. VERY BAD SITUATION with people reserving chairs. -Only 2-3 umbrellas at the pool....and it was HOT. They should get more umbrellas!!! -Beach had seaweed all over....stay by pool (if you can get a chair). RANDOM NOTES: -Brother Jimmy's on rooftop is AWESOME. Open air, good drinks, etc. Definitely check it out!! -Casino was decent. -Lobby bars are ok. -Prices of food and drinks were typical...you're on vacation so expect to spend $$$. -Walgreens very close which was great!!! - We took a one day flight to St Thomas (and St John) at 6am and returned at 7pm. It was a GREAT getaway from PR. "A vacation from our vacation" Again, pool chairs are awesome so if you can get them- stay by the pool! Good luck....but if you have time try another spot!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed a week with my family.”
Reviews.Author: Howard R
Reviews.Content: I used Hilton points to book two connecting rooms for my wife and 3 young kids. After reading all of the negative comments on TripAdvisor leading up to our trip, I was extremely nervous about what our experience would be. Now, to be clear, this hotel is completely different on Sunday-Thursday noon than it is from Thursday noon to Sunday afternoon. The weekdays are quiet and the bar area was completely dead. On Thursday night through the weekend, the bar area is packed, band is playing and Bravo is bringing in a ton of young people ready to party. (We met people who said that Saturday night was loud and crazy in the halls and they had to complain to the manager.) I can honestly say that our 5-night stay was fantastic. We stayed Sun-Fri on the 7th floor in the tower with connecting rooms. The rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet. For the pool area, you have to get there early to get a chair, especially on Fridays and Saturdays. The bar drink prices were standard for a resort like this but I did take advantage of the earlier comments and get some beers at the store across the street. (True story: Medella Light beers at the bar are $7 each with tip. They are $4 for a six-pack at the store.) The breakfast bar was good and clean and the service was fine. The beach area had stinky seaweed on it but you could walk down the beach and find clean areas. On Thursday morning, a truck came through and cleaned up the entire beach in front of the hotel so everything was clean for us. (Probably cleaning it up for the weekend crowd.) I booked excursions (ziplining, snorkeling, etc.) but did it all online before we went. Did not go through the hotel as this just increased the price. Overall, everything was great for us. We would return again as either a family (Sun-Thur) or go with a bunch of couples (Thurs-Sunday.)

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: LaKiva B
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I booked our family spring break at the El San Juan Resort and Casino. From the photos on their website, it was beautiful. Neither one of us thought to check tripadvisor before paying for the hotel in full. A week prior to our trip, the light went off, and we began to read all of the reviews and was terrified. We called our 3rd party to attempt to change hotels before getting there, but it was going to cost us more money. She and I decided to stick with our plans and hope for the best. Well, the day of the trip, she was unable to catch the same flight as my family and I (losing one night stay). My family and I arrived at the resort at about 11:25 or so. The lobby was BEAUTIFUL, something to die for!!! The check in process was great, and I was given $100.00 hotel credit.......yay!!! I booked the garden lanais room. Here's where the disaster begins.............we had to walk through what appeared like a jungle to get to our room. The building had an odor to it, and you could tell it was old. Even the elevator had an odor. Once I entered the room, my allergies immediately began to act up. The floor had to be full of dust and dust mites, there were some stains in the carpet, and the smell........that alone was enough for me. I called the 3rd party (whom I booked my reservation), and they called the hotel to have me moved to another room. We were moved to a city vista, which was actually worse!!! Mind you it is well after midnight, we are tired, sleepy, hungry and aggrevated. The white, was a dingy white; the bathroom toilet had pubic hair on the toilet; the shower floor had black stains in the caulk, ewwwwwww; the pillow on my daughter's bed had stains on it; the white sofa had stains on it as well. We had no choice but to stay there until morning. The kids and I slept fully clothed. That morning will on the phone with my 3rd party to change hotels immediately, I walked out on the patio (which appeared to be the roof or something), and there was an unwrapped condom on the patio. I was livid!!!! The hotel manager Yvonne wanted to move us to another room..........NOT!!! I want out!!! If their cleaning skills were subpar in 2 rooms, what in the devil made them think I wanted to try a 3rd?????!!!!!!! We moved to the San Juan Marriott, which was like Heaven compared to what we experienced the night before. NEVER AGAIN!!! To think this is a Hilton property and is ranked with 4 or more stars, is scarey. I've stayed at a better La Quinta Inn. Instead of a resort............this is more like the Bates Motel. A hot mess!!!! I wouldn't recommend them to my worse enemy. My advise, tear down and rebuild; hire a better cleaning staff!!!! If considering this hotel, PLEASE RUN

Reviews.Title: “A great time if you are 18 yrs of age and older....”
Reviews.Author: Nicole M
Reviews.Content: El San Juan is conveniently located off Isla Verde Ave. It offers a great party scene during the evening hours until the early morning from thursday-saturday. I do not advise families with small children staying here or couples looking for privacy. Due to the fact that a club is located in the same building, drunk patrons stumble in their rooms and tend to wake other visitors trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty resort located close to airport.”
Reviews.Author: Wbfd724
Reviews.Content: shower were yellowed. It seemed as if everything in the room was updated except the shower tiles. The on demand did not work as well. The pool was beautiful. One major complaint I have which Susan is aware of Is the availability of pool chairs with shade. The first day I went to the gym and then to the pool. At 7am... Yes 7am on a Monday every single pool Chair with the pretty white fabric overhang had towels on them except 3 as if they were taken. No guests to be seen but towels on every one except 3. I have dark skin and the sun gets very strong. You need shade. The other pool not with a pool bar has literally 2 umbrellas. Tuesday we set our alarms for 6:15am just to get a chair. We went down and nothing was available. Either they don't have enough chairs for their guests or guests are getting up at 6am, placing towels on chairs and going back to sleep. Who wants to get up at 6 on vacation?!?! The beach is very nice besides the 3 feet of sea weed when entering. Even though this is not the resorts fault they could rake the excess on the sand. Beach chairs are free umbrellas $10 each room charge. You are forced to buy the umbrella or You will bake. All the restaurants and pool bars are expensive. As to be expected, but this put A bad taste in our mouths. We split Half a burger at the pool bar, $13, it doesn't come with fries so that is an additional $5, one 8oz cup of coke loaded with ice, $4, one medalla light beer $5. It came out to about $34 with tax and tip to split a burger for lunch. Mojitos are $12 each, small plastic 8oz cups filled with ice. We dined at KoKo's next to the casino. It was excellent. Very expensive but delicious. We had two entrees and 1 appetizer no drinks just flat water. $77 around. The appetizer was scallops, it came with 3, for $18 for the appetizer alone. We dined at La Piccola Fontana the Italian Restaurant. One appetizer and two entrees $70. No drinks. Very good though. $20 can ride each way into Old San Juan. Go to Walgreens down the block Buy yourself the $10 collapsible Cooler and the 12 pack of medalla light cans for $9.99. There is an ice bucket and ice on the room floor. Eat at Mi Casita in the Ponderosa/Burger King Parking lot a block down across from Interconntinental. Or Metropol in the opposite direction a block down. Affordable, authentic, and delicious. It's just really ashame you have to put in time and work just to make it affordable. We gambled at the casino. Just the two of us were playing roulette. I played black and a number. My number hit and it was black. The dealer paid me on my color but not my number. I brought it to her attention and she played like she was confused. She eventually paid me. That was my last hand. I dont know if she was day dreaming or just trying to scam me. I brought it to the casino manager's attention. Upon checkout, we asked for a cab for two to the airport. A van that seats 8 pulls up. Two women standing next to us over heard us saying we are going to the airport. They asked us to split the cab to save us all money. The cab driver and the man that calls the cabs over who works for the hotel informed us since we told him two they will have to charge $12 for each couple plus $1 each piece of Luggage. We did not agree. It was supposed to be $12 plus $1 each piece of luggage. We were told The cab drivers are all in line and the other driver has to take the other couple. They all work closely together scamming one at a time. Instead of accommodating us, which we would have left him a nice tip they told us no after our luggage was in the van. The driver wanted his buddy in line to make the other $12. Even though Susan was very accommodating, unfortunately it takes more then one professional to clean that resort up. Next time we will be Checking out a resort closer to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Step It Up!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa B
Reviews.Content: The room was not clean, especially the bathroom. There was dust all over the place & some of the furniture had stains on it. Two of the lamps did not work. The one telephone in the room was not next to the bed which I found very inconvenient. The lobby was dark and outdated. Service at the pool area took forever. At the beginning of my stay, I called the front desk to find out if they had a larger room I could move to. I made it clear that I wasn't looking for a free upgrade, but that I would actually pay for the larger room. The person I spoke to said she would have to get back to me. However, she never did.On a positive note, the ground floor of the hotel had a galleria with great stores. It also had a Starbucks. The pool area looked beautiful in the evening and had great lighting. One of the hotel restaurants Koco was outstanding. The casino was a lot of fun and had a friendly staff.In light of the overall cost of my hotel stay, I expected much better quality & service. They need to step up their game.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: KKeehn
Reviews.Content: This hotel's lobby is very impressive with it's dark wood accents to the number of shops for the guests. Our room was clean, modern, roomy and attractive. The pool area is beautiful and the access to the beach is an inviting walking around the pool or through the archway path. The one negative point I have with my room is the bathroom door. The space was so tight that you had to be completely in the bathroom to shut the door. Space was very limited. Like most resorts, the beverages and food was a little high priced. Location is great and the beach is fantastic. If you want to venture out of the hotel to dine you can find many different eateries like Chiles within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “if you are going to PR.. this is as good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: Liana132
Reviews.Content: The resort was very nice, and huge with many restaurants on sight and Brava, the night club. I must say, i was not disapointed by the food...and YES! they do make a great steak at the Palm, which is no different from what we get in New York. Overall, awesome place to stay. We stayed at the Casitas room, which was nice with a large shower and the pool only steps away. You get a lot of the local crowd at Brava where we met great people. Generally, everyone is pretty friendly.. the staff is so so depending on the day. Obviously, if you are used to staying at the top of the line hotels, this might be just a little bit of a disapointment, but for PR, this is probably as best as it gets!

Reviews.Title: “I love this Place”
Reviews.Author: JakeB7555
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why there are so many haters out there, but for someone who is 21-35 and likes to have fun, this place is amazing. All of the beach and pool rental stuff is free (football, frisbee, goggles, etc) The club is the best in San Juan. All of the staff is so nice and helpful. True, drinks are expensive, but...you're in a tropical paradise, deal with it. Or go to the local grocery store and stock up on your own supply. I've been the last 2 years and I'm about to book a 3rd trip in the next few days. This place is the bomb. Especially on the weekends. I would never stay anywhere else. Period. Go El San Juan!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet my lowest expectations”
Reviews.Author: Alexandrakames
Reviews.Content: We didn't have very high expectations, but this resort was still a huge disappointment. First of all, it's a $20 cab ride from Old San Juan and there's nothing nearby except for other expensive hotels, so you're stuck paying their astronomically high prices for everything, food, drinks, entertainment, etc. No matter how high you think the prices may be, triple them. There are a couple of chain restaurants in the hotel, the prices at the El San Juan are twice as high as the Manhattan locations. Second of all, the service is terrible. When we first arrived the wi-fi was broken. I went to the front desk and they said it must be my computer because no other guests were having trouble with the internet. I pushed back politely because my computer hadn't had a problem connecting to any other networks that day. They finally gave me a number to call the AT&T wi-fi helpline where I spoke to a nice guy who said the internet at this resort had been down for days. Nice. On the second day the OnDemand service wasn't working so I went to the front desk again. They agreed that yes, it was broken but had no idea when it would be fixed and didn't seem the least bit concerned that a service that was advertised when we booked the trip was no longer available. Finally, for a resort that advertises itself as a beach resort, the beach was filthy. Really, really filthy. Broken bottles, old plastic bags and rotting seaweed. I wouldn't come back here if you paid me. The only reason I gave them a "poor" rating instead of "terrible" is because the staff at the beach and the pool bars really tries hard. They are under staffed, but generally friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Have realistic expectations”
Reviews.Author: lawldy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the HIlton chain, so I expected it to be nice and well maintained which it was. It's not the nicest Hilton I've ever stayed at, but it was nice. The rooms have been updated. The good: Our room was a good size room with 2 queen beds and a sitting area with couches and a table and chairs. It was plenty of room for the 3 of us sharing the room. The beds are comfortable. The shower head has been updated, so the water pressure is great. The room service was excellent. They came by multiple times per day to replace towels, clean the room, refill the mini bar, turn down the beds, etc. Our room was kept nice and clean. The bad: The tile on the shower floor looked dated. The bathroom is rather small. There's very little counter space near the sink because it's a pedestal sink. There's only one outlet near the mirror/tv, and it was overloaded with stuff plugged into it. Every time I wanted to plug something in, I had to half crawl under the table and plug it into the electrical strip. The fridgerator keeps items cool but not cold (but that's the norm outside the states). Regarding the reviews about overpriced food and drinks, in my experience, the food and drinks at hotels are always expensive. San Juan is a tourist spot, so a lot of restaurants are high priced. However, there's tons of fast food within walking distance - Burger King, Wendy's, McDonald's, Taco Bell, etc. There's a grocery store a few blocks away. There are some restaurants and bars within walking distance. Chili's is across the street. There's lots of restaurants that are a $10 to $15 cabfare away. Regarding the beach, it's pretty nice but not as nice as some beaches I've seen in Aruba and some parts of Mexico. The sand was soft, and the water was pretty, but there is a good amount of seaweed on the waters edge and the first several feet into the water. You can walk at least a mile down the beach. There's mostly condos and other hotels along that walk. However, there is a couple bars/restaurants. We had no problem getting lounge chairs on the beach. If you want an umbrella, they charge $10 per day for that. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful and well maintained. The concierge gave us great advice on restaurants and were happy to assist us with all of our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Below Par on every scale, stay at the Ritz Carlton in PR”
Reviews.Author: klhnewyork
Reviews.Content: I am an avid traveler with above average tastes. My boyfriend and I stayed at the El San Juan this time in Puerto Rico. We had to be asked to be moved three times. We paid for a room with a garden or pool view. Our first room was underground (don't stay on the third floor of the main building, it's below ground), our second room was next to the elevator and you had to stand behind the toilet to close the door. Our final room was fine, but no view that we paid for. The bathrooms were all dirty. The drinks are completely overpriced ($8 for a coors light, $12 plus for a cocktail). The breakfast buffet is $25 each for little selection and our seats were covered in bird droppings. We ended up spending more than if we would have just stayed at the Ritz Carlton b/c the food and drinks (which aren't great) were so expensive. They attract people with the casino and restaurants, but I would not recommend staying there. We had a problem with our bill when we left and the front desk was a pain. I would suggest staying at the Ritz if you want to be in San Juan. I think some of the prior reviews were written by the hotel and not actual guests. I hope this has been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Think of what you will bring for spending money, now triple that.”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreGirl123
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here in December 2011. The room was clean with a nice view of the pools and beach. Lobby is beautiful. Grounds are beautiful. Drinks are way overpriced. Takes the joy down a notch. I've been to a few overpriced restaurants and hotels before, but this place really does take it to the extreme. The man out in front told us he will have our bags ready in our room when its time to check in. The woman at the desk said the same. Meaning the luggage will be in the room when we open the door. So we tipped the man that took the luggage, since we figured hey the bags will be in the room. They weren't. We called. And when a man brought them up, he informed us that they are NEVER waiting for you in the room. So we had to tip him too. Annoyed me, still annoys me, because on top of everything these tips add up. Unfortunately, money does not grow on trees, but if it did, I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: NycAshley_28
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Puerto Rico and I was excited to stay in what I was told "the best hotel in San Juan"- and that assessment was completely inaccurate!! The staff at this hotel is not only incompetent but rude, unhelpful, and had the keen ability to ruin EVERY single day of my four day stay. Negatives: -The concierge told us to go to a restaurant at 9:00 pm that was a 30 minute cab drive away on a night that the restaurant kitchen was closed at 9:15. Essentially wasting our night out, our ability to enjoy the entertainment in the hotel lobby, and causing us to rush down dinner at one of their restaurants at a late hour when no one was in the restaurant and the restaurant was about to close. The concierge was neither apologetic nor helpful and was quite unprofessional. -In an attempt to e-mail Yvonne (manager) one week prior to the trip to book a tour for the Bioluminenscent Bay, we recieved no answer. On Day 1 of our trip we went to the tour guide desk to book the tour ourselves. She called one tour company who was booked and potentially had 4 spots available we would just have to wait for a phone call later in the evening to confirm that those spots opened up. This tour desk attendent never called us back. The following morning, all of the spots were booked. -Upon adressing these issues with the manager (Victor) he assured us he booked us a private tour for us (2 guests) the following day for the Bio Bay. We waited in the lobby for over an hour for our tour guide to arrive! We had the front desk call our tour guide and he was completely unaware that he was giving us a tour because the hotel had never confirmed the tour. It also turned out that he was just our driver-and as per the hotel's request he, the driver, was to "keep quiet" about the fact that they never really booked us a tour and that upon arriving to the Bio Bay after an hour drive he was to ask around to see if their were any spots available. If there weren't, we had just wasted a 2 1/2 hour trip in the car for nothing and would have to return the hotel experience-less. On our trip to the Bio Bay I called Victor to ask him if we indeed had a tour book. He played dumb, and when I told him that our driver told us that we did not have a tour he stated "why did he tell you that, he wasn't suppsed to." We ended up having to wait another 2 hours for a 8:30pm tour when originally we were supposed to have gotten a 5:30 tour (although the staff and managers LIED about ever booking a tour). We were forced to have yet another rushed 30 minute dinner by the bio bay. -Rooms are outdated and NOT clean. -Never once was approached by hotel staff by the pool or beach for a drink or something to eat -Pool side food is overpriced and lackluster in quality. Although my comments are harsh, they are 100%true and I wish my trip and stay here upon no one, not even my worst enemy. The managers lied repeatedly to our face and refused to accomodate us or acknowledge how wrong they were in every aspect of our treatment. I hope that this will steer some of you away from staying here and may save some of you a lot of money and anger in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Mold, Mildew, and Mismanagement--probably the worst Hilton in the US.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeard
Reviews.Content: If there is a worse hotel for the money in this hemisphere, I am not aware of it. Sadly, it would appear from my recent stay that all the negative reviews here on TripAdvisor are accurate. After I booked a junior suite at this hotel, I read the reviews, and to allay my concerns, I contacted Susan Wilkerson who is noted in a few of these comments. (For the record, I think it is odd that you have to petition a luxury hotel ahead of time to ensure you will have a satisfactory experience--but if thatâ€™s what it takes.. . .) To her credit, she sent back an e-mail a few days before my arrival, assuring me sheâ€™d look after me--and told me sheâ€™d get back to me on a few of my questions posed in my note. Not sure she ever followed up with anyone else at the hotel--my question didnâ€™t get answered, and goodness knows, my stay didnâ€™t go well. Several of these reviews mention that the lobby on weekends becomes quite a hot spot. Depending upon your viewpoint, this is either great or awful. In my case, it was so loud when I checked in, I had to shout so the front desk agent (once I found her--no one was apparent behind the front desk when I arrived) could hear me. The check-in was not great. I guess I might have anticipated a better welcome since I am a HHonors Gold member. Had to ask the agent about breakfast arrangements and internet--which are key elements of the benefits a Gold member receives. Made my way to room 827, and was surprised to find that the junior suite Iâ€™d reserved wasnâ€™t what I saw when I opened the door. 827 was a standard guest room, not a suite. So I called down to the front desk, and the phone rang and rang. Second try, I finally reached the agent whoâ€™d checked me in. Explained to her that Iâ€™d reserved a junior suite, and this did not appear to be a junior suite. Her response was that Iâ€™d actually been â€œupgradedâ€�--that this was a grande vista room and was better than the junior suite Iâ€™d reserved. How a room that is 250 square feet smaller and goes for a lower rate constitutes an upgrade is beyond me, incidentally. When I pressed further, the agent told me that the junior suite wasnâ€™t very nice anyway, as it overlooked air conditioning units, and not much else. This room did have a partial ocean view, for sure, but there isnâ€™t even a walk out balcony. . .just a Juliet ledge. Finally, the agent told me that there wasnâ€™t anything she could do anyway, since they were full. As I was at the hotel for two nights, I had no desire to move rooms the next day, only to check out the day after. So much for my contacting Susan Wilkerson beforehand to ensure my stay would go smoothly. Even had I reserved this category of room, the poor housekeeping and deferred maintenance issues in 827 underscore how distant from a luxury hotel todayâ€™s El San Juan has become. The decor indicates a recent renovation, but the condition of the room reflects neglect and insufficient housekeeping. The shower glass was dirty, the shower ceiling was speckled with black mold, and the toilet had brown stains that indicated it was not cleaned properly. The walls of the bedroom are marred, the metal legs of the desk were rusty, there were stains on the desk and on the floor. The hotel compendium had no hotel information in it, but rather was just a baffling collection of advertisements. The stationery is left over from when this hotel attempted to be a Waldorf-Astoria. (That would have Mr. Astor twirling in his grave, this hotel in its current state.) On the positive side, the bed is very comfortable and the shower pressure is good. Few rooms in this hotel, despite the beachside setting, have views of the ocean--and this one did. (If you require great ocean views to go along with high room rates, this is not the resort for you--there are no rooms above the 9th floor, and given the trees, etc., rooms below floor 7 likely have little water view). A continental breakfast is a key benefit of being an HHonors Gold member, and La Terraza is the indoor/outdoor buffet restaurant for guests. I went down for breakfast and was told that owing to groups, no tables were available outside and there would be a 20 minute wait. So I left, and walked around the outside of the restaurant, where there were 7 tables available. . .I went back into the restaurant, and asked to be seated outside given the number of tables that were there empty. Given that individual guests only have one choice for breakfast--it is doubtful that accommodating a group of 20 for breakfast at the only restaurant is a great strategy. It certainly isnâ€™t guest-friendly. The buffet is standard Hilton breakfast--$25 per person, and $10 as an upgrade from the continental certificate Gold members receive. While capable, the breakfast could be anywhere. . .little if anything marked it as uniquely Puerto Rican. If I wanted to eat breakfast inside, I would have stayed up north. But given Saturday morningâ€™s fiasco, it will likely not surprise to learn that on Sunday morning, was told, yet again, that I couldnâ€™t sit outside, because there was a group. My reaction was less stoic than the previous dayâ€™s. . .and I stood my ground and told the hostess that I planned to get a table outside to enjoy my breakfast. The manager overheard, stepped in, found me a cup of coffee, and ultimately, I got seated outside. Such hassles, two days in a row, are uncalled for in a hotel where the going rate is nearly $400 a night and breakfast is $25 a person. The mismanagement obvious in the rooms area extends to food and beverage as well. The pool area is gorgeous, though the hotel needs to institute measures to enable all guests to have access to pool and beach chairs. While it is not unique to this hotel that guests feel the need to save large blocks of chairs first thing in the morning--El San Juan should institute a 45 minute saved time limit as some other resorts have in place. While the pool deck is large and lush, there appears to be few staff dedicated to serving guests. It should be noted that such poor service and worse upkeep doesnâ€™t come cheap. My guest room retailed for $390 a night (I used HHonors points) and to add insult to injury, there is a 14% â€œresort chargeâ€� added to hotel bills. What does this include? Access to the fitness center, daily lounge entertainment, and daily pool activities. Yes, a $55 additional charge per day doesnâ€™t even include internet access. Ouch. El San Juan has a few great attributes--the hotel is just 10 minutes from the airport, and it stands on 14 acres of the best beach in San Juan. Otherwise the location is out of the way for Condado or Old San Juan, a $15 or $20 cab ride respectively each way. (The public bus is just 75 cents, but if you choose to take the bus, prepare to wait as the schedules are erratic). All in all, I canâ€™t recommend a hotel that so lacks an attention to hospitality details, and charges you exorbitantly for such mediocrity. In fairness, the manager on duty and I discussed all these issues, and the hotel has invited me back for a return stay. Still, a hotel should get things right from the beginning, rather than have to make up for gross inadequacies. There have to be better places, for less money, in San Juan. As if all of this werenâ€™t enough, management at the hotel agreed to furnish a two-night stay as a result of the shortcomings I have outlined here. Remarkably, it took me a month and a half to receive the certificate from the hotel, only after I followed up with the hotelâ€™s executive office--and even so, it took the hotel a whole week to answer my subsequent e-mail. The experience was bad, and the recovery attempt was tepid and slow--only serving to depress my already low opinion of this terribly managed, poorly maintained hotel. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and Tanned”
Reviews.Author: DSA2AS
Reviews.Content: My stay at the El San Juan was very pleasant. The staff was polite, friendly and helpful whenever needed. The beach was nice and the water clean,except for some seeweed, but that's not the Hotel's fault. The rooms were large, clean and beachy. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. We had a patio, but no view, we didn't pay for one so I didn't expect it. We arrived very early and the room wasn't ready, but the hotel held our luggage and we hit the pool/beach(most hotels have a 3 PM check in) . The Hotel lobby is large and has 3 bars, a lot going on on the weekends, starting Friday night. Very Lively! The Disco "Brava" is the place to be if you like to dance and have a good time. You can hear the thumping of the base in your rooms if you are on the lower floors, but I had the TV on and was so tired from my daily activiites it didn't really bother me. The restaurants are pricey, but very good. The pool is clean and enough room for eveyone,but you need to get your pool beach chairs early or you'll wind up at the beach. Not such a bad thing since it's a tropical Island! The swim up bar and beach bar drinks adverage about $10-$12, but that's what they cost in NY anyway. The local beer(Medalla) is 8 in a bucket for $32) Took a cab ride to Old San Juan twice, visited the Fort, walked around and visited many shops and had dinner at 2 great restaurants, Al Dente (Italian) and the Dragonfly(Latin Asian). The cab drivers were very polite and a shout out to Hery the concerige who calls the cabs. A really nice guy. There is a grocery store down the block called "Pueblo" and a Walgreens a few blocks away if you need drinks or snacks for the room. There is a Chili's accross the street and 3 nice local places called Lupis(mexican/Latin) Don Juan(Latin/American) and Piu Bella(lunch, breakfast, great Gelato!) Also a Wendy's, Subway and a Chruch's Fried Chicken a few blocks away if you something cheaper to eat. Hotel Had an adaquate Casino, if you like to gamble and several nice shops and two jewelry stores. Jet ski's on the beach was $75 for 1/2 hour. A lot of fun !! Took a snorkling tour with Castillo Catamaran. The staff was friendly and fun. We snorkled at the beach and on a reef. Got lunch,afternoon fruit and cookies for the bus ride back to the hotel. Shout out to Frances she is a really nice lady and funny(ask about Castillo at the tour desk). I would definitly come back to PR, loved it !! Just relax and have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1y
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two periods of three nights at either end of a trip in March. Having read the negative reviews about the refurbished rooms, we requested Lanai rooms. Ons the first trip we got a garden lanai on the second floor overlooking the pool, and on the return visit we specifically requested a casita as they are ground floor and lead directly onto the pool area. It was obvious that the very pleasant girl at the check in desk did not want to give us a casita - I am a Hilton Honors Gold member and she whispered to me: 'but that's a downgrade!'. Both rooms were tired and could do with re-decorating - particularly the casita -but the beds were comfy, the showers were great, the TV was flat screen and the aircon was powerful. We were perfectly happy with our choice. You may want to know that there are no safes or fridges in the casitas. The pool areas are fabulous with the most comfortable, deeply padded sun loungers I have ever come across. You can help yourself to free chilled water at the pool which is a nice touch. The formal restaurants are very expensive, but as mentioned in a previous review do go to the happy hours at the Palms restaurant between 5 and 7pm where small plates are served at the bar for the bargain price of $5.50 each. Just two of these would make a generous dinner for most people. There is a reasonably priced Pizza restaurant in the hotel and if all else fails, there is a selection of more moderately priced outlets within easy walking distance of the hotel, including a Chilli's directly opposite. The casino has a good selection of slots and table games and together with the lobby bars made for a great night out which is obviously popular with more than just residents. One slight negative was that we didn't realise until our last night that drinks were complimentary in the casino - the waitresses were that difficult to spot! Overall we loved this hotel, we visited four Hilton group hotels in PR on this trip, and this one was by far our favourite.

Reviews.Title: “El San Juan Resort and Casino”
Reviews.Author: SusanB28_12
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly staff, and great location. Pools and beach are beautiful...will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “2nd time at El San Juan Hotel - BEST place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tara G
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I absolutely LOVE El San Juan Hotel & Casino. The pool during the day pulls a good crowd, the rooms are very nice, the restaurants are great and you cannot beat the lobby or club Brava. Two reasons alone to stay at this resort, but there are so many other great ammenities, there is just no where else you would want to stay. Fitness Center, although windowless, had decen

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Long Island, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times in a year and we love it.We like to stay in the Garden Villas a little more private and closer to the beach and the pool. The pools are gorgeous , the landscaping is fantastic , the service is unbelievable (great) the restaurants are great as are the shops . They have a great breakfast buffet and the pools have many comfortable chairs (even when they are filled to capacity)There is alot of places to sun yourself and a lot of shade for people who want to stay out of the sun. The location is perfect ,5 minutes from the airport, near Walgreens, near other restaurants ,near the supermarket, near taxis and buses, close to Old San Juan by taxi or bus and Condado Beach by taxi or bus.The rooms arent brand new but on vacation we are only in it to sleep and it was fine for that. Im looking for beautiful scenery, easy access to the beach and great service and on this I give it a 10.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL VACATION!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tippy M
Reviews.Content: WoW!! where should I began?? let's start off with saying after booking our vacation we emailed Ms. Wilkerson to ask for a few accommodations without any hesitation she connected us with our AWESOME concierge MS KAMIL!! (we love her!) Ms. Kamil Made sure we had a great vacation! The entire staff from the door men to the housekeepers have 5 star customer service their attitudes are GREAT they kept smiles on their faces and were eager to make us as comfortable as possible! We stayed Feb-13 through Feb-17. We planned this vacation for my fiance's birthday, as a surprise to him I wanted a cake made in Puerto Rico and delivered to our room. I was unable to speak spanish so Ms Kamil took care of all the arrangements for me!! The cake was BEAUTIFUL,He really enjoyed it, thanks so much MS KAMIL and Angie's Creation & More! The Resort is Wonderful from the lobby to the swim up bar, our room was quiet, clean & comfortable with a beautiful view of the beach and resort. We took a day trip to old San Juan via bus($.75), and checked out some of the other restaurants outside of the resort. although there were a couple of showers the weather was georgeous.. WE REALLY ENJOYED OURSELVES. we're already making plans to return with our family and friends!!

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: shari r
Reviews.Content: We are just ending a 5 day excursion to PR with our four kids - 13, 16, 19, 21. with the exception of the lobby, the hotel is pretty run down and our rooms had peeling paint and beds that definitely need new mattresses. The staff was pretty helpful, and having a Starbucks in the lobby was a huge plus for us coffee addicts. Its frustrating to come to a hotel that charges for just about everything...even a beach umbrella for the day! Food by the pool was better than expected, but you are definitely paying a premium. Overall I would say - if you can stay outside of San Juan you're much better off. Nicer beaches for sure...and perhaps more to do with older kids. We would not come back to this hotel..or this part of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: 371Cynthia371
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was nice and attractive. Drinks very over priced. We ended up walking to a grocery store up the street and bought liquor and snacks. Had lunch near pool upon arrival due to room not ready even thought we were promised early check in, bill was $90 for 4. That took care of our $100 hotel credit for booking 4 nights. Bathroom in room had mold in shower. Woke up every morning to construction workers drilling at 9 am. Hotel did credit us $100 for the inconvience, we would have rather slept more! Intranet was $14.95 per day, when i thought i read it was free when i booked the room, hotel mamager said only for gold hilton honors members ended up getting free wifi at chili's across the street. . The hotel personnel will gladly help you with touring the area but will cost u $$$$$ .offered tour to Bacardi factory for $60 per person, we ended up taking a taxi to peir 2 then .50 cent ferry ride then taxi that was $1.00 per person, then Bacardi factory was FREE. Total cost around $20 for the 4 of us. We rented a car and drove to rainforest and shopping mall. Beach was beautiful, great restaraunt up the street called mi casita great mofongo. Conveniently located close to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great time- perfect weather”
Reviews.Author: bbreak
Reviews.Content: We â€“ 2 families totaling 10 people- stayed at the El San Juan for 8 nights during Presidents Week (Feb 2012). To begin, we had basically perfect weather. Maybe a drizzle and a few hours of clouds over 8 days. Overall, we had a great time. Positives: -The hotel is literally 4 minutes from the airport and if you are coming from a U.S. city, there is obviously no immigration. So, land, get your bags, get in a cab and youâ€™re in the hotel in no time. -Check in was excellent- very efficient. No lines and had our rooms ready in 1 hour, despite the fact we arrived well before official check-in. Everybody speaks English, but they also enjoy speaking Spanish w/ Americans who like to. -While hotel has been around for a while, it is still very nice. Lobby area is great (especially at night) w/ great pools and easy walking to the beach. The beach and water are pretty nice, but not as nice as some other Caribbean destinations. There was a lot of seaweed in the water and it often would end up on the edge of the beach. -The beach attendants are very helpful in getting lounge chairs set up. We gave a tip each time. -The Rooms are fine. Good size and beds are comfortable. Bathrooms are not anything special. Theyâ€™re small and showers are small and have not been renovated in a while. -Service was overall excellent. Room cleaning excellent. Great that you can get food/drink service on the beach and at the pool. Food at the pool/beach is reasonably priced, but drinks are expensive. -Lots of water activities available for extra charge right on the beach (jet ski, banana boats, parasailing, etc.) -There are a few places in walking distance from the hotel to check out. For lunch, dinner and ice cream/dessert. The Metropol restaurant a block away (towards the East) was good and reasonable. Also, an excellent find was a Pizza place (I think called Pizza city)- about Â½ mile walk on Isla Verde Blvd west of the hotel. Best NY pizza Iâ€™ve had outside of NY. Go buy a pie or 2 and bring it back to the hotel for lunch. -There are a number of WalGreens and SuperMarkets very close by. Iâ€™d suggest buying various snacks, drinks and chips to bring onto the beach/pool during the day. -Old San Juan and Condado beach area are just a cab away and have good restaurants. Negatives: -As noted, the rooms and especially the bathrooms are just OK. -Restaurants in the hotel are very good, but expensive, as are drinks at the pool and hotel. Breakfast buffet is not worth it. Get something at Starbucks or even outside at one of the places on Isla Verde Blvd. -While we and our kids had a great time, there isnâ€™t any organized activities for kids. No beach or pool soccer, volleyball, etc. -The gym is OK. -Also, as noted, the beach is fine, but nothing special compared to much of the Caribbean. -When leaving at the airport you need to go through an Agriculture check of your bags. The lines can be extremely long for this, the bag check in and security, especially on days that Cruise Ships are ending their weeks in San Juan. Be prepared for long lines and ask for a porter to expedite things (and should tip them). -Rainforest tour. We booked and paid for a Â½ day rainforest tour through the hotel/trip people at the hotel. It was fairly expense, it was a fairly long/bumpy drive and we only stopped at 3 spots. Iâ€™d recommend renting your own car, get directions and do the trip on your own. I donâ€™t think it costs anything to enter the park (El Yunque).

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the El San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: Donna L
Reviews.Content: My husband, 16 y.o. daughter, and I just got back from a 5 nigh stay at the El San Juan Hotel. We had a fantastic stay there! When we booked our trip, we had carefully read the reviews and were not sure what to believe, so we contacted Susan Wilkerson to explain that I was recovering from spinal surgery and needed to be in a room that was away from the noise. Susan was fantastic throughout our trip, going above and beyond to ensure that we were comfortable and that our needs were met!! She even had a cheese platter and drinks sent tour room, but she went out of her way to be helpful, beyond that, even when we had assured her that everything was perfect! Kudos, Susan! While were there, my husband and I were reading some of the reviews and virtually pulling our hair out about them! Our reaction was: "Huh? Is this a competitor hotel writing?" Our room was perfect! It was pretty, large, clean (always!) and quiet, and it had a balcony/patio area (we were on third floor of the main tower), with a partial ocean view. The beds were really comfortable and I loved the ceiling fan, which along with the ample air-conditioning (a rarity in my experinece!), lulled me to sleep whenever I sank into bed.
