Our bathroom wasn't tiny as some others have experienced, it was fine, and there was always hot water. In terms of the maid service, I'd have to say that WE were the rude ones, b/c we frequently did not leave the room until after 4:00 PM; but, when we would see a maid in the hallway to then ask for towels, etc., they'd insist that they'd happily clean the room for us. This happened several times. Everyone has already remarked on the beauty of the grounds and pools/beach and I echo that sentiment. The pools were crystal clean, the beach was beautiful (and, by the way, it's public, so I was impressed by how clean it was for a public beach!), and the pool boys and servers were very helpful and friendly. How can people say that everything is overpriced at this hotel? The swim-up pool menu prices were: $13 for a burger, $11 for sandwiches, etc. We've stayed at resorts all around the Carribean and in Europe and we've never seen prices this low! Granted, drinks are expensive, but they are always expensive at resorts and you can buy liquor outside the hotel and drink on the beach, so that's an advantage in my mind to what I've been able to do on other resort vacations that were not all inclusive. I am really surprised that there are comments that are no other places to go except for the resort. This is simply not true. There are a myriad of options just next door to the hotel! For fine dining, check out the Intercontinetal next door if you are not happy with the many fine restaurants in the hotel (this is just one example); if you want to pass on the breakfast buffet, you can find extremely inexpensive options across the street from the hotel, next door to the hotel, etc.! There are a variety of restaurants on the strip just outside the hotel, so check them out! There is also a Walgreen's next door to the hotel -- a tremendous convenience. Now, I found these places with a spinal cord injury, so I'm sure you can find them if you just leave the resort! We also loved the verve of the hotel. We are in our 50's, so the club scene was not for us, but the lobby was magical at night, with salsa dancing and other types of music....electrifying even if you are just passing through. I can honestly say that we did not have a single problem during our stay, enjoying every moment of it! Everything was perfect! I would highly recommend the El San Juan and I'm not young :), so that's a high recommendation!! Thanks for everything, Susan! Donna L.

Reviews.Title: “Protect Your Wallet...From El San Juan”
Reviews.Author: T. Maria
Reviews.Content: Positives: Gorgeous lobby, beautiful pools and grounds with good poolside service and we had a large, updated room. The property itself was great. I generally had an enjoyable time here. Negatives: You are trapped here and at the mercy of the hotel's prices. There are very few good restaurants around the hotel or places to have a drink. Of course, it is a resort so resort prices are to be expected. But El San Juan takes it to the next level. We ate breakfast here both days and opted for the cheaper continental breakfast. The problem? If you grab a larger plate from the hot buffet immediately next to the continental breakfast (rather the saucer - I am not exaggerating - that they provide for the continental breakfast), you have opted for the more expensive buffet. Also, items from the more expensive buffet are intermixed with the continental buffet, and you must rely on the hostess to explain to you what those items are, or - you guessed it - you have elected to pay for the more expensive buffet. This is an ongoing problem, as we were warned from wiser guests ... but we still were tripped up. The manager, Diana, refused to take off the charge. Instead, she was immediately hostile and implied that we had intended to conceal our "theft." In the end, it isn't about the upcharge, but the generally feeling that the hotel is trying to drain as much money out of you in as many different ways as possible. Another issue - the rooms are not the cleanest. Surfaces had dust and dirt in the corners. The vinyl shower curtain had mildew on it. My suggestion - stay in Condado where the hotels have to compete with the other fine dining available in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon K
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Puerto Rico and this resort came highly recommended from a friend of a friend. The resort looked beautiful, the lobby and the lobby bars and restaurants were all beautiful, the pool area was also great but needed a little TLC. It was not cheap to stay here and for what we payed the room should have been nicer, none of the rooms in the main building have balconies, which when we booked i was reassured several times that our room would have a balcony, well none of them do, so that was dissapointing. Also, although they claim the rooms have been recently remodeled, at a closer look they are dirty and in need of some care, I actually wore my flip flops in the shower i was so disguted by it. The walls are paper thin and i am not exagerating at all! We heard the couple in the room next to us arrive back at there room at 4am and we got to listen to them have sex, then at 8 in the moring we heard nose blowing, throat clearing and coughing, and we could also here every word they said to eachother, it was like they were in out room! Also, the fitness center was right above us so the treadmills woke us up at 6:30 every moring! We complained twice with no results. The first time i complained about the lack of balcony, when i as assured before i booked it that our room would have a balcony, I told them i wanted an Ocean Lanai room, they are seperate from the main building and actually do have balconies, but i was told that they were all full but they would contact us when someone checked out. Nobody ever contacted us. I also infomed them about the nasty bathroom, they sent housekeeping up but they really needed to sent up a contractor to remodel that tiny nasty bathroom! What a dissapointment. Also, the food and drinks were very expensive on the resort, $7 for a bottle of water, $25 per person for continental breakfast, what a joke! $60 for lunch at the pool, $25 for two drinks, unacceptable! The pizza place was awesome and reasonably priced! we walked to many different reasaurants off of the resort for breakfast and dinner everyday and the food was outstanding and affordable! We also found a man on the beach making hot dogs and hamburgers and kabobs, which were great! We would definitely retunt to puerto rico but we would not stay at the El San Juan again, we were very dissapointed with the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: jenn b
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 3 times at this Hotel, and have recommended it as well. It is one of the few hotels (maybe the only one) that offers so many amenities. The rooms are "chic" but no balcony's and a $300 fine for opening the window and smoking. The walls are very thin and noise is an issue. AVOID anything over (or even 4 floors up) from the nightclub in the Hotel. We made that mistake once, and heard the bass until the club closed at 4am :( Not bad if you're AT the club until 4, but that night, we went to bed early...or tried to! If you want to sit in the pool cabanas, it's easy to get one. If you want the more coveted "swim deck" by swim up bar, get there early! It's a bit more of a party and social scene, which we found fun! No umbrellas for shade in this area. Wouldn't recommend sitting there with kids, toddlers...you'll just make those who want to drink, be loud, and have fun all day...annoyed. There's better, shady, shallow pool areas for kids anyway :) If you prefer the beach, access is easy, chairs are available (first come first served), and you can usually flag down a server for drinks! Again, I haven't found another Hotel with these amenities. Restaurants are good. There's a starbucks and shopping too. Lobby has bands some nights, and people gather, dance, and drink at the main bar. There's a smoking room (VERY smoky), Casino, parking...and 10-15 mins from the airport; a 15-20 min reasonable cab ride to Old San Juan (great restaurants!), and a 10 min ride to the luxury shopping and restaurants in Condado. The room rates are a bit high, but again, they offer a lot....and know it!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Resort”
Reviews.Author: nancy b
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived on a Sunday. The resort was on the quiet side but started to become more active at end of week. We took bus for 75 cents to Old San Juan during daylight without problem and took walk to Fort El Morro. It was a good but enjoyable walk. My husband insisted on bus back but as it got dark it seemed along way back and hard to see..would recommend cab at night. We spent good amount of time at pool. We were able to get lounges the days we were outside and staff helped us move to shade. Careful as lots of people send someone out early to claim chairs. If you have trouble ask staff for help and be prepared to tip. The staff were all very friendly and seemed really happy and proud of resort. We took a day trip to rain forest and it was pretty good..hiked into waterfall. When you hike you walk on wet concrete walks so make sure you wear sneakers or hiking boots. I did slip once but was ok. Waterfall area has alot of rocks wish I had brought water shoes but did make it into waterfall. If you walk out front of resort and go left you will come to Platos restaurant. They had incrdible white sangria,paella,a nd a salad with passionfruit vinigarette that was just delicious. All in all my husband and I had a blast and enjoyed resort. Manager Susan Wilkerson took care of all my pretrip questions quickly and professionally.

Reviews.Title: “Great FUN!”
Reviews.Author: llej14
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in the past and it was a great time. Although when I first got there this visit I was put in a room that was not in the main tower that was not much light and much older. The hotel gladly switched our room right away and it was a great experience. The pool is great and the lounge chairs very comfortable. Also the ocean is nice and clean. The drinks and food are a little pricey in the hotel so i would suggest going to the super market or Walgreens to stock up on water and alcohol and snacks. There are a bunch of restaurants in the hotel. I ate at the palm which was great and the hibachi place which was also very good. I also took a taxi to old San Juan and had a night out where i walked around and ate dinner there. There is plenty to do at the hotel if you do not want to leave. There is a casino always live music in the lobby on the weekends and two outside bars as well as a dance club that was very fun on Friday to Saturday night with much cheaper drinks inside then in the lobby bar. It was a great girls weekend trip and I thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Will be back

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel and facilities”
Reviews.Author: MindyMo
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 4 night stay in this hotel in March. Lobby, pool and beach area are all gorgeous and well maintained. Stayed in a garden room behind the pool on the 3rd (top) floor. Room was spacious, with a large bath, double sink and separate bath/toilet area and a huge walk-in closet. Our room was in excellent condition and the high vaulted ceiling made the large room seem even larger. Nice sized balcony with breakfast table and two chairs. The service, however, while better than most of Puerto Rico, was still severely lacking. Coming from NYC, I expected a bit of "island time" mentality, but the bar, restaurant, and check-in staff took this to the extreme. The exception we found was in the in-hotel sushi bar, where we received excellent, prompt service. That said, I would return to the El San Juan if in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to have a great time”
Reviews.Author: WJG-PR
Reviews.Content: Nice place to have a great time and enjoy with family and friends. Beach is great, restaurants are very good and night life is even better.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation made better”
Reviews.Author: gillurgi
Reviews.Content: We were at the esj hotel for few nights. The rooms could be cleaner but it wasnt bad. Pool is really nice and the beach beautiful. The casino was really cool on the weekend nights, the staff there was sweet, specially the bartender( alex ),which was very helpfull and mixed was great drinks, even tough his bar is in the back,but we were lucky to meet him outside by a crap table. I definily recommend the hotel and highlly the casino. Ask for Alex!

Reviews.Title: “About what expected - not awesome but just fine for needs ...”
Reviews.Author: Worldcitizen94
Reviews.Content: I came to the El San Juan because I just needed to get away and needed some sunshine. I looked all over the Carribean and the Eastern Coast of Mexico for destinations. I decided on Puerto Rico because its not to far and you don't have to deal with the hassle of passport control. Good thing I wasn't expecting a 5 star resort because the El San Juan certainly isn't up to that standard. That being said its just fine. Exactly what you would expect from a typical run-of-the-mill resort. Generic. Casino is fun. Not exclusive. Not bad. Just typical.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Brad G
Reviews.Content: A group of my closest friends decided to go to San Juan for a bachelor party and if you are considering Puerto Rico for a vacation I would highly recommend the El San Resort and Casino not only because it the most exciting place to be (both poolside and nightlife) but has a truly wonderful staff. Prior to visiting I contacted Yvonne Ramos, Concierge Manager, who not only made sure we would be able to check in a little early but without request decided to upgrade our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but I want to mention a few things....”
Reviews.Author: BEG1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the El San Juan Feb 24 - 28. My review may be a little long, but I wanted to break it down for those who are thinking of staying there and also give a few helpful tips. Check-in: Arrived at hotel at @ 1pm, our room wasn't ready, check-in is officially at 4 but we were lucky to get into our room at 3pm. I had emailed Susan Wilkerson (front desk mgr) a few times prior to arrival to see about removing down bedding (I'm allergic), a fridge for meds and to request a room higher up away from the noise. Susan was very accomodating with these requests and put us in room 825, which had a side ocean view. Pool bars: While waiting for our room, we went outside to the pool area and ordered a light beer and a rum drink. The cost was $20!!! The rum drink was in a small disposable cup, maybe 7 oz and the beer was a small 10 oz can. From what I heard from friends who have stayed in the area, that is the norm for the bigger hotels to charge that much. I also noticed they had special food stations w/mini kebobs etc but no prices on anything. Even some of the bar menus didn't have pricing on them, which brings me to my next point below, EVERYTHING gets charged to the room, they will not let you pay cash or credit, it all gets billed to your room. I do not like this practice and not all hotels in the area do this. Restaurants in hotel: We didn't eat in any of them, though they looked good. See my seperate reviews for Platos Resturant, BLT at the Ritz Carlton, La Playita, Ciao etc... Casino: Being we are not big gamblers we went to the casino once, it was very nice and crowded. I played the slot machine once. Lobby: It's a gorgeous lobby with bars, lounges, a nightclub (Brava), on Friday and Saturday nights, it was jumping with entertainment. It's definitely a hotspot for dancing and music. Pool area: Be ready to get up early and duke it out for chairs, they are usually gone by 7am. You have to get your towels from the towel stand or towel guys walking around and stake your claim. If you do not return the towels you will be charged $20. The pool has a few hot tubs which were very nice and cabana huts to rent (not sure the cost for rental). The pool area in general is very pretty with palm trees and other tropical foliage. Listening to the coquis at night was cool. Beach: There are young men wearing aqua/turquoise colored shirts who work for the hotel they will get you beach chairs and set them up for you for free (we would give them a tip) but if you want an umbrella, it will cost you $10. There was never a problem getting beach chairs. The weather was mid to high 80's and the beach area was very nice. The first day there was tons of seaweed in the water but by the 2nd day it was starting to subside. We spent most of our days at the beach, only spent one day at the pool. There a people on the beach who sell hotdogs for like $2, frozen coconuts $5, sodas and water for $1 and further up the beach past the Intercontinental hotel there was a woman who sold delicious empanadas on the beach for $2. There are also a few stands on the beach w/people selling jewelry, hats, souvenirs etc.. I bought a few jewelry items from Iris' stand, she was nice and her prices pretty reasonable, but please note there is no price haggling here. Tower Rooms: Our room was very nice, a good size and had a sitting area, there are no balconies in the tower rooms but you can open the door to look out. The room was super clean and the maid was great, sometimes coming in 2 times a day to give us more towels and to freshen up the room. The bathroom could've used more shelves to put your stuff, some re-grouting on the tile floor in shower, hotter water (I love HOT showers even in the summer, but it was only hot when you 1st jumped in, then would turn lukewarm) and the way the shower was configured, you had to stand in it in order to turn the water on. We heard none of the noise from the lobby in our room, but we had a room that had an adjoining door and the walls were a little thin, lucky for us our neighbors were pretty quiet, but at times could hear them playing music and watching tv. Casita or Garden Lanai rooms: These rooms are seperate from tower, the Lanais were 2 floors and caistas were 1 level. They were close to pool area, I looked at one that a maid was cleaning, they looked nice but I would imagine you would hear all the lobby noise and the pool areas have music and sometimes a DJ outside. The Galleria: It's a small shopping center adjacent to hotel, has a Starbucks, clothing boutiques, pizza, Japanese restaurant etc... Prices a little high but again that seems to be the norm for the area. Hotel Staff: Everyone was very friendly and helpful, from Susan Wilkerson, the doormen, security, the maid, the beach/pool area guys, and Ramon at the towel stand who I had nice morning chats with. Resort fees: I know most hotels charge this fee nowadays but with the amount of money you are spending to stay there, I think it's a little ridiculous. Some helpful hints: I packed a small lunch tote type cooler in my suitcase. Went to Walgreens that is a block or 2 away, puchased 12 pk of beer, wine, bottles of water and ice teas for only 25 dollars ( a whole lot cheaper than buying that stuff at the hotel). We would fill up the cooler with ice and take our beverages to the beach with us every morning. I had also packed in my carry on bag granola bars, breakfast bars, trail mixes to munch on. There's is also a supermarket called Pueblo that is across the street and behind the building that Chili's is in that had a very nice, large selection of wine and beer. It's also a good idea to pack some warm weather clothes in your carry-on bag this way if your room is not ready, you can change your clothes and go enjoy the the beautiful pool area and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great, but Good Enough!”
Reviews.Author: Don M
Reviews.Content: I read a ton of reviews for this hotel before booking our trip, but decided to give it a shot despite many negative reviews. First of all, my wife and I had a great time at this resort. We were looking for a relaxing week in the sun and that is exactly what we had. The pool area is awesome - very well kept and the waiters are very sweet and the food is fantastic! The beach is not as great, but it wasn't bad at all. It surprises me that people would complain about seaweed. Really? If you don't like seaweed, why not just stay away from the beach? I find that sometimes people just like to complain about any & everything. Honestly, the hotel overall was very good. We agree that the customer service was not spectacular, but it wasn't horrible either. Besides, we weren't expecting 5 star service at a 4 star hotel. For that matter, people should go to the Ritz right up the street. So, don't expect the staff to serve you like a king, but just know that you're on an island - where everyone is laid back as can be. And so it doesn't pay to act like a snob or be demanding. The food at Platos (few blocks up) was simply amazing. Metropol was just OK, and the Italian Cafe inside the hotel was really good. (Forgot the name). My favorite part of our stay at ESJ was getting a massage on the beach. Lisa (the masseuse) is very sweet and practically made me fall asleep. Awesome way to unwind by the water! Old San Juan is beautiful. Loved it! Vieques was gorgeous. Just don't take the ferry. Trust me. We flew back because the boat ride over was that horrible. Fly, fly, fly!

Reviews.Title: “Winter Break”
Reviews.Author: Karen D
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Puerto Rico we stayed in the El San Juan Resort & Casino, we had a wonderful time the staff was very nice and helpful, the rooms were nice. The pool area was very nice, but we were unable to get chairs, we were up and out of the room by 7:00 AM I suggest if you want a seat sleep on the chair or pay someone. The hotel is very expensive, I could not believe it when I ran into a family eating in the lobby, they had gone to the Walgreens and purchased Milk and cereal because they were disgusted that the hotel charged 25.00 per person for breakfast that's before tax. I would return to Puerto Rico but not sure I would go to this hotel, I would rather stay in the ESJ next door, I would save a ton of money and be able to sleep in on my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED”
Reviews.Author: catrina717
Reviews.Content: Here are the Pros and Cons of my stay for 6 nights - the best part about the trip was 85 degree weather - gorgeous - sunny everyday - the BAD part was the beach - the seaweed is TERRIBLE - if you walk down the beach a little past the Intercontinental Hotel the beach is GORGEOUS - but who wants to do that I got up each morning and got 4 lounge chairs on the beach - if u want cushions you have to get up at 6:30am - but heres a bit of advice - the staff PURPOSELY puts towels down on random beach chairs and pool chairs so that if you give them 10 dollars they miraculously find you a beach or pool chair I got there on a Sunday night and the lobby was popping - they had a DJ on Monday which was great but THATS IT - they have no live music near the pool - only on Saturday and Sunday - the drinks are 12 dollars each - ouch!!!! The Intercontinental Hotel has the Medittaranean Cafe - right on the beach - we ate there twice for lunch - Mi Casita right across the street from the Intercontinental was a great breakfast spot 30 dollars for 4 people The beds in the room were AWESOME very comfortable - the bathroom was HORRIBLE - TOO SMALL - the door couldnt even close - it needed a good grout job - no closet space in the room The breakfast is TOO EXPENSIVE 100 dollars for 4 people for the buffet - ABSURD Here are the Pros and Cons of Restaurants - prepare to spend 250 for 4 people - that is a botttle of wine 2 entrees and 4 appetizers - I really liked La Piccola - however the first night was great they sat us in a nice table and they give you bruschetta and chick peas (really good) before your dinner- our drinks came out on time - the veal milanese was awesome - so we decided to book another night there - well the second time we ate there we had to wait a LONG time for our drinks and bread - then when i asked the waiter about the bruschetta that we had the last time he told me that not every night is the same - and then my daughter said "mom, that table has the bruschetta" so then I complained to the waiter and told him that the other table had the bruschetta and then he brought it out to us - I was disappointed The restaurant KoKo - we had aan 8pm reservation and did not get our food until 9:30pm - food was great - service was HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE The Palm - what a joke - we ordered clams casino - it should have been called clam shell with a piece of bacon - the clams oreganata was TERRIBLE - oily greasy mess - the waitress gave us other appetizers that took 35 minutes to bring out - the steak however was very good The Japanese place was great - Yamato - my teenage daughters liked it I think I would only go back to the El San Juan from Thursday to Sunday

Reviews.Title: “First time in Puerto Rico...the good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: harjenmom
Reviews.Content: Like others, our room was not ready when my daughter and I arrived for our first ever girls' getaway over President's Week. I confirmed that we had a view of the pool and gardens on a high floor (my husband emailed with Susan Wilkerson prior to our arrival). We went to the lobby bathroom and changed (had I known about the Spa facilities on 10 we would have changed up there). Our room was ready at 2:30 pm, however it was not the view we had booked and then confirmed. We were on the 6th floor with a view of a disgusting roof of air-conditioning systems. I hadn't even brought our bags up, so I went down and complained immediately. Suffice it to say it took several emails, a credit, a cheese and fruit platter and 2 nights (3 days) before our room moved. They definitely do not pre-assign rooms no matter what they tell you, I watched families with 4 people being given King bed rooms. There has to be a better way. The room itself was reasonably clean, but definitely run down. Drapes were torn, paint was peeling in the bathroom. The grounds on the other hand were phenomenal. The pools and seating areas were well maintained. We had the same experience "reserving" the sunning beds on the back pool wall. I tipped, then was told that the hotel was too crowded, so I bolted down at 5:45 am. Again, there has to be a better way. The beach was nothing too exciting, it was very crowded, the seaweed was smelly. We sat on the beach for brief periods, but liked walking down the beach where things were less crowded and less full of seaweed. The lobby is unbelievable, and there is always action. We ate the buffet breakfast at the hotel which was always stocked and no lines, food was great. We also ate light breakfast from the Starbucks. The food at the pizza place was surprisingly good (pizza, burger, local food and gelato), but be prepared for a bit of a wait. Japanese was fresh and good, the Palm was eh - wouldn't recommend it at all. Things not to miss - the night kayaking in the bioluminescent bay, it is work, but worth it; the rain forest trip that includes swimming in the falls (bring a rain poncho and towels and wear sneakers); El Murro is amazing; Old San Juan - our best 2 meals were at El Jibarito and Mojitos. If we had more time we would have gone to Marmalade or Aguaviva. Pikayo at the Conrad Hilton was incredible. We went to the Bacardi factory because we wanted to get out of the sun for a few hours before meeting friends in Old San Juan. The set-up is beautiful, but don't expect to learn much. If you don't have the time, don't feel like you missed anything. Overall, we had a great bonding week. I don't think that we would stay in such a congested spot again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice But, Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: penelopepenguin
Reviews.Content: Let me say I had a few reservations about staying here due to the negative reviews. I have to say we were pleasantly surprised. Check in was another story. We were told check in was at 4pm. We stayed at another property because we had an overnight flight and The El San Juan had no rooms available at 5am. We brought our kids over to this hotel around 12 noon and sat out by the pool (FYI they need to invest in more umbrellas for the pool...there were 2...yes 2 at the main pool which sucked for everyone else who had to bake). My husband went in to check at 4 and was told we have no idea when your room will be ready. I was very annoyed since I had emailed Susan Wilkerson prior to arrival to let her know our situation. I went to the front desk and asked for Susan and she came out and promptly gave us a garden lanai room. The room was quite large (room 366) had cathedral ceilings and a walk in closet. The bathroom needed to be updated but was clean. Traveling with our two kids it was fine. The balcony was nice for us to sit in the evenings but could have used a power washing. Susan also sent us a lovely cheese plate and chocolate chip cookie tray for our boys complimentary the following night. It was a lovely surprise. The pizza place at the hotel was quite good and we had a night in ordered a large pie for about $15. We bought wine at a local store within walking distance. It was a very pleasant experience. The staff was very nice. Laury at the pool was super nice and went out of her way to make us happy. The beach was covered in seaweed and they should've had that raked. I did ask one of the beach staff and they said a public truck was supposed to come by and they didn't. For what customers pay to stay here...they should have a clean beach. We did eat at the Palm steakhouse one night and it was TERRIBLE. I will review that separately. All in all would come back though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, clean rooms, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Food-happy-AA
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the Oceanside lanai, a two-story building separated from the main ESJ building by a series of pools and pool bars. We had a spacious room, very clean, with jetted bathtub and an oceanview patio. The beds were comfortable but could have been queen size. The sound insulation is not good. Our nest door room had loud people and music. Hotel security was responsive when we called so it wasn't a problem. You could hear high heels clicking on the tile floors above but luckily, that didn't last long. The breakfast buffets were served in a restaurant with in and outdoor seating, good views of the grounds and ocean. The foods were typical buffet fares, could have been any hotel anywhere. $25 price tag was pretty steep. The service was responsive and efficient by PR standards. Parking is pricey too. Location is very close to the airport so it was perfect for catching our morning flight. I would probably come back for longer and explore the grounds and the pools. I'm sure lots of people come for the bars and the casinos. Those aren't our thing. The good thing is you can enjoy yourself even if you don't drink and gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! I would stay here again:)”
Reviews.Author: MsErica35
Reviews.Content: I will have to say that overall the hotel was very good. Let's start with the bad: 1. We checked in around 3:00pm, the room wasn't ready until after 4:00pm. I didn't understand that if check out is at 11:00am. It's frustrating after dealing with airport madness and being in the air for 4hrs. 2. Dirty dishes were left outside of the doors of several rooms for hours at a time. The Good: 1. The room was very very nice 2. The staff was friendly and helpful. Even though I found that the young man who delivered our room service knew more about the Bacardi factory(as far as the best way to travel there) than our concierge. The concierge tried her best. 3. The hotel grounds are BEAUTIFUL. Loved it!!!! 4. There is always something going on at night. It was great. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: jessandbarry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from the El San Juan and are so happy that we chose this hotel. We really felt like we were well taken care of and at the center of it all. The pools and beach were gorgeous and our room was very clean. We had a great time at the casino and loved relaxing in the lobby area in the evenings.Thank you to Susan Wilkerson for making our getaway one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “I love the El San Juan”
Reviews.Author: teteny
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the El San Juan five years ago with a group of friends and had an amazing time on that trip. I might be biased about this hotel because it was during that trip that I met my husband. My husband and I traveled to the El San Juan during Presidents Week as a second honeymoon. We read some negative reviews about the place, which was very surprising to me because my experience at the hotel 5 years ago was so pleasant. I am glad we ignored the reviews and opted to book our trip because we had an amazing trip and it was worth every penny that we spent. Because it was Presidents Week, the hotel was very crowded, but that did not have any impact on our vacation and we had a great time regardless. However, this week is the busiest week to travel and any major hotel or resort would be filled to capacity. If you are not willing to deal with crowds that it might be best that you chose another week to travel. Our room was beautiful and spotless and we had a great view of the pool and the ocean. We were on the seventh floor. I slept comfortably and I thought the bed was very comfortable. Sue Wilkerson, the hotel manager, sent us a lovely platter of cheese, wine, and champagne to congratulate us on our new marriage. It really made us feel special and we are grateful to her for her generosity. It was not difficult to get a chair at the pool, but we are early risers and were at the pool by 9 am. For others, there was some trouble. People reserved chairs and did not return to use them until later in the day or not at all. It might be helpful if the hotel staff was more cognizant of this and maybe cleared off chairs that were not in use after a few hours. Although I think the chair shortage is an issue at any hotel during this week, it is not fair to the guests who paid a lot of money to stay at the hotel and there should be better rules in place. The restaurants were VERY expensive and so were the drinks. We shopped at the Walgreens up the road to alleviate some of the cost. We ate at Koko one night and the food was spectacular and the service was amazing. We also at ate the sushi place, which was way over priced and the food was mediocre. Thankfully, there is a Starbucks in the hotel and we got coffee and a light breakfast there every day, except the first day. The lobby bar is so much fun and the entertainment is great! We returned to the hotel for the nightlife every night. It is the place to be. I would return to the El San Juan again and look forward to our next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “We did this last year around April”
Reviews.Author: doris638
Reviews.Content: The timeshare was really nice, but it did not have a decent restaurant, there was shopping a few blocks away and they were really nice, they even let you take the cart all theway to your hotel, you had to eat outside, which was not extremely great. The hotel's casino was only open after 4:00 PM, so we entened going to other hotels to gamble. The pool and beach were here nice, and staff was very pleasant.There were buses to go to the turist attractions and they were cheap. We did not rent a car. You only need one if you are going to travel to other parts of the island.

Reviews.Title: “More Old School than New!”
Reviews.Author: katherineiris
Reviews.Content: This is not a modern hotel even though rooms have gone under renovations. It's ok for a quick weekend couples trip, I stayed here about 5 years ago too and not much has changed besides the staff which is nice and helpful. The lobby needs work but the starbucks in the lobby is a good feature reminds me of home, just grab that in the am and head to the pool. The pool area is nice 2 sections but the beach is really disgusting and dirty lots of seaweed and bugs they even warn you about in the hotel! The club in the lobby called Brava for a late night activity is a really good time but I do not recommend The Palms restaurant, the food is disgusting!!

Reviews.Title: “not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: sarahrebhun
Reviews.Content: I had wanted this hotel to be so much more than it ended up being. Beautiful lobby, staff was pleasant. The bathrooms in the lobby and out by the pool were gross. Room was in desperate need of a make over. The bathroom had cracked tile and mold on the ceiling and in the vent. The bedding was ok but the bed was very uncomfortable. Too soft and I could feel the springs. We had a balcony and the slidding door kept falling off the track. Also you will hear planes taking off all day the airport is very close. I've stayed at the Intercontinental(next door to ESJ) and never noticed it as much as I did at the ESJ. If you go during Presidents day week beware hotel is at max capacity. If you want a chair at the pool get there early to get the best spot. I saw people out there at 5am(or earlier) saving their chairs. And what killed me was people would save a row of chairs in the sun and also in the shade but then take off for the beach. They would never return to those saved chairs but would leave towels and shoes or magazines on them. Making them completely unavailable for anyone to ever have those seats. Also if you like to have a drink by the pool be prepared to pay. $8 coronas and $11 pina coloda????? Not sure which is crazier the fact the hotel charges that much or that I actually paid it. I know the answer to that one. In either direction of the hotel there is a Walgreens. Go there and get your alcohol and save yourself some money. If you have the time catch a cab to Miramar and check out the restuarant Casita Miramar. It was a great place to eat and their sangria is really good. And there is a Fro-yo World(frozen yogurt) about a block away from there which is yummy as well. The hotel offers The Palm restuarant which is good but pricey. There is also a restuarant in the lobby that has pizza, gelato, salds etc... which was pretty good. The Verdanza hotel which is on Tartak(5min walk) has a restaurant called 8020 and we've had breakfast and lunch there a few times. It was good also. There is also a bakery ( I cant remember the name)about a 5min walk and they serve breakfast, lunch and dinner(I think). We had breakfast there and it was good. Their Lattes are were very good. Go for a walk there are many choices. I will come back to Puerto Rico but will not stay at the El San Juan again.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all up to expectations.”
Reviews.Author: TheOnlyRuby
Reviews.Content: I wish I were reviewing from home, instead of from my phone- suffice to say, the room quality cleanliness, staff etc- not good. Try an experiment: call and ask for the concierge, or tour desk, or anywhere! Do they even answer? Are they helpful? Not honest about condition of rooms, dirty, out dated, etc. some are refinished ( though already showing wear, and no counter space in the bathroom, others, shabby 1980's basement with dirty bathrooms and sewer bugs. Chiggers on the beach, you are warned about, but they tell you to get bug spray at the towel huts. All around dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property - Great Getaway Weekend”
Reviews.Author: SNoon4056
Reviews.Content: I spent HOURS planning our weekend getaway. My wife wanted to do something special and Presidents Day weekend was clear in her calendar. It didn't hurt that it was fairly adjacent to Valentines Day. I read all the TripAdvisor reviews and went to the El San Juan with substantial fears about doing so based on the other submissions. I left very pleased-- we had a wonderful time. For those of you who are also concerned, I'll provide tips and address some of the concerns of other reviewers, so forgive the long entry. Hopefully you'll mark this helpful. The location is in Isle Verde, fairly close to the airport. It's not in Old San Juan (which is where we preferred to stay), but we were using HH points so we took it. Old San Juan is only 15 mins away by car, so it was fine. Our location afforded us some space away from the city, and a very lovely beach location. If we go back, we may try the Caribe-- but I have no hesitation to recommend the El San Juan to you or any of my friends. The room. There are some garden villas, as well as rooms in the main hotel. I understand that there is a "new section" to the hotel which has some renovations going on. We stayed in Room 621 and the room was very nice. The decor was colorful and inviting. The view stank as it looked over a parking lot, but we spent zero time in the room staring out the window anyway. (Views can be over rated unless you plan to just sit on a balcony the whole time.) I'll attach a picture below. It was great. Lots of reviewers talk about crappy bathrooms. To the hotel staff: I'll say that a good steam cleaning of the grout and a re-caulking of the tile would be a useful investment. But by no means was it a problem. The room was clean and the bathroom was just fine. Lots of reviewers complain about the elevators. There are three. One was out much of a busy weekend. Yet, we never waited more than 2-3 minutes to get an elevator. Much ado about nothing, I say. Hotel: Get the elevator to be reliable. Noise. There was none on the 6th floor. Lots of reviewers complain about this, yet it wasn't our experience in the least. The hotel is BUSY because it's a great place to stay. There is free Salsa music in the lobby on Friday night. There was more free live music on Saturday night (and a long DJ set featuring disco music for us 50-somethings). And on Sunday night, there was live Jazz. There are two bars in this area that serve affordable food, so this is the indoor hub of the hotel. Of course it will be busy and noisy-- it's a huge value. Hotel staff: Bravo! The pool area. When we first arrived, our room was not ready. (This happens when you check in at 2pm and the official check in time is 4pm. Suck it up.) They took our bags and we proceeded to tour the pool area and look for food. John, the pool area manager, saw us looking lost and gave us a nice tour of the grounds. Very kind of him. He tool us to the far bar/pool area (I think it's called El Canto or something) and we ordered lunch, due to his recommendation of the salads. The salad was great, but the cocktail wasn't. Apparently, when the bars run out of the nice tall 14-16 oz plastic glasses, they use the disposable 7oz cups. At $12, this is BAD practice. I was mad about it all weekend. Yet every other drink I had was the normal price, in a big glass, and was excellent. See Eric at the front bar for an exceptional pina colada. HOTEL: Buy more glassware. NEVER serve your customers in those crappy disposable cups. You owe us two drinks. The beach. Fantastic. Free lounges provided by the hotel. Local vendors doing their thing. It was pleasant and bug free. The view was great, the water was warm. God: Bravo! (Hotel staff-- you get no credit for this one. But thanks for the chairs.) The casino. It's small. But that's not why we went there. We did win $60 though. The service. The guy who checked us in at the front desk was EXCELLENT. Thank you, Carlos. Other than the people I named here in my review, the service was good but not great. The lobby bar needs more servers (HOTEL: the servers work on tips, right? so increase your labor slightly-- you're leaving money on the table). The restaurants on site are great, but expensive. The service there needs polish too. All in all-- a great getaway weekend. It was our first time in Puerto Rico and we'll be back. Next time, I'll lay around the El San Juan all day and enjoy the pool more. We were able to get in a tour of El Morro and the Bacardi plant, so that took much of our weekend. Worth doing though, folks. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not what its cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: darc449
Reviews.Content: The grounds and lobby are beautiful but once you get into the rooms you will be disappointed! Our room (107) had plaster falling from the ceiling, curtains ripped off and dirty. Bathroom had mold everywhere and overall dirty. They gave someone the key to our room and we got walked in on by a stranger. The closet had broken shelves. No in room safe, coffeemaker or fridge. We paid 275.00 per night plus tax and feel like it did not meet the Hilton standards. $60.00 for 2 for breakfast buffet which was nothing spiecal. We traveled with another couple booked in the same catagory, somehow they where in another buliding over looking a parking lot. Even though I called the day prior to our arrival and we told that the request for our rooms to be close together would be granted. When I called the front desk minutes after checking in, they said that they were full and that there was noting they could do. The shower in thier room would not drain except by running over on the floor. From their room you could see planes landing and taking off...so thier room was very noisy. Very dissappionted and would never reccommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Hotel and a Wonderful Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy M
Reviews.Content: The El San Juan offers an awesome vacation! Their staff is exceptional, including Carlos, who checked me in and Maria, who handled the keeping of my room. Both were attentive and caring to any needs. Take Carlos. Upon checking in, I told him that I had read some concerning reviews about what it was like to have a room close to the infamous Brava, the nightclub at El San Juan. I told him that 30 years ago, I would haven been partying at the Brava, but that I was 60 now and was looking forward to a peaceful and relaxing time at the El San Juan. Bless his heart, Carlos found a room for me on the eighth floor. Heâ€™s the best. Although even on the eighth floor I could still hear the base beat from Brava, it wasnâ€™t that much. (For those who are unaware, Brava is the happening nightclub at El San Juan that appeals not only to guests, but to many locals in San Juan. Theyâ€™re open Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights starting at 10:30 p.m. and are open all night long with the music cranked up.) My room was beautiful and very clean. The colors ranged in a compatible spectrum from cream to green, and the look was very sleek. The floors were tiled and had a striated surface to make them slip resistant. Itâ€™s easy to see why this flooring works for the El San Juan since it is easy to track sand into the room from the beach, even with the beach showers. The bathroom was adequately sized, and very quaintly decorated with small hand laid tiles throughout. Hand laid tiles is a lost art since they take an exceptional amount of workmanship, time and patience, so it was very warming to have the experience of having a bathroom with such wonderful workmanship of a prior time. One tip is to keep the folder that your room key comes in because it has a map of the El San Juan property on the back. I could find no literature in the room about what El San Juan has to offer, so I used this map as my guide. Dining at El San Juan is wonderful, although I must admit that I only ate dinner at The Palm while I was there. The bartender during the week at The Palm is wonderful and makes a great margarita. The Palm also has a satisfying menu of happy hour â€œbar bitesâ€� for $5.50 a plate, such as steak sliders, chicken parmesan sliders, and other offerings. The Palm also has a great Arugula salad that I ordered each night, and wonderful crab cakes. There are a lot of people at the bar during the week, which is a lot of fun. The pool bar (Aquaire) is also wonderful. Eric there makes a great margarita, and Aquaire also has a bar menu during the day. El San Juan has three higher-end restaurants (The Palm, which offers steak and seafood; La Piccola Fontana, which offers Italian food; and Koco, which is Japanese.) El San Juan also has a small, attached shopping area to the left of the entrance to the hotel called the Galleria. In the Galleria is Galeria Pizza and Trattoria, which offers more moderately priced breakfasts, lunches and dinners. The attached Galleria also has a convenience store and souvenir shop (Viaggi) that sells everything from clothing souvenirs, to sundries, small cups of Ben and Jerryâ€™s ice cream, to a small selection of wines and beers. You name it, and Viaggi has it. For breakfast El San Juan has La Terraza, which is a relaxing restaurant with both an enclosed dining area and a dining area in an open air terrace that overlooks the ocean and pool. I really enjoyed the experience of having breakfast on the outdoor terrace, looking out at the ocean and enjoying the wonderful ocean air. As others have noted, the full buffet is $25, but I decided it was worth it with the tropical feel. As with any outdoor restaurant, however, you get to share it with any birds or other wildlife wondering by that are interested in eating breakfast, too. They wonâ€™t come to your table unless you leave, so if you leave, be sure to put a napkin over your food and youâ€™ll be fine. A chameleon may also cross your path at El San Juan as you are walking around the pool area. It all adds to the experience, and I found my leisurely breakfasts at La Terraza and the tropical wildlife around the resort area one of the best parts of my trip. For those who want a more moderately priced breakfast, there are two Starbucks at El San Juan, one to the left as you enter the hotel, and one in the Galleria area. The Starbucks in the lobby is open during the morning and offers breakfast sandwiches and oatmeal. The Starbucks in the Galeria is larger and open all day. The pool area and ocean are beautiful, and be sure to see the Banyan tree that is to the left as you enter the pool area. Itâ€™s so incredible. The only final comment is that anyone who visits the El San Juan needs to remember that this hotel is a very happening place, both for visitors and locals alike. Itâ€™s a very popular place to see and be seen. As with any such place, noisy neighbors, people coming back from partying (and having had a very good time), are very much a part of the fabric of being at El San Juan. The fact the floors arenâ€™t carpeted and there isnâ€™t sound proofing in the Brava or elsewhere (such as sound resistant wall fabrics or paint), means that there isnâ€™t anything to minimize the sounds of other vacationers and nightclub attendees who are having a wonderful time. I got used to it after my second night, but if you are looking for a quiet, peaceful, low-volume vacation, a quiet boutique hotel may be more suited to you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby”
Reviews.Author: ChanelCinq
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay here but we came to drink, dine, and gamble. The lobby is beautiful and the wood work is impressive. My out of town friend wanted to dine at the Ritz Carlton but he was glad I talked him into going to the local, almost historic El San Juan. We walked around the grounds and the pool area and it also seemed very nice with direct access to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette Party”
Reviews.Author: n m
Reviews.Content: We came down to San Juan, PR for the first time and based on other people's reviews- we stayed here. There were 6 of us between two rooms so we all had plenty of space. We did not have an amazing view outside of our window, or a balcony which was a little disappointing. We loved being able to use our ipod to play music and never got any complaints about the noise factor in the room. The bathrooms were disappointing as they were small and the shower head was difficult to manage. We did not like the lighting in the room either, but other than that we were comfortable while staying there. We even asked for additional foam pillows and ice buckets, which did not pose a problem. The elevators did slow down from time to time and we did take the stairs once or twice. We liked the Japanese restaurant on premises as well as the Italian place. The food was delicious. The poolside bar/rest. was also very convenient. Service can be a little slow though. We liked the option of a quieter side of the pool and then the "party" side with the swim up bar. The beach was also nice as we were able to rent umbrellas and get service out there. We loved the club inside the resort, as we went there all the nights. The lobby has a great party every night. People are always dressed up, so don't plan to walk around in shorts and a t all day long! Overall, we would go back here on our next trip down to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “All About the Lobby!”
Reviews.Author: Connor2003
Reviews.Content: The lobby and weekend atmosphere are the best part of this hotel. The pool area n rooms are not impressive. The beach is nice and relaxing. The Palm Restaraunt is great and worth the money. Overall it was a nice time but I wouldn't stay here again. Having said that it's still the best hotel on the strip of hotels in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a 4-Star Hotel, Some Issues, Great Beach & Pool”
Reviews.Author: usflyer
Reviews.Content: We are HH Gold folks and really looked hard to find a property on San Juan to use our points for an award stay. Reading reviews, it really seemed like a crapshoot as all had mixed reviews. We initially booked Caribe but the reviews were continuously pretty bad and then I noticed that this property was downgraded to a 4-Star Level from previously being Waldorf Astoria so would be a savings in points from Caribe. I also noticed I could reserve a Junior Suite as part of my cheaper award reservation, so I cancelled Caribe and booked here. Note there is a resort fee like all PR resorts, but we didn't pay that since this was an award stay. POSITIVE - Awesome beach. We thought the calm and large beach here was much better than Condado. We thought Condado in general felt like a cruise terminal. - Great pool area. They have a lot of little cabana areas where you can lay down under a canopy by the pool for free. Nice busy bar by the pool with reasonable priced food and overpriced drinks. Pools were plentiful and very nice and surprisingly not used much. - Junior Suite was very large with nice sitting area and big desk. Room has nice big flat screen TV and the bed was nice and comfortable with plenty of good pillows. - Continental Breakfast provided without asking for Gold HH members, as well as free Wireless Internet (will be reversed from your bill at checkout). - Starbucks in the hotel AND 25 steps away in the interior mall attached. Side note, they don't accept the Starbucks Card here but will give you a 10% discount if you present it. - Property lobby and ground floor is very nice and popular with locals. - Nearby to local restaurants (loved Metropol and La Playita....Platos just OK...see yelp for reviews posted) - Susan Wilkerson did respond promptly to emails although.... CONCERNS - When I contacted Susan about request for high floor, etc....my room was downgraded from my booked Junior Suite to a regular room. I noticed and then had to talk with corporate to get my original reserved room reinstated....which it was. According to Susan, this may be a HH website glitch being able to book the Suite. - The rooms and amenities definitely reflect why this was downgraded to a 4-star property. First impressions matter and upon entering our very big room, the first thing we noticed was the large crack in our room window. The rooms are very bare and basic - no in room coffee or tea, small bathroom with no tub, no balcony (although our window had a door you could open), and most criminal of all is 4 straight days of twice daily warm showers. We took showers at all hours of the days here and never had a hot shower. - Major elevator issues at this property. First of all, there are only 3. Secondly, they were never all working and one day all of them were out so everyone was climbing up a set of staff staircases to get around. Average wait if they were working was probably 3-4 minutes. - As others have said, noise is an issue here. Honestly, I don't know how to advise getting a room that would be quiet. Based on reviews here, I requested a high floor (to be away from the club) and away from the elevators. Unfortunately, the end of the hotel away from the club is near the entrance of the hotel where everyone stands outside to drink/ smoke/ arrive as well as near the airport. So, while we avoided the club noise, we listened to all that noise every night and had to sleep with earplugs which reduced most that noise. - Not a huge deal, but it was interesting there was no guide to hotel services/ amenities in the room. - We had false minibar charges on our final bill which were promptly removed without question at the front desk (just make sure you review). - Concierge wasn't particularly helpful with explaining how the local bus works (bring quarters, they require exact change!) and we got much better info and maps from the Intercontinental concierge next door. - While we appreciated the HH Continental Breakfast....upgrade to warm foods is $10 more (plus additional taxes)...and really the whole breakfast area and selection is fine and basic but not like you would have at a 5-star hilton property.......and unfortunately their outside seating area is like being in the movie The Birds - many, many (25++) black birds (grackles?) and pigeons congregate in the outdoor seating. They perch on chairs and tables (yes, even the "clean" tables and dishes you eventually eat off of) watching you eat, and if you get up, they all get all over your table, in your food, in your napkins, etc. I guess it is nature but just not very sanitary. SUMMARY The outdoor part of this property is awesome and the location very good. Inside, I would say it is an average 4-stoor property with the type of issues you would expect there. I feel it was a decent value for my points, but I would likely try elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelor Party trip to the El San Juan”
Reviews.Author: sbouldin
Reviews.Content: A total of 8 of us flew down for my brother's bachelor party. We had a great time at the hotel. We had 2 rooms, with 2 beds in each room. The beds were very comfortable and the room was big enough for 4 of us. As others have said, the bathrooms are a disappointment. Very small and a shower that needed a lot of TLC. I give the rooms a 4/5 just because of the bath issue. Checking in was a breeze. Mara was awesome and was very nice. We got in early, so she had us check our bags and we waited for the rooms out by the pool and grabbed some lunch. The lobby of the hotel is amazing; huge and spacious with dark mahogany wood throughout. There are 2 bars and plenty of places to sit down and relax. At night, it turns into one big party and his packed with dancing and mingling. Also off of the lobby is a nightclub where hotel guests can get in free. You'll need some nice close toed shoes to get in though. FYI, the drinks in the night club are quite a bit cheaper then those out in the lobby bars. The pool area is what sets this place apart. It's awesome. 2 huge pools, plenty of lounges and chairs, 3+ hot tubs, swim up bar. It's awesome. Plus, you have direct access to the beach where you can rent jet skis, pick up some food from local vendors, or just veg out. I"ve seen some folks complain about the beach, but I thought it was fine. The seaweed can be a bit rough on the feet, but they can't help that. Lastly, the casino is a lot of fun. Don't expect Vegas, but it was clean and had a good vibe to it. All in all, we had an excellent time and I would recommend it in a heartbeat as a cool place to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun in PR.....with a few glitches....”
Reviews.Author: edward l
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from the EL San JUAN in Puerto rico. I have been staying at La Concha, bit wanted a bit of a change. Overall I did think this hotel was hopping!! The check in was easy, the bar scene with Live musical bands was awesome and the staff was great!! i Stayed in an island lanai, and not the main hotel. I was upset at first being away from the closed up action of the main building. However, I heard from many that the main hotel gets very noisy with many people over drinking at the bars. So as it turned out the Island Lanai, which has older rooms and a small bathroom was very quiet. It was also very convenient to get to the hotel an beach. As far as food goes, the morning buffet breakfasts which run about $30 after they add in sales taxes that I never heard of, was a bit pricey, but convenient. I ate there every day because that food was great and heck ....it was right there! The food that they have at pool, the burgers, rotis chicken, and salads where first class, but the morning buffet should keep you full most of the day. I absolutely loved the Japanese restaurant at the hotel!! They have a $20 sushi lunch that was great, so we went back and had dinner there as well. Sushi is always expensive so Id say it was the right price. Was very very disappointed in the Palm restaurant!! Its the forst time I ever walked out of a restaurant complaining....so much so that they didnt let me pay the check! The place was 1/2 full yet the waiter service was horrible. My date ordered the tuna and hated it, while i orderd sirloin steak and was brought filet mignon....this after waiting 40 minutes for my soup!! Very disappointed and i wouldnt go back to the Palms...even at the zero price tag....its over priced. The casino was great!! Lively, fun, seemed on the level ...but i won so maybe im being a little to generous with my love of the casino. The pools and lounge chairs were great!! Only problem is that people put 2 towels on two chairs at the beach, on the private lounges, and on two chairs at the main pool. They cover six chairs and use them as they see fit, son you will see many chairs with only towels saving the seats....That part was bad, but if you go to the pool area by 10 you will have a good selection of where to sit. Over all... I love this place! Its only 7 minutes to the airport and there are many restaurants and a walgreen in short walking distance. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and also there to say good morning and welcome. I will definately go back in six months.....Great place

Reviews.Title: “February 2012”
Reviews.Author: Nicole G
Reviews.Content: I was at the El San Juan Feb 2012, duration of the trip was just over a week. The room: we stayed in the Garden Villas. 2nd & 3rd floors had nice balconies that faced the main hotel and one of the pool areas. 1st floors faced the same direction, but had a large walk-out to the pool patio. The room was very quiet. Our room was a king room, and had a small couch/living room/office setup, a large walk-in closet, large double sink plus extra vanity, and a small, seperate room for the toilet and bathtub/shower (the tub and toilet room was SMALL, bathtub/shower is standard). Overall it was nice (except toilet & bathtub which were cramped and dated), but nothing out of the ordinary, with the exception of the balcony which was a very nice plus. We constantly had issues with our keycard not working. It was probably because we had it next to a credit card or camera or cell phone, but as a tourist, that cannot be avoided :) The grounds: There were 3 pools on the grounds. The pool in the center of the resort had some tables set up in the pool. Lounge furniture and hammocks, an unopened massage area, and a outside bar (but not in the pool, about 20 feet from pool). This is the only outside bar I noticed, and closes at 6pm on weekdays, bummer. Closer to the beach area there was a very small pool, and a larger "cool" pool with all the amenities - cabana's, lounge areas, swim-up bar, small waterfall. There were at least 4 hot tubs spread out throughout the grounds. The part of the bar that is swim up is in shade the whole day with the exception of about 3 of the water-bar stools. The pool water is relatively cold, but once you're in, is comfortable (in the sun). the beach: The hotel provides beach lounge chairs to all guests and follow you and place them wherever you want. There are private owned, small, food carts that walk up and down the beach & you can bring beverages to the beach as well. The ocean water is slightly warmer than the pool water. the waves are smaller, but still large enough to boogie board. The shallow regions of the water are full of seaweed and other ocean crud - you have to go out deeper than about 3-3.5 feet in water depth to get to cleaner water. Something that was in the shallow area, washed up weeds gave me numerous bites on my legs and torso; like mosquito bites. there's jet ski rental, banana boat rides, and massages all available right outside the resort on the beach there. food/beverage: Our trip was NOT all-inclusive (don't know if any are here...) and food and beverage are quite expensive on the resort. For example, a short tumbler (one shot with soda) of their local rum (Don Q) was $12 each. We ate at the Palms, which was very good and filling. We shared a lunch at the swim-up bar (the yellow rice is really good). We went to the Japanese hibachi place once and absolutely loved it - our chef was better than other chefs we have had (Orlando, Vegas, etc...) - the food was cooked perfect & delicious. We liked it so much we made a point to go again, this time we had a different chef, who was sub-par - if had him the first time don't think we would have went again; the food and hibachi presentation was only so-so this second time. (the good chef had a left sleeve of tattoos.) There was a small shopping area inside the hotel, a pizza place with gelato, and the small casino - which has everything you need in a casino; it is small, but perfectly sized for the amount of people that go. The 2 bars in the lobby are absolutely packed on weekend nights. There was a lounge bar off the lobby, which I never noticed open. there's a dance club in the hotel, small, but a nice setup. Seemed like drinks were actually cheaper in there than out in the lobby (hotel guests are on a list and get in free; non-guests have to pay to enter). Pool closes at 9pm (midnight swim not an option sadly). And everyone does clear out of the pool by about 4pm. The staff was very friendly. Every morning the hotel completely cleaned the pools. There is Walgreens a block from the hotel, liqour stores, and if you head right out of the hotel to the right there is a whole LOT of different restaurants (every different ethnic cuisine just about) & small shops - they start about 2 blocks away, easy walk. The hotel staff was friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable due to fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: tripsaway
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 'tired' and really needs a face lift. Rooms overlooking the pool (6th floor and up) have a pleasant view but need updating. The room itself is nothing to write home about. The bathroom is tiny and the shower needs to be redone. The room was very clean and all requests were quickly fulfilled by housekeeping. The bed was very comfortable. There are no full length mirrors or magnifying mirrors in the room. There is no balcony however there is a door to open so you can enjoy the outside but the filthy old balcony railing is there and it leaves much to be desired. On the plus side I give the hotel staff an A++. Each person we met, from the breakfast waiters and waitresses... to the front desk reception..... to the pool staff and housekeeping etc. were wonderful. They were pleasant.....smiling and made the shortcomings in the room seem not so bad.,The pool area is beautiful and the chaise lounges extremely comfortable. During the week there were plenty to chose from, but be prepared to claim your chair early on the weekend when the hotel seems to be mobbed.Restaurants are great however you can't charge them to your room (except for pool bars for lunch). La Piccola Fontana was exceptional...expensive....and very crowded. You feel like you are eating at your neighbors table! Nice to start up conversations but not so great if looking for a romantic evening. They offer a special menu during the week with a specially priced bottle of wine which was well worth it. We ate at Il Mulino at the Ritz... Very, very pricey but the most amazing restaurant. Well worth the cost. The breads and appetizers etc that they bring out as you sit down are fantastic. The service is like nonother,. Dinner was delicious and something we will talk about for years.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Neil P
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the El San Juan for 5 days and was pleasantly surprised. I had read mixed reviews concerning the service and room conditions and found both to be very good. Service was very good, all employees went out of their way to be friendly and to attend to my needs. Room was very nice, not luxurious but clean and well appointed. Terrific pool area and great beach steps from my room. A good value , I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're not near the elevator”
Reviews.Author: kdistasio26
Reviews.Content: The El San Juan is a gorgeous hotel. The pools are beautiful and it's setting right on the beach is beyond compare. My husband and I actually got married here and it was gorgeous. The lobby is beautiful as well, the multiple bars and sitting areas are wonderfully designed. The only bad thing that I can say is that our room was situated at the elevator bank, basically right behind the elevator, which made it quite noisy. Between hearing the people coming off and on the elevator as well as the elevators CONSTANTLY zooming up and down it was annoying to say the least. The worst part however, was the bathroom! It was so ridiculously small that I'm not even sure why they had a door on it at all because it's not as if you could actually close it! The door opened right into the toilet, like the door just barely cleared the toilet! The sink was just a small pedestal crammed between the toilet and the tub. If you're going to stay here I highly recommend you make sure that you DO NOT stay in one of these elevator rooms. The room itself was nice but the bathroom was terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Very overrated”
Reviews.Author: Happyatdisney
Reviews.Content: This is probably the most overrated hotel I've ever stayed by. On first glance, it looks luxurious and trendy. But ten minutes after I entered my room, I was already on the phone with housekeeping to sweep the floor. Here's the breakdown: PROS: 1. The lobby is the most happening lobby that I've seen in a long time....many many many people were there on Friday and Saturday nights. The dancing was fun and the live bands were great. 2. The staff were courteous....but not always helpful. Read the con below. We didn't encounter any rudeness at all. CONS 1. The rooms are nicely decored, but are in shabby condition. The shower especially needs updating. The size of the room was ok, but I see that many reviewers complain about the quality of the rooms. 2. Drinks were good, but very expensive! 3. There are no refrigerators to rent. I like to have a fridge in my hotel rooms for my own stash of drinks and fruit etc ...otherwise you spend a fortune on hotel drinks and snacks. 4. The pool is nice (please note that barely any hotels in Puerto Rico have heated pools), but I noticed that few chairs are actually situated around the pool! Most chairs had poor views. 5. The concierge was extremely unhelpful. All they want to do is book you something. They couldn't even give me information on a snorkeling beach! They just had information on a snorkeling tour. 6. I was upgraded to a room with a vista view, as they did not have any rooms with king size beds left. The view was ridiculous! Yes, we could see the beach, but the room looked out to the parking lot! Give me a break. Stay at the intercontinental, which is a 3 minute walk to the el san Juan. The rooms come with balconies, complimentary refrigerators, and have better views. Plus, there pool area is much prettier. Their lobby is nothing special, so walk over to the el san Juan for some.entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with beautiful pool and beach”
Reviews.Author: Travellingsoulottawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with spouse for one night post cruise. Lovely lobby area with several restaurants on ground floor (all expensive as per most hotel restaurants). Attached to "La Galleria" which is a small shopping mall which contains a Starbucks, a couple of restaurants and stores, maybe a dozen merchants in total. Our room had a king size bed with a nice lounging area and plenty of storage for clothes. Bathroom was a bit disappointing as it could have been in better repair. The grout around the ceramic tiles in the very large shower was in need of replacing as it was starting to look a bit black and moldy - yuch! Outside the pool areas are large and very comfortable with lovely chaise lounges with comfy chair pads and lots of "beds for two" everywhere. The beach was lovely and it only took a few minutes to find a staff person to bring some loungers to the beach (which were free for guests). Service on the beach was terrible for food - we ordered hamburgers and beer and it took about 20 minutes for the food to come and he forgot the beer. Said he would be right back with the beer but never came back. Then we moved to the pool area and went to the pool bar ourselves and got our own beer. We stayed here because it was close to the airport, a $12 taxi ride plus $1 per piece of luggage and only took about 10 minutes to get there. Overall experience was positive!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms, Bad Service, Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: Pamma76
Reviews.Content: I had a horrible experience at El San Juan. At first glance, the hotel looks like a nice place with stylish decor and really cool pool area, but they don't know anything about providing good service and the rooms are dirty. The bathroom had mold on the walls both in the bathroom and a patch outside of the bathroom because the room had no real ventillation. We told the front desk about the problem and they didn't seem to care. When I went down and told them again, they wouldn't switch our room and never sent housekeeping to clean it like they said they would. We did get a $50 refund on our room because we had requested a room change and never gotten it. The floors were covered in a layer of dirt as if they are never vacuumed and I suspect I was bitten by bed bugs during my stay there. I never saw any, but my husband and I both had little bites all on our legs and we had only been outside at the pool, so I would caution anyone against staying there. Even if you are lucky and get a clean room, you can hear everything in the rooms next door (so much so that you can hear whole conversations, not just muffled voices). Also, every little service costs extra. WiFi is $14 per day and bottled waters are $7. It was a very frustrating place to stay and they ruined what would have been a really nice little vacation (we went for a friend's wedding). Luckilly we spent our last night in San Juan at the Double Tree where they treated us like guests, were very helpful, and gave us a clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - getting the buffet on the way out - ouch!”
Reviews.Author: DrF111111
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms where clean and in nice condition. All in all it's an OK place to stay. We where staying overnight before a cruise, got up went to breakfast. Figure we would have the buffet, no listed prices and shame on me I didn't ask but $25 per person for an omlet and pastries - ouch. One night stay with dinner and breakfast was $653.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities but rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: keldes
Reviews.Content: The pros are the pools, the nightclub, and the restaurants the only con are the rooms. They are so unattractive they take away from the rest of the stay. The decor in the guest rooms is cold and dingy, the showers are small and moldy (with a really awkward shower head) and the white pillows on the couches should be burned they are so dirty. The grounds and the common areas are well maintained, the pools are sparkling clean, the food is very good in the restaurants, the nightclub has a great DJ, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The health club is small but adequate with only one piece of broken equipment. The spa could use some work on the quiet area and the dressing areas but the treatment rooms are nice and I had one of the best massages I have ever had by Carlos. I would be more likely to stay here again if the rooms were renovated. Ask for a high floor that faces the beach or you might get stuck looking at the dirty roof of an attached building.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive lobby, rooms need updating, wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: juliso
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent four nights at the El San Juan Resort and Casino in Puerto Rico. When we booked the trip we were under the impression that the hotel is owned by the Waldorf Astoria chain. We found out before our arrival that the hotel is now owned by the Hilton hotel chain. Having stayed at other Waldorf hotels we had been expecting the same level of service and attention to detail that we experienced at those hotels. We were a little skeptical after learning that the hotel was now owned by Hilton but felt, based on many of the TripAdvisor reviews, that we would be happy. Upon entering the lobby of the El San Juan Resort it was hard not to be impressed. The lobby is accurately represented on it's website and is very well maintained. We saw the difference when we got to our room. Although the room was clean, it wasn't immaculate. Little details like chipped tile and smudges on the white leather sofa as well as a few small tears in the drapes made it clear that the attention (and money for upkeep) is spent in the lobby. We liked that the hotel had several restaurants in the lobby including Koko (where we dined twice - the food and cocktails were amazing and Joe, bartender, was very friendly and very attentive), an Italian restaurant and a Japanese restaurant. We had takeout for lunch from the Japanese restaurant twice (the sushi was extremely fresh) and had dinner at the Italian restaurant our first evening (the mushroom risotto was delicious). We had been told by the hotel rep., when we booked the trip, that the lobby was a favorite spot for locals and tourists on Friday and Saturday evenings. It is "the place to see and be seen" according the to rep. Because of this he told us that the hotel was very strict about the evening dress code. Absolutely no jeans, shorts or tee-shirts after 7 p.m. Although my husband would not wear shorts and a tee-shirt in the evening, he had planned to wear jeans. I sent an e-mail to the hotel and called the hotel directly to confirm what I was told. I never received a reply to my e-mail but was told by the front desk that this was in fact true and that the dress code is enforced. I can tell you that nothing is further from the truth. Our first night, Friday, about half the men in the lobby were wearing jeans. On Saturday night, not only were the majority of men under age sixty wearing jeans, several were wearing shorts. These were non-hotel guests whom I saw enter through the front doors where they could have easily been turned away if the dress code was valid. The pool area and beach were nice but lacking the same attention to detail obvious in the guest rooms. These areas were also very crowded.
