On our third day, we got to the pool at 10:00 a.m. only to find all but one of the covered double lounge "chairs" was taken. On the beach, there was some litter (plastic cups and food wrappers) in the spot were the "pool boy" put our chairs. I thought he would pick it up after setting up the chairs. He did not. That would not have happened at a Waldorf hotel. The service of the hotel staff was very average. The front desk staff was friendly but not well informed about sightseeing in Old San Juan or restaurants and shops outside the hotel. The bartenders in the hotel lobby were poor at best both in timeliness and friendliness. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for attention to detail and exceptional service.

Reviews.Title: “Just go at night for drinks but stay next door”
Reviews.Author: Cristinac246
Reviews.Content: Bad service, shabby moldy rooms, not worth the money. I picked this hotel because I wanted to be right in the heart of the action but it was not "happening" during the day and the rooms were gross. The only thing good about the hotel was the fun lobby at night. Rooms: The rooms are trendy but very worn and not clean. The bathrooms have a lot of mold and dirty grout--I wouldn't take my flip flops off the entire trip. Service: the service was especially bad on our first night SOMEONE TRIED TO BREAK INTO OUR ROOM through the connector; when we reported this to the front desk and asked to move they showed no concern--no one from security ever contacted us to get a report or find out what went on. We asked to have our room changed b/c I felt unsafe staying next to the person that tried to break in (here's what happened: at 12:30a we were awakened to someone fussing with the lock on the connector door; not until I said someone is in here did it stop. But earlier, when we got back to our room after the beach, we found a guy in the hallway knocking frantically on the next room door, when we got in our room we found the connector door unlocked (lucky I checked) but nothing touched, not until the 2nd attempt did we realize the guy in the hallway was probably a lookout and the next door guy had already been in our room, we just got back early and "foiled" his attempt) Nonetheless, when we asked to have our room changed 4 times, they gave us no priority and no one went out of their way to try to accommodate us. I understand they were near sell out but we would have appreciated if they would have done more to have us moved earlier and followed up to make sure we got one of the 1st rooms available and then again after the move to see if everything was ok. No employees say hello when walking around, no sense that in general you are being taken care of or catered to. No "hospitality" at this hotel. EXCEPT: Angelo the bellman at the door was happy and cheerful, friendly and kind everytime we saw him. Everyone at the hotel should be like him! Spa: We went up to the spa to inquire about services and the girl didn't explain anything about the spa or treatments but just said "when do you want to come--because we don't have anything now"...um, we don't even know if we want to yet...better to get a massage on the beach. Pool: I wanted to stay b/c I thought the lobby is happening at night, it must be happening at pool during the day...not the case. Only on Saturday did they have a dj but otherwise nothing going on during the day at hotel. In summary, don't waste the money to stay there--it's not the posh hotel you might think is happening and luxurious. Just go at night and hang out; stay at the Intercon (I've been, it's very nice) or the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Prime Locations”
Reviews.Author: WhatMickyEats
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is extremely accommodating and flexible at ESJ Resort. I went with a group of 10 other ladies for a birthday/bachelorette weekend and Ms. Wilkerson and staff went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable experience. The rooms are modern with great views. The lobby/bar areas are chic and elegant; the food options are excellent; the pool area is fun with direct access to the beautiful beach. Only 5 minutes from the airport, ESJ Resort is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: crystalline242
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to stay here since it was part of the waldorf collection. The lobby area is decorated very beautifully and there was a prom going on the day we got there. Overall the grounds were nice but I guess I expected it to be a 5 star property which I did not feel it was. The pool area is pretty with a swim up bar as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Crude Bartender”
Reviews.Author: costaricaconnections
Reviews.Content: We were not staying at the El San Juan but went to enjoy a drink at the bar. The lobby and bars are somehting to see. It is definitely "a scene". After enjoying our drinks our bartender started telling us very crude jokes. It really spoiled the ambiance. I would highly recommend seeing the lobby on a weekend night.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: mike k
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at ESJ last week. After reading some of the reviews we were a little concerned about the noise level. I emailed Susan Wilkerson (after seeing other comments about how helpful she was) and asked her to please do what she could to get us a room in a quieter part of the hotel. She came through like a champ. Put us as far away from the elevators as possible on the East side of the hotel. (The night club is really loud and people we spoke with whose rooms were on the west end of the hotel said it was very loud on Friday and Saturday night). Our room was fine. The bathroom is small and the shower tile could use a good scrubbing but nothing too bad. We had no complaints at all with the room. The beach is pretty good. The chair guys are very attentive and the wait service was decent. (If you want a great lunch, walk 50 yards down the beach to the Ciao Mediterranean Cafe. The lunch was definitely better than the ok lunch we got at ESJ). The food at the Piccola Fontana (the small Italian restaurant in the ESJ) was very good. Not cheap (nothing at ESJ is cheap unfortunately) but very good. If you're expecting a 5 Star Waldorf Astoria-type room you will be disappointed in the room. We weren't interested in paying $500/nite for a 5 Star experience But, if you're looking for a pretty decent room (call it a 3 Star??) and a pretty nice tropical resort then the ESJ is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Still awaiting a response from management”
Reviews.Author: Tim K
Reviews.Content: I had copied emails in an earlier post last month so that people could read my content and sincerity in inquiring of room change charges and what appears to be additional charges for my 1 year old daughters accommodations but tripadvisor did not post since it had quoted material. It is a shame because people who read my numerous inquiries direct to hotel management with only one response from 6 weeks ago stating that they would review and get back to me. I'm still waiting Susan Wilkerson on emails sent on 12/19/11, 12/22/11, 12/29/11, and 1/5/12. The other couple that came with us has contacted Hilton and is also still awaiting a response. Extremely poor customer service on charge inquiries. The very short summary is that I stayed at the ESJ Hotel with my wife, 1 year old daughter and another couple from December 5 - 9, 2011. Prior to arriving, I called on December 2 to inquire on having adjoining rooms to allow for easy monitoring of our baby who naps 2 times per day. December 2, we were charged $95 from the hotel shortly after making the phone call without warning of this charge. December 5, we arrive at ESJ Hotel and we are assigned rooms across the hotel from each other. We mention we called on 12/2 about adjoining rooms and a crib. ESJ assigns us rooms next to each other but not adjoining which is fine but we also have to wait another hour for a crib to be delivered. Again not a huge deal but we did call ahead, were told we would have adjoining rooms, crib would be ready, and later (days AFTER checkout) finally find out that the $95 charge from 12/2 was because of the phone call we made requesting adjoining rooms. They stated the $95 fee was for the room change which was never addressed and not reimbursed and emails/phone calls to hotel management still haven't been addressed. Still awaiting Susan Wilkerson's response. The other issue was that we were charged $190.00 per night for our room which was $38 per night more than we had reserved it for. Our friends in the room next door, which was exactly the same setup and size as ours, were charged the quoted amount of $152.00 per night. Upon checkout, I inquired of this difference and the lady assisting us said she did not know and that we should contact the reservation phone number. I contacted Susan Wilkerson via email about this item as well on 4 separate occasions (see previous dates of emails listed above) and still awaiting a response. I can only assume that the difference was for the additional baby we brought with us. If this is the reason for the additional $190.00 in charges, it goes against Hilton hotels family policy as well as ESJ's policy. If I was charged for the additional occupancy, the room they put us in was not rated for (3) occupants. I should have been placed in a different room rated for this occupancy if this is the reasoning for the additional $38.00 per night. Did I mention that Susan Wilkerson still hasn't responded to our repeated email inquiries. The pools and breakfast were great and much of the staff were friendly. Customer service could use a boost (or boot).

Reviews.AuthorLocation: East Hampton, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Very Accomadating”
Reviews.Author: Joy K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days @ the resort...she suffers from a spinal cord injury and they couldn't do enough to make her stay comfortable. Carlos @ the front desk is a gentleman and all in all a good person. i would recommend this resort to anyone who is looking to have some rest and pampering. Cant say enough about how nice everyone was too us and everyone around us.... hope you have as great a time as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: jtg3
Reviews.Content: We anticipated that the ownership of Waldorf would ensure a top-rate hotel and were sorely disappointed. While the lobby and the casino had been renovated, the amenities were lacking in the rooms, especially the bathrooms. Also, there was no view of the beach from rooms ....no balcony.......and the poolside cabanas were worn and tired looking. On a plus: The brunch was phenomenal, (but we were pestered by table-top birds on the patio) and we loved the rooftop BBQ open air restaurant. Needs a sprucing up!!

Reviews.Title: “Great lobby but all else leaves a bit to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Rdevita
Reviews.Content: Based on my stay at El San Juan 10 years ago, I was excited about getting back. The lobby is one of the prettiest you'll see with marble and hand carved mahogany adorning it. It looks like the kind of place that Frank Sinatra would have loved while smoking a cigar and leaning on the lobby bar. Unfortunately, this is where the positive comments end. The rooms like they were decorated with furnishings from Target. I think they were going for a minimalist, white theme but what they got was a sterile, plastic feel. The room was not soothing to say the least. We had a weird security issue where we returned after dinner to find our hotel room door wide open....anyone walking by could see our entire room. As far as we can see nothing was taken, thankfully we had our valuables in the hotel safe. We called security and got a very unsatisfactory outcome as their equipment was down and they were unable to tell us whose room key was used to enter the room. We demanded a room change and were given it but I can tell you that the front desk treated it as more of annoyance to them than an issue of concert to me. The grounds are in need of clean up as we saw common areas that had standing trash that had been there for sometime. We enjoyed Puerto Rico, but next trip, we'll be choosing an alternative hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Annette H
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in this hotel in January. There are some positives to the hotel such as the location on the beach is absolutely beautiful and the main lobby area is gorgeous. The chairs provided on the beach is a paradise for beach goers. For a Hilton I was surprised by the upkeep and service of the hotel.... Let me paint a picture. On arrival we had a room on the third floor and had to drag our luggage up three flights of stairs due to the elevator not working in our portion of the hotel. That's fine we can totally handle that. Then we showed up in our room and it was pretty but there was an open bag of chips that was left with crumbs in our closet. After discovering that we asked the front desk to double check the mini-bar to make sure nothing else was missing. At check out they tried to charge me for a few different items from the mini-bar, which we did not use. They thankful took the $50 purchases off my tab. Another disappointment was the jacuzzi heaters were down for three nights. My friends and I had a few active adventures and all you want to do is rest and relax in the jacuzzi. We had to contact the concierge to figure out what was going on and they had no idea when the heaters would be back up. We stayed 7 days at this hotel and had to deal with a leaky sink for about three full days. We originally thought that we had dragged the water into the bathroom somehow only to find the puddle in our bathroom every afternoon and morning after getting in from the beach. I informed the front desk and they sent someone to look who said they couldn't fix it till morning. Morning came around and the people who were suppose to fix our sink left and didn't do anything... I had to remind the front desk that our sink was leaking quite a bit of water onto our tile. It was just disappointing to have to deal with a leaky sink while on vacation. There wasn't even an offer to change rooms and the hotel was definitely not full. FYI it is a $20 cab ride to old san juan and the airport. So if you want to head into town make it a day event otherwise you are wasting $40. Puerto Rico is awesome enjoy your vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great escape from the Cleveland winter!”
Reviews.Author: elizabethkd
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the El San Juan 5 nights over MLK day weekend. We had a room on the 7th floor with a view of the pool and ocean. The sliding door didnâ€™t open (it had a sticker saying do not open) which was disappointing, but at least we had a nice view. We didnâ€™t hear any noise from the lobby or club downstairs. The hotel and grounds are beautiful (Iâ€™m a sucker for a good swim up bar). The staff was friendly and accommodating â€“ just the right amount of attention. The lobby bars and casino were lively and crowded â€“ it was entertaining to watch guests from other hotels gasp at the beauty and energy of the lobby scene during the weekend. The beach was nice, but not beautiful. The drinks were SO EXPENSIVE. Two vodka tonics cost $30. The food was good â€“ we ate at The Palm for bar bites ($5.50 happy hour menu weeknights) once, again for a delicious steak dinner, and at the sushi restaurant â€“ all fantastic. There are two great beach sports bars just past the Intercontinental with cheap, good food. For breakfast we either had a bagel from Starbucks (located within the hotel) or walked down to the two breakfast places nearby. We also ate at the Meixcan Restaurant next door once. If you want to spend the money, there certainly is not a lack of dining options at the El San Juan. Brava, the nightclub, was small but fun. Also, I think itâ€™s important to point out that thereâ€™s really not much around the resort. The airport is literally 5 minutes away, but you donâ€™t really notice it. We had a great escape from snowy Cleveland and loved the El San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “No Balcony!?!”
Reviews.Author: LondonGirl3
Reviews.Content: The most disappointing thing about this hotel is that there are no balconies (unless you are in the garden or ocean lanai)! So that means no afternoon cocktails on your balcony watching the sunset...a huge negative in my opinion. Like 85% of the other reviewers, I had to request a room change during our stay. I am a Hilton Honors Gold member and upon check-in I am supposed to automatically receive an upgrade. After confiming this with the person who checked us in, we were given a room on the 7th floor with a view of a TREE! You couldn't see anything else, how is that an upgrade???????????? We went to the lobby, where we stood in line behind numerous other guests who were there to complain about their rooms as well. Even after expressing our disappointment in the view, we were only moved 2 rooms over so we got a slightly better view. We stayed M-F and the hotel was definitely NOT at full capacity. You would think being a HH Gold member that they would of gone above and beyond to please us. If you are a frugal consumer like myself, then DO NOT order drinks from the hotel. We ordered a pina colada and margarita from the hotel bar and it cost $27. These were very small plastic glasses. Instead, walk to the Pueblo grocery store (walk past the Chili's approx 1/2 miles and pick up your beer/wine there). There are no rules against BYOB to the beach. If you really want to plan ahead, pack a little lunch cooler from home that you can fill up with ice in the hotel and pack your refreshment of choice. Was also disappointed/astonished with the breakfast offered. Again, being a HH member I received vouchers for free continental breakfast. Even with the voucher, you have to pay an additional $10 to receive any hot items (eggs, pancackes, etc). If you are not a HH member, the cold continental breakfast will cost you $15/pp...if you add hot items it goes up to $25/pp. However, if you walk about 1/4 mile to Don Jose's Restaurant you can order pancakes for $2.95!! Speaking of food, we ate a La Piccola one night. Food was good, however very $$$$$. Don't expect to leave for under $100-$125 for 2 people. Our server Michael was very very friendly. To save some money go eat at Platos restaurant (again, only 1/4 mile from the hotel). We ate there 2 out of 4 nights. Great local Puerto Rican cuisine and really friendly staff. To get to Old San Juan, be prepared to wait up to 30 mins for the bus outside the hotel. But for only $.75 is worth the wait (you must have exact change). The ride takes approx 45 mins. To address the noise complaints I will say this. Monday through Wednesday we didn't hear a peep. However, on Thursday around 1:30 am I woke up and could hear the music from the lobby (all the way on the 8th floor)!! Bottom line, there is a reason why Hilton HAS NOT put their name on the property even though they own it. If you are use to a typical Hilton hotel, then don't stay here! From what we heard, Hilton purchased this property some time back and bc of the recession they have not put money into much needed repairs!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: prweiss65
Reviews.Content: We were on a stop-over on the way home from a cruise, and we were blown away by how cool this place was. I can not think of one negative thing to say here. EVERYTHING was perfect about this hotel. Stunning pool(s), super cool modern rooms, hip happening lobby with two Starbucks inside and a little attached shopping mall. Okay, here's a little negative, the beach is just so-so. Not very Caribbean-like, but we didn't come for the beach. And with pool(s) and grounds as awesome as here, there was no reason to go to the beach anyway. This is definitely a top-rate resort and worth at least double what we paid it on Priceline. I would not hesitate to stay here again, for two nights next time. Bring your wallet if you plan to drink or eat in the hotel's restaurants. They are also top notch, and understandably EXPENSIVE. Please take note: the concierge recommended a local restaurant, Mi Casita, as a local alternative to eating in the hotel itself. See my review on that before choosing to do so. Had we known, we would have spent the extra money and dined in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant property!”
Reviews.Author: wbru83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights here in mid-December and we were very, very impressed. We travel a lot and are pretty picky but we can highly recommend this property. The main lobby area is very elegant, the pools are spacious and nicely maintained and the swim-up bar is always fun. The beach was pleasant and the drink service out at the beach was a nice bonus. We were in a junior suite and the room was very large. Don't bring a lot of toiletries, though - the bathroom was very small with almost no room for "stuff." That, however, was the only minor negative of an otherwise great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to see Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and it's right on the beach. The pool area is a great way to relax and enjoy the sun and service!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Scott L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El San Juan in May of 2011 for 5 days and the stay was fantastic. Susan Wilkerson went above and beyond my expectation. The resort was beautiful and all the staff was extremely helpful and always had a smile on their face. We came from Oregon so just wanted some nice sunny weather and a peaceful enjoyable pool/beach atmosphere. There was always plenty of chairs on the beach and by the pool. If you are looking for a convenient location to San Juan but the best access to the best beach in the San Juan/Carolina area this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazed!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Erika J
Reviews.Content: I am very happy and satisfied with my stay in your hotel! It was my second time in PR my first time was horrible, and I did not want to come back. But my children surprised me with this trip for my Birthday so I came. Ohhhhh was I sad and happy the day I checked out! Happy because the service was EXCELLENT and sad because I was leaving. I want to say in concierge their was this girl if I'm not mistaken her name was amanda or samantha I have to say AMAZING! She helped me and my family find places to go, to eat. And was so patient. Loved her!! My room amazing, roomservice excelent. One of the nights we went to Koco it was really good!! All in all I am really happy my kids and grandkids surprised me with going to PR. I was really sad the last time I went. Thankyou once again for your service and being so kind! Next time I'll be going with my girlfriends!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING STAY”
Reviews.Author: ronzelazo
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned about this hotel after reading a number of the negative reviews on tripadvisor. When we checked in, we were greeted by Ms. Wilkerson who treated us very well and gave us an excellent room with views on the beach. Everywhere in the hotel the staff was extremely friendly. The room was in excellent shape and the bathroom was modern and large. we especially enjoyed the free salsa band playing for hours in the lobby on friday night

Reviews.Title: “You're Kidding Me...”
Reviews.Author: Misty K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just completed a cruise and decided to stay at El San Juan on the night before we left town. The cab driver told us the hotel was very nice which made us very happy. The lobby, pool, and grounds are beautiful. If you don't stay in the hotel this would be great place to visit. The service is really bad at the restaurant by the pool. We waited 20 mins before we tracked down a person that worked there to see if we could get menu. Then we waited another 20 mins for someone to take our order. It was unreal. Later in the day we wanted a beer.. we waited 25 mins and could never get our order taken and got up to leave. We headed to our room in a building away from the main building. When we walked into the building we were horrified. It was extremely outdated, dirty with dishes, towels and bedding all in the hallway. Our room was EVEN WORSE! The toilet ran non-stop, the air conditioner did not adjust, we only freezing or none. We called Hilton Honors and the hotel manager, where we were blown off. There is mold and water stains on the ceiling, the carpet is nasty and old, the shower was gross, the patio deck had rusted chairs and the actual deck was failing apart. The worst part... the previous reviews are right the noise is unreal. People screaming, yelling, having sex, partying and loud music... it was horrible. We got no sleep and had a 10 hour flight the next day. Again, if you go to play at the hotel it is good place. If you are spending the night.. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “A 50th Celebration”
Reviews.Author: suziewong1961
Reviews.Content: Being a hotel snob, coming from Europe and traveled for many years, my standards are quite high!! This is a beautiful hotel and our rooms proved to be the same. On arrival we were early and rooms were swabbed so that my friends were next door. Hotel staff were friendly, professional and never stopped smiling. We were situated on the other side of the pool and the main hotel, which was peaceful. Our room was clean, bright and the cleaning crew again never stopped smiling! I celebrated my 50th on the beach and surrounding eateries with very friendly people in the and out of the hotel. If I had to find any fault with this hotel it would have to be the breakfast service which I felt was very pricey. Starbucks coffee at $5!! A little outrageous for Hot water don't you think?

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property”
Reviews.Author: kat60750
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pure opulence! The lobby is old hardwood mahogany and dark woods and the main bar is stunning. The casino didn't seem to do much business and after playing a slot machine for a few minutes, I could see why. The non-smoking policy was a bit troublesome for those who smoke but the atmosphere was beautiful and I can understand the reasoning behind it. The rooms were large and comfortable. Great beds! Five Stars all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Older Resort with an Amazing Pool Area!”
Reviews.Author: Leah G
Reviews.Content: My family visited the El San Juan over Christmas 2011. The resort grounds are a little bit old and dated but overall it is a beautiful resort. My favorite part of the resort was the pool area. It was extremely plush with oversize cabanas and comfortable areas to relax. We stayed in a garden lanai room which was very private and quiet. The beach at the resort is a little bit too rough to enjoy swimming. Also, don't miss the hot tub that is located beside the swim up bar. It was one of the nicest hotel hot tubs I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation to Puerto Rico - BEST BEST !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NJMICKEY
Reviews.Content: The hotel was spotless, the front desk people were the most professional I have met in a very long time. They were always there with a smile and helpful information. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Must See, and Must Stay, if you Can Get a Good Rate”
Reviews.Author: Emoskimo
Reviews.Content: The only drawback is the price. If you are able to get a good rate, grab it. If you've never stayed at El San Juan Resort, you'll wish you had the instant you step into the hotel lobby. This is one of the most unique hotels I've ever seen. Huge ceilings with antique wood frames and marble floors, style and glamour throughout. They often have life salsa in the lobby where people will dance. Also in the lobby, you'll find 3 completely separate and very stylish bars, each with a unique vibe that makes you want to stop and have a drink. A cozy little casino is off to the right, where you'll find a few blackjack tables, craps, and several slots. (They have $5 dollar minimum tables for guests who want to get more play out of their budget:) and free drinks are served while you play (by a gorgeous staff). The outdoor patio, pool, and beachfront are also where it's at. Several places to hang out, including rows of shady lounge couches, and a small pool bar with bar stools in the water. This pool area will make you want to drink, especially if with friends! Of course, drinks are around $11 each. By the beachfront, you can rent jetskis for $40 per hour, or get a massage in the sand. If you want real carribean cuisine, walk to Platos, which is 2 minutes walking to your left sangli exit the hotel. If you want to stay at the resort, there are SEVERAL restaurants within the resort, including a BBQ joint on the roof, Palm in the lobby (with a GREAT happy hour), as well as a few others (a Mexican, highly-rated Italian, and carribean place). There is also a small string of high end shops, souviner shops, and boutiques in the hotel. *They also have a small wine shop where they sell hand-rolled local cigars you may enjoy after a hard day at the pool :) They actually have an Enterprise car rental agency in the hotel, which can be convenient if you want to explore PR but don't want to hassle with it at the airport (note there are no kiosks for rental car agencies in the San Juan airport - you have to call them from numbers posted in the airport). The enterprise in the hotel opens at 8am... The basic rooms are set up in a spacious, lounge-like feel. White tile floors, low profile bed, trendy couch and sitting area. Clean rooms, comfortable bed. Isle verde is a $8-$10 cab ride to San Juan. It is really a relaxing and fun location to stay, even if your intention is to explore San Juan. An this resort has it all. I'm usually a little more practical with hotels, but I would easily spend the extra buck for a stay at El San Juan, because you really feel like a king in a playland at this resort and it's worth it, if even for 1 night. I paid $200 for 1 night in mid December. That was an awesome rate fir what I got. I know they charge a lot more in te high season... But I hope they lower it because there is a lot of solid competition in the area I would say a good rate is anything under $300. If this was useful, please click "useful" below. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “***BEST VACATION EVER!***”
Reviews.Author: Thrilled73
Reviews.Content: My wife, our twenty-year old children and I just stayed @ El San Juan from Christmas to New Years. ROOMS: spacious, quiet, adjoining, clean & cool. WEATHER: 11 straight 85 and sunny days. BEACH: each day, Javier had 4 lounges and an umbrella waiting for us on the waterfront, deserted edge of their mile-long beach. LOBBY & CASINO: none prettier or more spacious in PR. Luis is the friendliest croupier at roulette. BREAKFAST: free for diamond members. Servers Carlos, Garcia & Dianna couldn't do enough for you. Mgr Carolina Blanco was courteous and friendly. LUNCH: promptly served to you on the beach. DINNER: La Piccola Fontana's grilled shrimp over fresh pasta was spectacular! Palm? So-so. Yamato was a delicious and fun as Bennihanna. FRONT DESK: Mgrs Susan Wilkerson and Yvonne Ramos will make your stay best ever! Desk agents Ambar, Carlos & Sarahi treat you like royalty for every request! We would have stayed a few more days but flights back to Newark were totally booked. CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and relax”
Reviews.Author: setcarp
Reviews.Content: Wonderful pool and right next to the beach. Great restaurants inside and a Chili's right across the street. Casino attached is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy, forget sleeping resort”
Reviews.Author: JayserM
Reviews.Content: Our booking was a pre-cruise visit to San Juan and we chose this hotel based on a package offered for several days. This location made it easy to get to and from our interests in Puerto Rico and the resort had a good recommendation from TripAdvisor reviewers. We were warned about the party atmosphere at the resort, but took the advice and requested rooms away from the noisy area. I even wrote to the General Manager of the resort to let her know that one of us was revisiting the resort and had not been back to Puerto Rico in almost 40 years and was very much looking forward to the visit. I had hoped for a response to my request to be located away from the non stop noise and raucous guests but received no response at all. The front desk was staid and business like but totally non-responsive to our requests. What ever any guest can do to be housed away from the front entrance would be well worth the effort. The traffic, especially the honking and whistling to hail cabs, is non-stop all night. The drunken guests yelling and carrying on at the entrance allows several floors of guests above it, no sleep at all, even with the windows closed.

Reviews.Title: “Not your standard Hilton”
Reviews.Author: NewHoper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a six-night stay at the El San Juan and, while we truly did have a wonderful vacation, this isnâ€™t a hotel which we would choose again. Exactly a year ago we stayed at the Caribe Hilton and had a much better experience there. Our feelings not to return is partly due to simple personal preference: we prefer the tropical open-air and casual lobby/bar area of the Caribe as opposed to the ornate, overly air conditioned! lobby area of the El San Juan. We were also a bit put-off that there was a dress code in the lobby (but yet it seemed okay that young kids ran around playing tag and swinging on the beaded curtains of the swanky nightclub as visitors attempted to enjoy a quite evening cocktail). The pools and the grounds were very nice and comparable to the Caribe. Two things which we did like about the El San Juan over the Caribe is its location near many nice local restaurants and shops AND the very nice and wide beach area. As far as our room goes, we werenâ€™t too pleased at the El San Juan. While the room appeared to be clean, it needed some serious updating. The beauty and elegance of their lobby in no way matches that of their guest rooms. But our biggest complaint was the noise level and the fact that we could often smell cigarette smoke (itâ€™s supposedly a smoke-free hotel). We easily heard people coming and going from the rooms at all times of night and morning. [Incidentally, we left our San Juan trip and went straight to the Millennium Hilton in New York City to celebrate New Yearâ€™s Eve last night. That one-night stay really put things into perspective for us. It was SO, SO much more comfortable, sleek and amazingly quiet! Of all nights, Iâ€™m sure people were coming in at all times of the night, but we didnâ€™t hear one peep!] Since my husband is a Hilton Diamond member he has stayed at many different Hiltons and he felt (and I agree) that the El San Juan just isnâ€™t up to the usual Hilton standard of hotels. One cab driver in Puerto Rico put it perfectly: when it used to be a Waldorf, the rooms were very nice and worthy of the Waldorf name. Now, the hotel clearly puts its money into where they get their biggest profit: the bars, restaurants and casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are atrocious.”
Reviews.Author: CSC28970
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Puerto Rico -- and found that the rooms at El San Juan were a major disappointment, something that we heard from other guests too. The furnishings in the room (for a 499 dollar hotel, mind you) were as low-quality as you can imagine, and the room was the opposite of what a hotel room is supposed to be: uncomfortable. (Never mind that the rooms look over an acre of air conditioning units.) Moreover, screws were loose on many drawers, rust was on virtually every piece of metal (and rust stood on every treadmill in their gym), and the whole room, from floor to furniture, looked like formica. In other words, the rooms were as low a quality can be imagined -- more like a $50 place and not a $500 place. We tried to find another room at another hotel and could not -- because everything was full. Suffice it to say that while we may go back to Puerto Rico, we're not going anywhere near the El San Juan. .

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel that has it all.”
Reviews.Author: Juliegal3949
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our two adult children, stayed five nights at the Hotel. We travel all over and I was reluctant because of some reviews I read. Our visit was fabulous. It took ten minutes to check in with one of the many courteous and efficient staff members. The pool area was wonderful with very nice pool/ bar staff. Every member seemed to be "running" to make everything perfect. My one suggestion would be to have a kids pool and adults only pool. It's certainly not the hotels fault, but some parents do not correct their children and let them run wild. The beach area was great. Umbrellas and chairs were provided for quest. Also, other water sports were available for rent. The bars and casino was great. I just wish the slot machines would have been as lucky as the tables!! We ate at all of the restaurants. They were very good. The morning Buffett is lovely and I just wish, again, that parents would correct their children. Playing bouncy ball indoors is inappropriate in a hotel of this caliber. As stated before this was not the hotel's fault, but parents unwilling to correct rude, unruly youngsters. We rated the trip as one of the best taken. We found efficient, polite, staff going beyond their call of duty. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone. Yes, we did check to confirm our reservation. Yes, we did take documentation of reservations for verification if needed. Again, we thank every member of your staff for a wonderful vacation in a gorgeous clean hotel. Also, please realize that the people of Puerto Rico are more relaxed and do not have a "New York state of mind" I personally was offended by the way some of the guest treated the staff. I was embarrassed that any human could treat the Puerto Ricans as some guest did. My deepest regret for anyone who experienced these people. Though we are Protestant, we visited a beautiful Catholic church nearby with a wonderful service. Many thanks for your hospitality. You all are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: sas30274
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the El San Juan Resort for her birthday. I must say Ali the Concierge Specialist is the best. He made all of our dinner reservations for us each night and made sure we had a reserved table when they had events going on at the hotel as well...We stayed in the Junior Suite which was really nice. The only complaint was the shower. The shower had a curtain as a door and we never experienced nothing like that so it was a shock. For that hotel to be so beautiful the bathroom really need to be upgraded. Besides that it was wonderful. We traveled to Old San Juan for shopping which was a $20 cab ride there. My baby was sooo happy especially to play in the casino every night. I wish we could've stayed longer to lay out on the beach, but we will be back.....again thank you Ali for everything you are AWESOME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Lo B
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 3 nights. Amazing service by all the staff. The rooms were very clean and we had a great view facing the ocean. Plenty of pools inside the resort along with jacuzzi and hot tub. At night they have entertainment in the lobby and Club Brava. Definitely will stay at El San Juan on my next trip to Puerto Rico!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel property”
Reviews.Author: 739katiethetraveler
Reviews.Content: Visited property for 2nd time and stayed for the 1st. Great property with a lot to offer, especially for people who want to have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: obnc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the El San Juan Resort because or a booking error. We were originally booked at the Condado Hilton, but since the reservation system had a problem Hilton rebooked us, at no charge, in their beach resort close to the airport. The ESJ resort is very nice! We stayed in one of the outer buildings by the pool. The room was large and comfortable with a nice view overlooking the pool and garden area. There is a casino and many nice restaurants. It's a little expensive and you'll have to dress nicely in the evening to go to the restaurants. If you're looking for a special place in San Juan I'd recommend the El San Juan resort.The hotel is close to the airport, so be prepared for the jet noise. It's also a $20 cab ride, each way, to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “This seasons update from one of the loyal guests”
Reviews.Author: pandg27
Reviews.Content: Okay, the room ( Garden Lanai ground floor) still is old and in dire need of renovation. The beach and outside menu has improved.The staff is still great and really caring. I now think the Palm is better than the Piccolo Fontana. The prices in both will blow you away. I expect that. Christmas is not a good time to come if you want some quiet and privacy. Not here at this time. I am recovering as I write this from (not a manicure) but merely someone to remove clear nail polish, and re polish with same $16+ some absurd tax. If you come bring your own remover and polish. A small thing but shocking even here in the land of $20.00 for glass of prosecco. Nevertheless I will keep coming back for the convenience ,get on a plane, get off the plane and go to the beach. And once again the staff is super.

Reviews.Title: “Interior was beautiful, but had many downsides”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie88186338
Reviews.Content: My mother always has wanted to stay at the Waldorf-Astoria. When we found this hotel, we were extremely pleased to discover that the El San Juan Resort & Casino was part of the Waldorf-Astoria collection. The interior was absolutely grand and very posh. But the staff was very variable. We had a $100 resort credit, and we confirmed with at least 3 different agents that this resort credit could be used for room service food and the towel hut. So when we checked out we were very surprised to find out that our resort credit was not valid. After pleading with the agent, she finally gave us some of the credit-----it was a rude reminder that inadequate staff training can show up on your bill at checkout.Also the proximity to the airport can have its pros and cons. Room cleaning is variable from day to day.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise respite”
Reviews.Author: SoCoRealtor
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights prior to jumping on a Caribbean cruise. Lovely hotel within 5 minutes and $10 from airport. Arrived around 1 pm and were able to pre-check in (room not available until 3 pm), leave bags, change into a bathing suit at the poolside cabanna, and within 1/2 hour of arrival was having a cocktail and lunch by the pool/beach. As I dozed lazily on a very comfy lounge my cell beeped with a message..."your room is now ready...come at your leisure". How civilized. Our room was on the 8th floor and clean, very modern (aka like a W Hotel style for those who know). Ocean view - ahh, what a great way to get into the vacation mode. We dined one night at KoKo's (delish) and sampled Vodka's in one of the fabulous lobby bars. A quick turn in the Casino left us $200 richer. A reasonable $25 cab ride into Old Town for shopping and lunch. There is a nice long beach to walk on, several local restaurants within walking distance if you don't want to dine in the hotel. Also drugstore and grocery store within walking distance as we needed a few supplies for our trip. All in all, a very pleasant stay and would definitely do the "pre-cruise" stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Break”
Reviews.Author: Peter918
Reviews.Content: Arrived around midnight to have the staff waiting for us and had a splendid room to welcome us.Service people were very polite and just real considerate to my wife and 8 year old daughter.The grounds were very clean loved the pool and surrounding beach areas were also really clean.We were placed in a nice quite room no sound issues,and even had someone check on us to make sure we settled in ok after arrival.We had room service for dinner a couple of nights and of course theres always a premium when ordering room service but the food ordered was great and made it easy for us to relax and enjoy the actual room after being out all day.Susan was great and super accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: zephyrgirl13
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay at the El San Juan and had a great time. I went with a friend for a relaxing trip before the Christmas holidays. We booked through Orbitz and stayed in the Garden Lanis section, which was very quiet and pleasant. Our room was nice and housekeeping was excellent. The pool area is pretty breathtaking, with tons of comfortable places to stretch out in the sun or in the shade (including hammocks if you are so inclined). They play some relaxing techno music around the pool area. I was very impressed with the pools. There are 3 big ones in addition to the hidden hot tub, which is really nice. The water is kept clean but is not overly treated like some places, thankfully. The beach is not the nicest and to be honest I had expected more from what I've read about Isla Verde beach. There is a lot of seaweed in the water (which I realize can't be helped) but there is no effort made to keep the beach clear. The sand is pretty rough with tar as well. But hey, a beach is a beach and I do love the beach :) As far as service at the hotel, we only ate at one restaurant which was the italian place in the galleria section. I do not recommend it, service was slow and the food was overpriced and pretty blah. Service at the bars poolside was also very slow and drinks are pricey ($11 for a mixed drink). Local restaurants we enjoyed were Mi Casita and Metropol (recommend reservations for Metropol if you are going at prime dinner time). I also enjoyed Mediterranean cafe on the beach that is attached to the Intercontinental hotel, the food was fresh and service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historical hotel, but not perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: CaptainK74
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the El San Juan Resort, even an experienced traveler will be blown away by the beautifully furnished and lit lobby filled with spectacular decorations and bars. The casino is truly excellent as well. The hotel has three pools and several hot tubs right up against the beach. This is also a beautiful area and is worth spending a great deal of time at. For critique, I must say that service could be much better at the poolside restaurant. To be fair, we didn't eat at all restaurants in the hotel, so I can't speak for all. Prices at poolside were outrageous- 13 dollars for a chicken sandwich and 16 for a Cobb salad, for instance. Additionally, it took a long time to give our order and to receive the bill. The rooms are spacious, but many offer only a view of a badly worn roof. I will counter by saying that if you have no plans of leaving your room, why even go on vacation? The biggest legitimate complaint would be its distance from Old San Juan. It's a 25 dollar taxi ride away. Carolina doesn't offer a whole lot in adjacent areas. All in all, a good stay. We got our room for 100 dollars on priceline. For that price, it's hard to beat El San Juan. Beautiful property that is timeless in nature. Pool areas and beach access are also top notch.

Reviews.Title: “A classic.”
Reviews.Author: OlyUSC
Reviews.Content: Very convenient airport hotel on a great beach. This is an old classic property. Feels like the Rat Pack has just left. Great lobby bar to relax and people watch. If you are alone, dinner at the bar of the Palm restaurant is a good choice. The breakfast buffet is excellent. The " continental" is the best so no need pay the higher price just for some eggs and bacon. Good gym up on the top floor, but lacking windows, feels like your in a cave. Do your cardio outside by running on their great beach and then cool down in the ocean. The rooms are large and offer living area. Only complaint is anytime you need to engage with the reception desk there is a long wait.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were not impressive!”
Reviews.Author: Macka_a
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only spent one night at the El San Juan Resort and Casino on a trip through to Vieques. I would likely not stay here again nor would I recommend it to friends. Our thoughts: Pros: Lots of character in the lobby area Large pool facility with plenty of seating Accommodated a VERY early check in without hesitation (we arrived at the hotel from an overnight flight at 7am and were exhausted after traveling for over 12 hours) For me, the TWO on-site Starbucks were a plus Cons: General room upkeep - quite a bit of wear and tear Rooms were NOT very clean! Depending on where you want to be/what you want to do....the location was not ideal for us. Looking back, we should have stayed closer to Old San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: TravelersABC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms are showing their age with overall wear throughout the room. The beach chairs are also well past their prime with stains and tears. I did not feel the pools and hot tubs were well kept throughout the day and they showed quite a bit of dirt. It's a nice property which includes shops and restaurants on site. The lobby is beautifully maintained, I just wished they would give the same care to the other parts of the property. It was just ok, not the quality of property I come to expect with Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lyle S
Reviews.Content: I had some uncertainties after reading some mixed reviews because I was traveling with my two year old son. I took advice from some reviews I read and emailed Susan Wilkerson prior to arrival. I voiced my concern about the noise and requested a room away from noise. She put us in room 833 which is on the 8th floor and we had no noise issues so we got plenty of rest as one should when vacationing for 9 days. We had some minor issues with the room and were upgraded to a beautiful ocean front for final few days. We also received a generous hotel credit and Susan Wilkerson sent us a nice wine and cheese plate for our inconvenience. The resort area (pools and beach)is awesome and there are a number of pools, hot tubs, and also an ample amount of lounge chairs spead over the resort area. The lobby and shopping areas are incredible and the lobby doubles for a nightlife area from thursday to Sunday. That's not my thing but it did not affect me one way or the other. The rooms are in need of updating which I think everyone on staff is aware of. But what is lacking in this area was definitely made up for by the exceptional and friendly staff who went out of there way to make our stay at the El San Juan and enjoyable one. Eight floor housekeeping supervisor was awsome and extremely helpful as well as all her staff. I wish I was better at remembering names because so many people there were extremely friendly and helpful. There are some many places to eat nearby for whatever your taste may be. There is a grocery store a block away if was very helpful since I have a two year old son. We bought a cooler there and kept our milk and fresh fruit in there which was a huge help. Walgreens is very close,chilies is across the street. I reccomended trying lupis, metropol,palm which is in the hotel, and all the local spots around the hotel. Puerto Rico exceeded my expectations and is a must see. We went to Culebra island,luquillo beach, el yunque,old San Juan, and reccomend them all. We stayed from december 2-10 and overall it was a pleasant experience at the el San Juan. Thank you to Susan and all of her wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hilton Standards- Would not chose again or refer to clients.”
Reviews.Author: NMF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel Dec 8-12th for a quick honeymoon after our wedding in Key West. I expected it to be first class service and nice rooms. Overall, average to poor experience. Check in, we had to wait till 4 to get a room, the front desk gave us no information on the hotel, where to eat, any ammenties etc. Just handed us a key. Pros: Nice lobby, beautiful and historic Good location from airport and Old San Juan- quick cab ride $20 spent 2 days in town Casino good for a location in San Juan Pool is large and has nice chairs, hot tubs, good layout. Cons: Room is very modern which would be fine if it was clean! The furniture is white and filthy, bedspread was not clean, wallpaper falling off in bath, tile old in bathroom and shower all moldy, floors are tile and were filthy the maid never cleaned them the whole time we were there even after complaining. They also never cleaned the bathroom, just made bed and left towels. They are lacking information in regards to the hotel, restaurants, activites, hours of shops etc..there was no info book in the room. No info on wireless, room service etc..not usual for upscale hotel. Maid was cleaning rooms next to us at 830am moving furniture, loud music, singing, woke us up, very rude. Went up to my room on Saturday night and there were 5 policeman lined up in the hall guarding the room next to mine, they were hauling out people and allot of commotion going on. Not a good feeling. The beach even though I know the hotel does not control, was filthy. Cigarette butts, garbage everywhere, chairs old, police driving back and forth, just felt like a dirty city beach. Went down to the Ritz Carlton right next door, the beach there beautiful and clean and service excellent for same room rates. Overall, it is a party hotel where they have allot of local events and hot night club. I would not stay here again or refer my clients unless they wanted a total party hotel, not a place to relax and good service or clean rooms. I stayed at the Ritz a few blocks down for the same price, service excellent, beach clean and nice, pool smaller but plenty of chairs. Rooms clean and fresh. I travel often overall the trip was good, loved Old San Juan. But just disappointed in the quality of this Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Best time ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah F
Reviews.Content: I recently came back from Puerto Rico from a stay at the El San Juan Resort, and i wish i was back back back! My girlfriend and I needed to get out of dodge and relax and play and we did just that! we had a spectacular view; the room was awesome and the bed was riduculously comfortable. There is a grocery/liquor store right around the corner, the water was 83 degrees and the pool and jacuzzi were so awesome, especially the jacuzzi...the nightclub was pumping and so was the casino!! Hot guys too:)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: TopDad52
Reviews.Content: Of course one stays in a hotel because of the room, amenities, etc. In that respect the El San Juan does not disappoint. However, it is the amazing staff members we met that made our stay truly memorable. Upon check-in we told Tania at the desk that we were on our honeymoon. She immediately upgraded us to a Jr. Suit. She later gifted us with chamagne and chocolate covered strawberries. The room was lovely with a partial ocean view on the top floor. We next met Yolanda Ramos, assistant front office manager. She guaranteed us late check out. A second bottle of champage and more strawberries were the compliments of the concierge, Kamil Segarra. I cannot stree enough how totally welcomed and comfortble we were made to feel being a gay honeymoon couple. We departed with hugs all around! The hotel and it's marvelous staff are highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “In_professional services... Lack of high standards towards clients.”
Reviews.Author: WSH-RH
Reviews.Content: The San Juan Hotel and Casino is no longer the gem it used to be. The staff is unable to provide the quality of service It's usual clientele was used to. I just called to find information in reference to a hotel activity and was given the usual run around about this request. I was transfered to the concierge for the second time after four telephone transfers and the lady opted to hang the phone without a response. No one that spoke to me was capable of just stating that they had no information on the matter. With the exception of the gentleman that took my call for a reservation_ whom was capable to carry its job with a high degree of professionalism_ the rest of the staff needs to be re_trained on tourism costumers service standards. I have been a client of the hotel since very young. Therefore, I can testify of the poor quality of the service that the hotel is currently providing. Be aware that if you speak Spanish... The staff approach to do business is extremely un_professional. In summation, the administration of the hotel needs to address these issues with a higher level within the hotel priority list. Your staff is your image and currently the face of your image falls into very low standards. I have no other choice than to find another hotel for my stay. Respectfully your, WSH

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in Isla verde”
Reviews.Author: virtualGoat
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place for me in Isla verde. Plenty of things to do in the hotel. Best hilton stay in 2011. Some tips: 1. Bring some semi-format attire, will need it for the Latin dance over the weekend and also for the clubs. 2. Take the tours for the rainforest, but skip the ones for the cave. 3. Beach and pool are the best, but dont wear bright blue (that seems to be the staff dress code)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property, beautiful beach and great service”
Reviews.Author: katie_travel_1
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at the El San Juan. It's a lovely property, spread out on a nice beach (Isla Verde). The property has 3 great pools, 3 hot tubs, plenty of comfortable lounging chairs, swim up bar, food/drink service on the beach, Oceanside massages, spa, shopping, and tons of nice restaurants to choose from (within the property). It's a perfect couples getaway. The lobby lounge has salsa dancing on the weekends which was great fun, and had a classy vibe, and there is also a nightclub - Brava, which is pretty good (Nothing different if you are from NYC or Philly, but a cool club if you are in the mood for clubbing). The resort also has tennis courts (not in mint condition, but a good nice to have) and Oceanside yoga classes (these were great). The service in the resort was outstanding. The pool swim up bar folks gave us a free drink when our food was late - for which we never even complained, cos who wants a fast pace at a beach resort? It's all about relaxing and losing sight of time. We reached out to Susan Wilkerson before we left, and received an immediate reply, and ample upgrades and rewards as well, so a special thank you to her. Driving in PR is not exactly like driving on the mainland - but there is a concierge who helped us with bio-bay tours, and an on-site enterprise. We had rented a car from the airport itself, which was not exactly necessary, but definitely helpful. The location of this hotel is pretty convenient as well. I highly recommend this hotel, esp for couples or families with bigger children/friends travelling together.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: ocatlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the ESJ resort for a week and just loved it. Before we booked our vacation I reached out to Susan Wilkerson, a manager at the hotel, to ask a few questions about the hotel as weâ€™re traveling with 4 adults and a child and she responded to our e-mail immediately and then was very helpful and welcoming when we arrived. She made sure our rooms were next to each other and went out of her way to situate us in perfect family-friendly accommodations. (Susan, THANK YOU!) The hotel is absolutely gorgeous both inside and out. The beach was the best in the area and the staff superb. We really felt welcome the entire time we stayed there. As soon as we walked into the pool/beach area we were offered beach toys for my daughter, just a priceless touch. The hotel offers lots of entertainment with lots of live music (yet the rooms are quiet), casino, outdoor dining, etc. The drinks and food are a bit pricey, but the mojito was the best Iâ€™ve ever had. We had dinners in Old San Juan. The hotel is within walking distance to lots of breakfast places and lunch options as well. I hope we get to go back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean and Palm trees”
Reviews.Author: Chr1
Reviews.Content: A nice property, great pools, easy access to the ocean and very close to the airport (at the most 15 minutes). Nice spacious room in one of the houses close to the ocean front. Overall very clean, but a little battered furniture. I don't know many hotels in the Caribbean, but this seems to be a nice place. But, you got to do something about the service. Check in takes ages. After a room change, my luggage wasn't transferred, instead the old room stood wide open, so that anybody could have taken my stuff. Even the service at Starbucks was lousy. Nobody, except one last bell boy and one big lady working the late shift at Starbucks seems to give a *** about having you as a guest. Well, under a good management it could be a paradise. Now it's just average. But, to be honest, it's not expensive - and if you love to party hard, it seems to be the place.

Reviews.Title: “Service needs improvement (more staff needed)”
Reviews.Author: JSMinMN
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort. the pool area is very impressive and the mulitple lobby bars are really cool. The rooms are nice, but a bit worn and in need of updating. The big problem is the slow service at the front desk. Nice and helpful people, but long lines and only one person usually working. I stayed there twice on my last trip and had to wait in line 4 different times. For the price you pay, I expected better. I get faster service at Hilton Garden Inn's. Oh, one other bonus is they have Miller Lite at the pool bar. $8 a bottle, but nice to have it, as it can be a bit hard to find on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: yentabecky
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the El San Juan Hotel and Casino. Overall, it was a good experience but, it could have been better. We e-mailed them a couple of days ahead asking for an early check in. When we arrived, no room was available and there did not seem to be a record of our e-mail. We left our cell phone number with the woman at check in as she said she would call us when a room was ready. Had we not gone back to the front desk to inquire, we might still be waiting. While we waited for our room, we went to out back to the bar where there was also a menu to order from. The staff was too busy chatting amongst themselves to acknowledge us so we moved to a table and got service. Our package included free breakfast which was a good thing since it came to $53.50 for two people before a tip for a buffet breakfast. The food was not very good and it took the staff too long to replenish items. While we were at the pool, a representative from the hotel approached us to ask a few questions about the service at the hotel. We told her about our experience and she told us that they were concerned about the level of service at the hotel which is why she was surveying customers. She was very apologetic. The next morning, she and another manager were in the restaurant at breakfast, helping the staff to provide better service and it seemed to make a difference. That afternoon, the same representative (Lisette) sent a fruit and cheese plate to our room with a note of apology for any inconvenience we may have experienced. The bathroom at the pool was poorly attended. If you went early in the day it was OK but, after a couple of hours, it could make you gag. We rented a car to go to El Yunque Rainforest and Luquillo Beach. We were able to rent the car next door at the Intercontinental Hotel for $10 less than ESJ wanted. Overall, we had a great time and would not hesitate to go back to San Juan but, we will look at other hotel options.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN ISA LA VERDE”
Reviews.Author: Michael-Carmen
Reviews.Content: MY wife and returned to this hotel after a dismal visit last year, and i must say the hotel has improved over 1,000 percent. THe staff was the BEST part MS suscan Wilkersom and her assistant Ms Ramos deserve a loud applause as there hard work and concern of the guests in the hotel went beyond the defenition of care.our room by the beach front was beautiful . It was very clean and the view was wow of the beach and water.The pool was so relaxing especially the new floating rafts they now have dont miss these. As everonr from the pool staff, the inside staff including check in etc were so polite and very friendly. My wife and i when we return next year to puerto rico are looking foward to seeing MS wilkersom and her staff as when you stay here you are in good hands and even if you encounter a problem Ms wilkerson and her staff will be there to help you

Reviews.Title: “Good with a few things to look out for”
Reviews.Author: niliwear
Reviews.Content: Overall, the staff was very friendly. When you first walk in, you think its just a hotel, but the grounds are set up as a resort which is exactly what I went for...pool, beach, swim up bar, whirlpool, etc. Very relaxing time and the fact that the hotel was not super busy helped. The room was fine, but the bathroom small, with a bit of need for maintenance with a standup shower only that can barely fit two people if you're looking to have romantic showers. Because the decor was mainly white, stains showed up on everything which if you're sensitive to that kind of thing, stands out. Walls are paper thin also so beware. There was an adjoining room and I heard every bit of conversation and laughter. From a budget standpoint, BEWARE. I specifically asked about fees upon checking in and was told that everything was paid for. All I put down was the incidental deposit of $200. Imagine my surprise when I got back less than a $100!! The resort fee of $21 a day was something I should have known according to the front desk. If I pre-paid for my hotel and flight via a third party, any other fees should have been mentioned upon check-in. As someone who planned for this trip and budgeted and spent according to my means, I was very upset and the hotel was unapologetic and unaccomodating. My rate plan did come with breakfast which was $25 a day so I guess they got their money back. Speaking of breakfast, $53 dollars for the buffet for two people, and its continental breakfast with a small omelette station, bacon, sausage, potatoes and mini pancakes. If you go the contiental route only, its about $32 for two people. There was no local breakfast option. You should consider walking down the block to the left of the resort for other options. Don Juan was good for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Avg plate about $12. Walgreens is also down the block so if you get your own drinks including wine, you'd save tons of money. Ice machine in the hotel and some plastic cups you'll save yourself a lot of money. Hotel is packed on thursday to sat. Band and DJ plays in the lobby and there's dancing along with two bars. This is what you see when you walk into the hotel. There's also a club in the hotel so during these nights, definitely not a family hotel. Miscellaneous details...hotel is 7 min from hotel which is nice. Cab ride about $14 to $16 without the meter. Cab to Old San Juan is $20. Hotel is on the bus route which is .75. Its about an hour ride, but not bad if you have the time and want to do something local. Went to the fort which was a great piece of history and went to La Bambanero restaurant on San Francisco St. Old school restaurant but you must try the Mallorca sandwhich (sweet bread, pressed with butter, cheese, eggs). All in all, a good hotel in a good location for friends, couples or solo. Just be aware of your budget and take advantage of when to save money if that's a factor.

Reviews.Title: “More good than bad”
Reviews.Author: MsMahjongg
Reviews.Content: Like the previous poster, we also attended a wedding last weekend but we had planned to stay a few days longer and so just came home a couple of days ago. I'd have to give the hotel a mixed review but since there is more good than bad, I'll start with the cons. 1. Personnel - While everyone was very polite, they do have a staffing shortage at times. We encountered a problem on Saturday night and the one person at the desk could not help mostly because she was on all alone, doing check-ins, answering phones, trying to do everything, and stated that she would be on all alone until 7AM. I asked her to call a supervisor but she said none was available to call. I would not expect ANY period without supervision from a Hilton hotel of this size. 2. The resort charge, at 14%, doesn't include much - the use of the pool and fitness center, facilities that used to be included in the room charge until a few years ago. This was annoying, but I realize tacking on resort fees is a trend many hotels follow these days. 3. Problems with the Wifi-it took several days and two technicians to resolve them, and only by disconnecting me from Wi-fi altogether and hooking up some other piece that I returned when leaving. Now home, I can't get my computer to recognize the Wifi in my house and have to pay for a professional to come and resolve this. 4. Unexpected charges - there were several unexpected charges on our bill - $2.00 a day maid service and $10.50 for the bellhop. Since only the resort fees and taxes were disclosed when I made my reservation, I had already tipped the bellhop $10 when we arrived and the maid $5 a day. I wasn't about to tip again for the same service. At first they told me they could do nothing, that this was the contract made by the person who arranged the wedding. After I insisted my contract was with them, not the wedding host, and that they never disclosed the charge or I wouldn't have tipped separately, they did remove the charges. There were also charges for using the phone, which I had them remove since I used it at their direction to call AT&T in an attempt to get the Wifi working, as well as a charge for breakfast one day at the hotel, which we never had. This too was removed. The pros: 1. Susan Wilkerson - I agree with previous posters who called her an asset to the hotel. Having read about the noise, I e-mailed ahead and reconfirmed my request for a high floor and was given a room on the 9th floor. Perfectly quiet, and the room was spacious, and despite other people's experiences, our bathroom was a reasonable size. The room also overlooked the ocean and the bed was very comfortable. 2. They did make good on my inconvenience concerning the WiFi. I used the business center several times while it wasn't working, and at my request, they took the charges I had to pay for that use off the hotel bill, as well as any charges for the little bit they did get our computer working. 3. The casino was just the right size - not overwhelmingly big but with plenty of variety and plenty of penny slots for those of us who aren't big betters but enjoy playing. 4. On Friday night the lobby was a magnificent display of entertainment and dance which was nice to watch at our own convenience, when noise was not an issue to us. This continued to a lesser extent on other days during the week. 5. The wedding set-up was lovely and they were able to make last minute arrangements to change seating when a short rain rendered the original area too wet to sit in comfort. 6. We did try several of the restaurants for dinner. They are overpriced in general, but each had a fixed price menu that was reasonable and with adequate choice, and by sticking to that, we got the good food and lovely atmosphere without breaking the bank. 7. Maid service was timely and adequate each day. They also provided turn-down service. 8. The two pools were lovely and I had no trouble getting towels or finding chairs. Would I go back again? Yes, but I'd ask ahead of time if any gratuities would be charged, make sure I get a high floor room again, and e-mail Susan Wilkerson again in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Geared towards nightlife, not a family hotel”
Reviews.Author: LGross13
Reviews.Content: My family (my husband, 2 year old daughter and I) stayed at this hotel for a long weekend with a "discounted" rate, as we were part of a group staying at the hotel for a Sunday wedding. The resort fees and taxes are estimated fairly well in the confirmation email received after we booked, besides the $10.50 bellman charge (I have never seen a hotel that charges for a bell hop service in my life!) and the daily maid gratuity, which is mandatory, whether they clean the room or not. Having seen our room was not cleaned one day, we requested maid service from the front desk at 5pm. We came back to a dirty room at 10pm. At check-out they would not remove the maid gratuity for that day. Being that it was only $2.00, not something I wanted to fight over, but it shows poor customer service in my opinion. The front desk and concierge were never overly friendly or helpful during our stay. The staff working grounds maintenance were always smiling and greeting you as you walked by, and were much more polite than the staff that is supposed to be service-oriented. Knowing other people staying at the hotel, we got to see a variety of room layouts and we certainly got the worst room of the group. We were in the main building (which has been renovated with a modern decor) right next to the elevator in room 726. Besides having to hear drunk guests shouting all night (which I know is not the hotel's fault) the elevator cables would bang against the wall, directly above the headboard of our bed every time the elevator passed. Our room overall, was smaller than others we saw in the main building and the bathroom was SO SO small, you could not open and close the door without squeezing passed the door as it swung shut. There was no counter space for toiletries, and the small shower had no tub (it's hard to shower a toddler, a tub would have been more convenient for a family). Even in the bigger bathrooms I saw in the main building, there is no place to hang dry clothing, which I really think is an important function of a pool/beach hotel. None of the rooms in the main building had balconies. I heard from other people in our party that levels 5 and below heard the night club or lobby music (which is very loud in the evenings) in the rooms. The garden building had larger rooms, larger bathrooms (with bathtubs), a walk-in closet as well as patios or balconies. They were not renovated, so the styling was older. We requested to move to the garden building after the first night experiencing the noise level in our room, but we were told the building was full. If you stay here, request the garden building and sacrifice the style for function and space! The pools, beach and general grounds were clean and well maintained. I notice some reviews complaining about the seaweed on the beach, but I did see a machine raking it in the early mornings so at least they attempt to clean it. The beach is not fantastic for a tropical location, so if that it what you are looking for, choose a hotel on the east side of the island. The pool towels are small and dingy, plain and simple. There is a Walgreen's within walking distance, that sells beach towels for $4. A worthy investment in my opinion. The pool hut runs out of clean towels by the afternoon, so grab a towel in the morning and keep it! We made the mistake of turning our wet towels in too early on the first day, expecting to be able to get fresh towels for our afternoon swim. A note about the main building: cover-ups are required in the lobby. Personally, I don't see the need for the rule, but I respected it. But, I hated having to get my cover-up wet just to walk through the lobby, knowing there was no place in the room to hang it up to dry. The pool bar and restaurant was way overpriced, had bad food and bad service. The rum drinks (with not a lot of rum in them) were $12 and lunch items $12-$15, which wouldn't be so bad if the food was any good. We did not eat breakfast or dinner at the resort so I can't comment on those. There is a cafe close by ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/piu-bello-gelato-isla-verde ) that had good breakfast food at reasonable prices. There is a Mexican restaurant right next door to the hotel that may be tempting to visit, but we had horrible food and service there ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/lupis-mexican-grill-isla-verde ). I suggest you walk a little further and eat here ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/platos-carolina ) where the service was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with much to offer”
Reviews.Author: Amy S
Reviews.Content: This resort is about 5 minutes from the airport and has a lovely pool area facing the beach...also nice. It used to be a Waldof Astoria but is now a Hilton. On site food is expensive (breakfast buffet $15-$25) but a good selection. Service is slow in the breakfast area. Eat inside as the birds land on your food and tables on the outer terrace. A screen would be helpful and would still allow for visualization of the water. Lobby area is big with several bars, a gambling casino, stores, and is truly a happening place at night. Beyond the downstairs area, the rooms are standard rooms with showers (retro in appearance). There was not a hair dryer in the room so we had to ask for one. Also, no coffee pot. The in-room safe was convenient. The work out room could have been cleaner. Mirrors/windows filthy. Opened at 0800 on Sunday. Overall, it is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel - especially if on business”
Reviews.Author: ModernNomad001
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel to be avoided, especially if you are coming on business. I am gold in multiple hotel programs, travel a lot, and have very rarely said that about a hotel. I can be happy with a Hilton Garden Inn which is well maintained and properly staff â€“ this hotel fails that standard at much, much higher room rates. Not even sure where to start. The walls are paper thin, good luck if you want to sleep (ask them if people ever call to complain about noise, they do). Planning to work at the â€˜deskâ€™? It has a barely padded chair which is very uncomfortable; not adequate for a 5 minute sit let alone hours of work. For part of the furnishings there are â€“ I kid you not - actually a chair and a lamp made out of cheap clear plastic (the kind of stuff you might see at a Motel 6). The wood rail outside the room looks like it has not been painted in years, the paint is cracking a peeling. There is a small table in the bathroom that is rusting. There are dust balls in the corners of the room, black spots on the ceiling (mold?). The beds do not have box springs. The ironing board is one of those tiny ones (1/3 size? Elf size?). They want to charge you $10 for a bottle of water in your room and nearly $6 for a 1.5 liter bottle in the gift shop; and a can of coke is $2+ in the shop (there is a Walgreens a couple doors down where you can buy goods for reasonable prices). I could go on but I am sure you got the idea. This is a very, very tired property in desperate need of renovation.
