And the staff is erratic, some are very lovely people and others are just downright rude; but even with the nice ones you can tell the training has been woefully inadequate. It is a real shame, Puerto Rice itself is amazing place and they are some amazing hotels here (La Concha by Renaissance, Hilton Caribe, and the Sheraton by the convention center â€“ which by the way is amazing if you are just here on business, unfortunately it is not by the beach).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - Not as nice as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: hobiecatsailor
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel. Leading up to my stay I had high expectations of this property because I had heard nothing but good reviews about it. From the valet parking attendant to the front desk check in, I was unimpressed by the cold, unfriendly service I received. In comparison with the atmosphere of the Conrad Hotel in Condado, where I frequently stay during my trips to San Juan, the service was not measuring up. After checking in and making my way to my room, I did not like it as much as the caliber of room that I usually receive at the Conrad Hotel in Condado, San Juan. The bathroom in particular was very small in comparison and there is some noticeable wear and tear in the shower tiles. The bathroom was not clean upon my arrival and I had to call housekeeping to come to the room to clean it more thoroughly before I could use it. It took 1/2 hour to get the housekeeping staff to the room. Once they arrived, they had a attitude that was less than service oriented and I was given the impression that it was a hassle for them. The view from the room was looking down on all of the A/C units on the roof and there was a considerable amount of noise coming from them. The noise from the planes taking off and landing at the nearby airport continued throughout the day and night. If you are going to stay in Isla Verde just plan on hearing loud noise from the nearby airport, it is inevitable. There are several restaurants and shops within the hotel and this is nice. I also liked the fact that they have 2 Starbuck's locations within the hotel. This just is not my idea of a nice vacation...it felt cold, impersonal, and too large for my style.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Mini-Get Away...”
Reviews.Author: leebritt1022
Reviews.Content: My sister and I (24 and 29 years old) from Baltimore, MD just recently visited the El San Juan Resort and Casino from November 6th-11th, 2011 (Sunday to Thursday). Overall, I would give this resort a 3 out of 5 stars. Food... We are both avid travelers and have seen a lot with tropical resorts. This was our first non-all-inclusive in a very long time. We figured for the price we could save some money and try not to eat as much as we would normally would at a all-inclusive type resort. Well, that was very true because the average cost of a cocktail was $10!!! Yes, $10!! and food was completely unreasonable. Our package came with a free â€œAmerican Breakfast Buffetâ€� (which was a hassle to convince the front desk we even had) and that saved us $200 for the 4 nights- $25 PP per day. It was a good selection but not worth $25 PP. If you have a free buffet with your package I recommend you bring the print out or voucher with you as the front desk tried to tell us we didn't have it. They did honor our print out but we were not prepared to explain ourself in the beginning of the trip and then again at check out. As soon as we arrived we went to the local grocery store â€œPuebloâ€� 5 minute walk and bought some snacks, water and alcohol. This was the smartest thing we did and was well worth it. We ate dinner at restaurants outside the resort as we couldn't see spending $$$$ for the restaurants in the hotel. We ate at some great places, Cafe Puerto Rico in Old El San Juan- that was amazing. Metropol Restaurant, 5 minute walk from the hotel- the best food ever! We just asked the server to order for us and it was so good. We tried to eat all the Puerto Rican foods and they were all delicious. We ate lunch at the resort- not much to choose from but it did the trick. We had a tuna pita, burger, grilled cheese... cant mess that up! Our favorite bar tender was Eric but he only worked on Sunday:( Jason was friendly too! Entertainment.... Since we traveled during the week entertainment was non-existent- NADA. The outside bar closed at 7pm, shops in town were closed early and there was nothing really going on. No entertainment at the hotel other then the casino and we are not gamblers... On Wednesday night they had someone playing the piano in the lobby but that was all. According to the locals everything happens on the weekends.... So be prepared if you are traveling during the week...The lobby was dark and not open-air so it didn't have the â€œbeachâ€� feel. We wanted to be outside and hang outside but the bars outside by the beach and pool close at 7pm... Room... When we booked our room we had asked for 2 double beds. When we arrived at the hotel they had us down for a King Bed. I told them that was wrong and asked if we could change and they said they were completely booked and apologized. Luckily we are sisters and didn't mind cuddling:) We were shocked that they told us they were booked as the hotel appeared to be empty the entire them we were there. It was interesting to say the least. The room itself was great. Spacious, very comfortable bed and lots of pillows, down comforter and a sofa sitting area. The bathroom was small but did the job. We were only on the 4th floor so we didn't have much of a view. The maid service was great and timely. The ice machine on our floor was not working so we had to hit the other floors for ice and I don't think they ever had any intentions of fixing it. The AC in the room worked perfectly! No balconies though, that was a bummer. Beach/Pool... The outside pool area was very nice, spacious and maintained nicely. There was plenty of spots to relax and there was no fighting over lounge chairs. (like I said the place was empty). The bars didn't open until later and the music was smoothing. The beach area was nice when the seaweed was away. The crew didn't do a good job keeping the beach area clear and the seaweed smelled very bad. The ocean was warm and very pretty. Great long beach to walk along as well. The service at the pool wasn't great- when you think it would be since they are being tipped and we are paying $10-15 for a drink. We had to waive servers down- they wouldn't just ask if we needed anything or go out of their way. The hot tub was very nice, it felt like we were in a tropical paradise- it was hiding on top a hill and very relaxing. It rained a lot when we were there so that was our escape while we were waiting for the rain to pass over... The hotel was very generous with beach towels as well, we got two per person a day (they were so small) and the staff didn't mind. Activities... We heard from friends we met at the resort that the Bioluminescence and the Rain Forrest was a must but we had issues finding a tour company that would only pick two people up so it didn't happen for us. This resort didn't push excursions like the rest of them do so it was different in that perspective. We did rent a Jet Ski at the beach at the hotel (guys to the left) and it was super fun- rough but fun. It was $40 for a half hour and believe me a half hour is plenty of time:) We also both got massages on the beach, 30 minutes each for $45 a piece. Lisa was the message therapist and was amazing! So relaxing a must! We went to Old San Juan ($20 cab ride each way or 75 cents on the bus) and loved it there. I felt like we were in Europe. Fun to see all the history and culture. The shops close VERY early so go early (before 5pm) if you want to shop. Most bars were closed or dead during the week too. Overall, we had a great time!! It was good to see San Juan as we have never been there. I think this resort is more for work events and business trips. Everyone we met was there for work- not many families, couples or friends. I guess thats why they can get away with charging so much money for food and drinks!! If you have any questions on the resort or ear please let me know, I am here to help! Have a great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “El San Juan, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyangel50
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. Excellent resturant, "The Palm", great staff. Beautiful lobby bar & the best mojitos! This was our second time there. I miss the cigar store on the second trip. The beach is very nice. Enjoy yourself in the lobby bar on with the music. This is one of our must go back to places. Close to the airport. We walked around the neighborhood during the day, not bother by anyone. I am a Hilton Honors member, but that should figure in on the quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “MINI VACATION”
Reviews.Author: mysty0422
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere is elegant but also relaxing the club live on the weekend- excellent bartendars were friendly and attentive to the customers needs the rooms were very nice and clean lots of shops right in the resort the beach is connected to the back of the resort... all the comforts are all here if a person does not want to travel far

Reviews.Title: “Run away as fast as you can”
Reviews.Author: Wisetravler62
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property several times in the past and been very pleased. However it appears there has been some drastic change. Our package was to include breakfast, parking and internet. So far we have been charged for all three. In addition the rooms were not clean, they were in vert worn condition and were missing things like the smoke detector and the phone. We are still waiting to hear from hotel management after calls, visits to the front desk, written notes and even a call to the hiltin customer care line. This used to be a great stay but something bad has happened to the hotel leadership.

Reviews.Title: “Most popular hotel on Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: BlessedV
Reviews.Content: I received a very good vacation deal on Jetblue for this hotel. If you are looking for a lively, hip, modern place to stay - this is the hotel for you. The decor is modern, the club is the best in San Juan, they have restaurants on site - although I suggest eating at the local spots - Metropol, Mi Casita, Don Jose etc... The pool/beach area is beautiful and was never crowded, but please carry insect repellent as those bugs will tear you up.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LOlbina
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It is a beautiful hotel with a lot to offer. Ms. Noelia was very helpful giving us information on places to shop and things to do and see. Mr. Gregory was always kind and helpful to us whenever we had a question. Mr. Gregory always made sure we had what we needed at breakfast. The staff was attentive, friendly, and warm, from the checkin desk/concierge/bellhop (Ms. Noelia, Mr. Hery, Ms. Yvette?, Mr. Joel) to housekeeping (Ms. Jossie and Ms. Williams) to the folks who were responsible for the amazingly, stunningly beautiful landscaping. We enjoyed the contintental breakfast, the beach, the pools, the live music, the beautifully landscaped grounds, the shops, the amenities, the location, the overall tranquility/ambience, and the fact that the hotel's staff finds ways to improve and accomodate its guests. The hotel knows it can improve even more, and that is something we appreciate as guests. For example, we requested a shower rubber mat, and they searched high and low to find one for us. It took them a while, but the mat was in the shower when we got back to our room later that day. This hotel has so much to offer, and the location could not be better, right there in Isla Verde, not too far from Old San Juan, next to the highway (26), and right by the airport. There are many other places to eat, if you do not want to eat at the hotel, and there are shopping areas not too far from the hotel. The Condado neighborhood, which also has many eateries and great Puerto Rican food restaurants is right next to Isla Verde. Also, the local buses pass right in front of the hotel. We will return to this hotel and recommend it to folks we know. We have never been disappointed by any of the Hilton properties in Puerto Rico, and we are so glad to have stayed at this hotel, despite the reviews we saw online. The only thing we regret is not staying long enough to see the 11-11-11 live event with the Gran Combo et al!! There is always next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: lmarvelous
Reviews.Content: This place gets some bad reviews....I think that is all about the room type. I stayed there for one week for a conference and I couldn't have asked for more. Great service, great food, beautiful location. We had about 65 rooms with our conference and everyone was happy. The vista rooms are nice and if you splurge, the ocean lanai rooms are great. We had excellent service throughout the hotel. The very few issues were resolved quickly. The lobby is incredible and a great place for people watching. The food can be expensive but that is to be expected on an island!

Reviews.Title: “This Vacation exceeded all expectations in the end!”
Reviews.Author: rsnyc2008
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were here on vacation, and we had an amazing experience. A special thanks to Noelle at the front desk for going out of her way to make our experience exceptional. The stay began with a small issue with our room, and instead of being combative, she stepped right up with a smile, made us feel comfortable and in minutes, everything was perfect. Below I am reviewing the pros and cons, not that I rated this 5 0f 5. Nothing is perfect, but this was pretty close! The Pros- Bed is ridiculously comfortable Front desk staff is very nice, and they truly care about your experience. Our package included free breakfast, it was delicious- hot food that never runs out Pool staff is really nice as well, they make great drinks and have fun The pool is great in itself. The chairs are incredible and the cabanas make you never want to get up. The clientele the hotel attracts is great as well, we made a lot of friends in the casino, at the pool, and in the lobby (No trashy, classless folks with matching tramp stamps like other Caribbean resorts we have stayed at) The Lobby is a spectacle. There are 3-4 beautiful bars right in the heart of it. All the wealthy locals hang out in the lobby at night, there is live music and dancing, its amazing. The club inside is also very cool. The dealers at the casino were great, we left as winners! Walking distance to metropole, which is a great, cheap restaurant (get the smoked chicken) JetSkis are a must- but go to the guy on the left, if you are facing the ocean, when you walk on to the beach, not the people to the right. The guys on the right couldn't be more rude. Cons- The Casino waitress' couldn't have been slower or more rude if they tried. Order 2 drinks at a time. The hotel room walls were paper thin, you could hear EVERYTHING in the room that you share the adjoining door with The pictures of the rooms make the rooms to be crystal clean. The room could use a little touch up in the tile grout and the whites could be a little whiter. (the furniture whites, like the bed frame, the couches in the rooms, the throw pillows) Jetski people on the right, if facing the water, were completely rude. To end this on a positive note, this was the best vacation we have taken in years! Every hotel has pros and CONS, but these cons did not get in the way of our experience. We loved it there. People like Noelle, Yvonne, and Susan make sure the experience is nothing less than spectacular. We highly recommend it, we cant wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: lil_msbeautiful
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed in this hotel. It was GREAT!!! The pool area looks just like the pics. The wait staff were great and the hotel is gorgeous! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: EvConboy
Reviews.Content: There is good and there is bad. I combed through reviews before deciding we'd give this hotel a try for our 1 week get-away. We had stayed at the Ritz Carlton the previous year, but had eaten here and seen then amazing hotel lobby. I called and requested a connecting room. We were 3 sisters with 2 little girls - connecting rooms make life easier! I actually called to make the reservation and then called again 1 week out to confirm. Based on reviews, I asked for a room that was far away from the nightclub because of the kids and I also requested that our rooms were connecting. I even emailed Susan Wilkerson (as many below here suggest) to confirm we had a quiet room and that was connecting. We arrived on Monday and got our rooms. Service was very quick. We were on the 3rd floor. Rooms were not connecting, so I went downstairs and they were quick to find something connecting. I mentioned twice while looking that we needed something quiet. So, we ended up in rooms 329 and 331. Not a great view, but we weren't really spending time in the rooms all that much anyways. Rooms are clean and well-appointed. Kids LOVED the swim up bar. Plenty of seating around the pool. Many pools to chose from. We had a great time. Food/restaurants around the pools had limited options, but we enjoyed and had a great time. Pretty beach as well! Fast forward to Thursday and Friday night. Loud club music came on at 10pm. It was actually louder when you put your head down on the pillow - because the club was almost directly below the room. The hotel was completely booked, so we were told moving rooms was impossible. Kids didn't sleep, I didn't sleep.... no one slept. We finally turned the TV on to CNN to bring some white noise into the room. On Friday night, we had to call security because the room next to us was blaring rap music. Security had the issue resolved within 30 minutes, but it was 1am in the morning. Obviously, it was a pain to wake up out of my half sleep from the club music to deal with even louder rap music. Kudos to security on their quick response time. By Saturday, we were all cranky, tired and ready to leave. Not how you want to leave vacation. Another issue as a side note -- 1. Our room key device stopped working. Couldn't get into our room. They promised to fix it and sent a guy up. I guess he didn't have the right part, so they promised to fix it the next morning. Didn't happen. Wasn't a big deal though, because we had the connecting room and just went thru the other door. 2. First night we were there we noticed a huge line of ants that literally wrapped around the room. Maybe the folks before us had room service in here? We were too exhausted from pool/beach to deal with it that night. Next morning, we told the front desk and they took care of it that day. They must have sprayed something, because we had a bunch of dead ants all around the room. All in all - great beaches and pools. Fantastic lobby. Service was hit or miss. Obviously, emailing Susan Wilkerson is also hit or miss. We had a "miss." My tips moving forward - insist on a room above the 5th floor. Do NOT stay on the 3rd floor unless you are partying with the club until 4am. Yes, 4am. Tips for food/supplies - Walgreens is just 2 short blocks away. Stock up on sunscreen, snacks, drinks! Piu Bello - just before Walgreens. Great little breakfast spot. We went every day. Very inexpensive. They knew our names by the 2nd day. Very friendly. There is also a full starbucks in the building too! Best dinner we had was at Platos. Great drinks, dinner, seafood. Loved it. Not sure if we'd stay again.... had a much better experience at the Ritz Carlton and paid only $40 more a night (minus all the issues)

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feeling!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetpeainpa
Reviews.Content: My sister booked this as a Mother and daughters spa trip. First time in PR and was impressed with the PR people. Rooms The resort was full and our rooms were definitely bottom of the line. We had no view ( it was a rooftop on the 3rd floor) hallways were quite chilly. The room itself was clean and modern. The shower in room 305 was almost impossible for my Mom to turn on Very tight) I had to go in and put the water on for her. Dining On Sunday the service at the aqua bar when we arrived was so slow. It took 45 minutes for just the drinks to arrive. Def a bad 1st impression. We ate at the Palm food was delicious and service was wonderful. We also loved the Italian restuarant Piccolos also excellent service. Pizza and Gelati in the Italian resturant in the gallery was always delicious. Try the Puerto Rican pizza!! Pool area wait staff very slow.... Tours We toured the fort, Old San Juan and the Baccadi factory excellent day. George from elegant steering was wonderful and very helpful to my Mom!! Pools and Ocean The pool area was quite lovely and had a delightful soft music playing. Ocean was not a pretty blue must of been recent storms in the area. Conciere Neoli thank you for your help getting my Mom closer to my Sisters.,you are a wonderful and caring person!! Overall Service ranged from excellent to plain bad. Room was clean and modern. Have fun !!.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: Spitfireagain
Reviews.Content: We arrived by cab from the airport about 10PM. There were NO valets and we had to handle our 4 bags (as we were traveling for 2 weeks) by ourselves. Once we checked in, there was no service offered. With few directions from the clerk, we headed out to find our ocean view suite in the dark. Luckily there was a hotel employee at the back door and he was kind enough to give us better directions. The lobby... gorgeous and well cared for.' Once you get past that, the hotel was in quite a state of disrepair. Many of the lanais by the pool were roped off due to rotting wood. Lights did not work in all but one pool. (pools were supposed to be open until 9, towel shack closes at 6) Pools were quite dirty... spas were downright disgustingly yellow! They even painted the tile just above the water level black to hide mold (I am assuming it was easier than cleaning it) Our suite: bed was pretty comfy. furniture were old and had issues. (peeling varnish, missing handles, drapery rods w/no draperies, broken bathroom light fixture, toilet that stuck and ran constantly, patio/deck furniture that was way past needing a paint job, shower door was ill-fitting and flooded the bathroom daily. the room was clean, but VERY TIRED. No coffee pot in the room. The casino: no life.. no excitement. the neighborhood: a bit shady. there was lots of trash and garbage, broken bottles and homeless, sometimes begging. We were there early in the week, we were told by several that it turns into a "spring break" type atmosphere on weekends... very loud and roudy. the beach: mostly clean but not white sand. the water was mirky. I feel that Hilton needs to do some serious upgrades here or take their name off of this property. Other than the lobby, it does not meet Hilton standards. Things to know: Tips/service fees are included in EVERYTHING there, be careful if you do not want to double tip. Beach towels must be returned to the shack or you will be changed $20 EACH. If you return them after the shack is closed, you are to phone them in the morning and tell them that you returned them You must have a bracelet to use the facilities, the color changes daily. these can be picked up at the towel shack.

Reviews.Title: “Great bachelor party”
Reviews.Author: bostonianinNYC
Reviews.Content: 7 friends and I stayed at the El San Juan for the weekend for a bachelor party and had a fabulous time. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which has a huge living room that overlooks the water with plenty of space for hanging out all 8 of us. We got one cot and otherwise had comfortable sleeping accommodations. The rooms are updated and clean, showers are great, and the service is quite good. Susan at the front desk is especially helpful. I'd definitely stay here again. Special tip about the casino - ask for the soup in the afternoon - delicious and just the right snack to keep you going. We ate at the Jam Rum Bar on friday night and it was fabulous! Highly recommend that.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place...”
Reviews.Author: Wislie
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel around noon; since our room wasn't ready the Front Desk Agent gave us a free upgrade. Originally our reservation was made for 1 bed, but we decided to bring our children and he found us a great double bed room. He gave us great advice on places to eat and explained all the facilities of the hotel. He made sure we had all the information we needed and he let us know if we needed anything to contact him. The room and Hotel is very beautiful and spacey. And the service we received the day we checked in makes this hotel a very pleasant one. We will love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Carolina”
Reviews.Author: Dashkina
Reviews.Content: I was travelling on business, so getting close to the airport was very important. Beautiful property, nice, modern rooms, great food, casino, nightclub, terrace roof-top bar. Pool area is gorgeous. They have superb staff at the front front desk and conference and F&B with who I communicated mostly. Truly, these people were the ones who made our stay memorable. Some downsides: the function rooms in the basement desperately need refurbishment - they are so outdated it looks like they belong to some other place rather than to this hotel. Elevators were not functioning very well - I even got stuck once for a couple of minutes with power (and obviously lights) off which was pretty scary. The beach was not my number 1 priority. If it was - I would be disappointed, as there are many more nicer secluded beaches than the one in Carolina.

Reviews.Title: “The Beautiful El San Juan Resort(Now El San Juan Hilton)”
Reviews.Author: nightnurseLancaster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned Sunday after i surprised him with a weekend trip to Puerto Rico. I choose this hotel due to reviews found here and the close proximity to the beach so we wouldn't have to waste travel time. What can I say about this hotel but WOW! While the hotel is going thru transition (it is now part of the Hilton chain) they are not lacking in great customer service and that was truly refreshing. We had a couple of issues that were promptly addressed and we were contacted directly by the manager who apologized profusely and went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. The hotel has several restuarants that offer a variety of foods for every tatse bud, the pools are gorgeous, the beach was amazing and the staff were friendly, couteous and knowledgable. The hotel is about 7 minutes from the airport and in walking distance to a 24hr supermarket, bars, clubs and other places to eat, but the hotel itself has a nightclub, a casino and bars with live music that seemed to stay jamming on the friday and saturday night we were there....The only drawback we found and people were very honest in their reviews is that it is pricey, it'd be nice if they offered some type of meal/drink plan to make it more affordable, the best value by far was the $25 breakfast buffet which was plentiful and delicious, and although things are pricey you are paying for premium and i'd rather that over crap, another drawback we found was for someone my husbands size (6'7) the shower is a bit tight but we were ok for just 2 nights..the rooms are very swanky they ook just like the pics which i liked since some of the pics on websites can be deceiving....We will return here gladly but definetely for longer than a weekend...this is the way customer service used to be i am glad they still maintain it here! A special Thank you to George Garcia the Hotel manager, Susan Wilkerson the front office manager for making things so special and to Carlos at the front desk he is a wealth of information and always available to help..We are looking forward to our return there!

Reviews.Title: “Always my choice”
Reviews.Author: Jesse M
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the El San Juan Resort & Casino for the past 4 years. I have never considered changing my itineary to stay elswhere. This place has it all. Location, Location, Location. The people there are friendly courteous and always professional. I have to give an special mention to Yamira. She works in the Hotel lounge and from the very beginning has always been very accommodating. I was impressed when she even remembered me when I returned. She truly represents the best of the El San Juan Resort & Casino. I will recommend the El San Juan Resort & Casino to anyone travelling to San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Utter luxury”
Reviews.Author: ShiningHalo
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by every aspect of our 1 night stay at the El San Juan. Granted, I didn't take advantage of everything the hotel has to offer in such a short stay, but I did enjoy all parts of my stay. The front desk staff at check-in was courteous and professional. We found our room to be clean, modern, and spacious. (The main lobby and casino area is furnished in dark wood and feels like a posh lounge from the 30s, to my un-educated eye; but our room was white and contemporary). Our room was great--for the 5 of us staying there, we had PLENTY of space. We booked a deal for the room price on Priceline, and so the view out our window was of a roof...but going down to the pool or beach area easily remedied this problem. The pools are breathtaking...an absolutely great place to relax away a Sunday afternoon. Lay in a comfortable beach chair and stair up at the green palms against the bluest of skies. The night we were there, we went to the club in the hotel, Brava. We got in for free as guests of the hotel, though as we came to the line, they had the wrong name listed as being in our room, so we had to go to the front desk and get a print-out with the correct names. This was the only hiccup in our stay, and we still got into the club within 5 minutes or so. The club itself was quite a good time--good music, packed with young people as the night went on. I would definitely stay at the El San Juan again. I didn't try out any of the restaurants--I've heard they're pricy, as you'd expect--but good and economical dining options can be found outside of the hotel property (within walking distance, if you like).

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous pools, beaches, hospitality, location. 5 STARS.”
Reviews.Author: PKBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: We booked a jetblue vacation package that included hotel, flight, car to San Juan. We were hesitant to stay in San Juan as opposed to closer to El Yunque or Fajardo, but I am SO happy we stayed here. 1. The layout, pools, hot tubs (there are three!) beach, service and hospitality were bar none. Everything was very clean, every staff person greets you with a smile and hello. The pool chairs range from cushioned chaises to canopied beds. The beach was also beautiful and clean. When we first checked in to the hotel it was about 10am. Even though we were super early to check in, Yvonne at concierge completely upgraded us to a junior suite! What a surprise! The room, the service, and the view was simply spectacular. 2. Tips on sightseeing. You must see Playa Flamenco in Culebra!! The ferry leaves from Fajardo - a one hour drive from El San Juan. Go on the first ferry of the morning which leaves at 9am. Buy a roundtrip ticket ($4.50). The ferry is 1.5 hours. Do not sit on the outdoor portion or the diesel fumes will kill you. I highly recommend sitting on the innermost portion away from the fumes. Feel free to bring a cooler with you - we bought a styrofoam one from Walgreens located on the same street as El San Juan. Beware, there are no glass bottles of any kind allowed on Flamenco Beach - so bring cans!! When you disembark the ferry there are drivers lining up to take you to whatever beach you want. Look for the Playa Flamenco sign. You can buy a one way or roundtrip ticket. The driver you want to go with is named Willy - he'll take 2 people roundtrip on the bus for $5. He gives you his cell number just in case, and he knows everything about Culebra and is very funny. There are many kiosks selling food and beer on the beach in case you run out :) You can rent beach chairs and umbrella for $25. Okay the best part about playa flamenco is that it is the most beautiful beach in the world. The water is clear for hundreds of feet out. The sand doesn't get hot, the scene is like a movie - gorgeous landscape and people! 3. Old San Juan is a 10 minute drive from El San Juan hotel. It's great for the day to walk around and grab lunch, buy some souvenirs. You should park in one of the parking garages as soon as you enter old san juan - it's about $2.15/hour. Try to jump into the trolley - it's a free ride around town. Grab a map from the front desk of the hotel and it's very well laid out of old san juan, very easy to navigate the area. 4. Because the drinks are kinda pricey at the hotel pool bars, try to bring your own cans of medalla (puerto rican beer). We brought down cans of pringles and other snacks since the pool bars only have entree type food. I would definitely stay at El San Juan ten times over again and look forward to our next trip back. Enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Business in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: thepearl8
Reviews.Content: Very classic property on first appearance. Rooms are contemporary in style, staff very helpful with responses to queries. Multiple food choices were excellent if you chose not to leave the property. Pools were excellent and beach is above average.

Reviews.Title: “What a special place to be!”
Reviews.Author: Talaine10
Reviews.Content: I have been to the El San Juan too many times to count over the years. It is NEVER a disappointment. The biggest delight is having Susan Wilkerson the front desk manager help with your stay. It was my best friend's birthday and Susan who always takes the extra step to make things wonderful did it again. She is a beautiful human being and we are very grateful for everything she does. The hotel has always keep it's high standard of excellence and we are delighted to stay there. The staff trys very hard to please and they do. Thank you all so much! Joan Cable & Barbara Lawson

Reviews.Title: “One of the best days of my life”
Reviews.Author: John19790
Reviews.Content: Two words, Susan Wilkerson. I emailed her before our one night stay with them, and she took care of the rest. My wife and I were celebrating our five year anniversary on a cruise, but wanted to get to PR a day before we left to adjust to the time, and we chose this hotel. We arrived before check in (2pm), and were greeted warmly by Carlos who wished us a happy anniversary and gave us our room key. We ended up staying on the second floor with the ocean view, and the room/view were amazing. We decided to relax at the pool for a couple of hours before getting ready for that night, and the pool was gorgeous, and we literally had the best rum punch drinks that we have ever had in our lives. The bartenders were very professional and nice. We ate dinner at the Palm and had steak and lobster which were delicious and VERY reasonably priced. After dinner we went to the lobby where they had salsa dancing and the best bartenders serving up carefully made drinks. We honestly had the best time at El San Juan and will definitely be heading back there in the near future. Thank you Susan for making sure that everything went off without a hitch!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay! Would go back!”
Reviews.Author: Tara G
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great service. Happening lobby area with good nightlife. There is 2 clubs within the hotel and a casino. Can rent a car directly from the hotel concierge and in the parking lot of the hotel. Safe and convienient!

Reviews.Title: “Great Saturday night in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: christine h
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous and has a lot of expensive restaurants and boutiques. My friend and I went on a Saturday night because she wanted to dance. We checked out Club Brava, also in the hotel, but it was too expensive, young and techno for us (I'm 44), so we decided to hang out in the hotel lobby listening to the live salsa music and watching the dancing. There is great people watching there and it's easy to dance with someone. A very mixed crowd, young to old, and everyone is dressed to impress-we had a lot of fun there.

Reviews.Title: “superb at its best”
Reviews.Author: ronni1959
Reviews.Content: I had the best Birthday ever thanks to the staff and the amenities at the San Juan Hotel and Casino. The food was yet to be believed. You had a variety to choose from without leaving the hotel. The rooms were beautifully decorated. The balcony overlooked the ocean and the pool area. The concierge service was very professional, and prompt. Kudos to Camille, she help make my Birthday extra special by all the extra things she did. Tha lounge area on Saturday night was filled with excellent music and such a feel of the Carribean.I will be back time and time again . I was so impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you like a party”
Reviews.Author: CharlieC33
Reviews.Content: We just spent the last four days at this hotel and if your up for a good party this is where you want to stay. However if you are looking for a relaxing vacation book a different hotel. The pool areas were excellent and we really enjoyed the hotel during the day but unless you like loud music playing until late in the night try another resort. The bands come in and the party only gets started after mid night and continues on until 4-6.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chefvanessa
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 days. I read the reviews after I booked my room. I booked a promotion with the 4th night free and breakfast included. Great price. Location is great. I moved out from PR 5 years ago and I knew I was going to be close to everything. I was concerned about a lot of things when I read the reviews on Trip Advisor. I sent an email prior to my arrival to Ms Susan Wilkersen as other people mentioned. She upgraded us and we had our room ready at 1pm when we arrived. Thanks Susan!!! She had a smile and asked us if we needed anything else. The room was pretty big, all white. I agree with other people that some improvements should be made but we definitely enjoyed our stay. The bed was so comfortable we didnâ€™t want to wake up. The pool was awesome. Pina Coladas by the pool were expensive and not too good. I would advise them to make them with Coco Lopez instead of the mix they use. Breakfast was included in the promotion we booked but the price was $25.00 per person. Itâ€™s expensive but you do get everything you need to not have to eat until late afternoon. My very honest opinion, if you do not want to splurge go to Panaderia Espana on the other side of Ave Isla Verde or driver to Kasalta in Condado, or La Bombonera in Old San Juan and try a Mayorca. So many places to go outside the hotel so people shouldnâ€™t be complaining. As other reviewers mentioned they did charge it to my room bill, and I was charged for it on my card. During check out and after reviewing the bill I told the girl at the front desk that it was included when I booked the room and she gladly and with a smile refunded my credit card with no hassle. I was charged for the towels too and she removed the charges as well. I didnâ€™t eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel. A lot of people complained on TA about prices, that is what you should expect in a hotel. My advice is to go outside. Dont go to PR to eat at Ruth Chris when you have tons of great options outside the hotel. Raices in Old San Juan, LAtin Star in Condado. The beach is ok, but you are a drive away to Ocean Park. The fitness center was awesome. I am training to run a marathon and I was able to use the treadmills and do my weights work out during my short vacation so that was nice. The lobby that a lot of people complain on TA was awesome too. I loved the live band Salsa and merengue on Saturday. On Sunday they had like jazz which people pay cover charge anywhere else and you have it for free in the lobby. what else can you ask for??? A casino?! you got it there too. Parking for $16.50 per day. Was the best deal! In and out privileges you never have to worry about parking except Saturday we had to park across the street but is part of the hotel so is included in the 16.50. The resort fee I know is a lot but they do mention it everywhere so people shouldnâ€™t complain just put it in the budget as part of the room before booking. Every resort in PR has this fee. I would go back and definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “5 times a year or more,there must be a reason”
Reviews.Author: pandg27
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this hotel for at least 25 years and return at 5 times every year. i have seen it go from the sublime to the ridiculous and more than half way back again. It was the only place where I chose to go after I became widowed. The staff is extraordinary and I feel at home there. True, some of the rooms need updating very badly.The lobby is not what it was prior to the most recent redecoration, but if you never saw it before, then you will still be in awe.I stay in the Garden Lanais and love it. All of the beds have been upgrade to my knowledge and are superbly comfortable. Piccolo Fontana is the best restaurant in the hotel. The Palm is what it is everywhere. The trattoria is a good alternative for breakfast or lunch or dinner or ice cream. Go out to eat. Try the old city or even nearby local restaurants. The food is good.It depends on what you want and how much you want to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Highly over-rated. No longer what it used to be despite "renovations" which is more like a superficial facelift.”
Reviews.Author: madeline v
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is the lobby only, which you pay for in the high resort fees. The pool pictures on the website are much nicer and some of the nice decor you see online is no longer there. Many of the locals stay here on the weekends for a reduced rate and may be difficult to find lounge chairs, which was another problem- certainly didn't have the "resort" atmosphere. The nightclub is very small, very dark with a tiny dance floor and lousy music. Furthermore drinks are small and very expensive throughout the hotel. Overall I do not recommend staying here for the price. If you do go, PLEASE do not go to the magic show dinner at the hotel- a latin food restaurant. What BS to charge $50 for the show and dinner (which was less than mediocure and very dark anybody could pull a trick). The restaurant itself was pretty and food was otherwise good- just skip the show. The best part of the hotel is the Italian Restaurant Piccola- excellent food,service and atmosphere and worth the price. The steakhouse was also very good. Last but definitely not least is the courtesy of the front desk- hit or miss, depending who's there. You would never know it's a Hilton hotel- or maybe Hilton is slipping I don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Air Conditioning in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: lsiuta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the El San Juan for one week on a work trip and it was a week after a hurrican had hit, so some of the amenities were not availble to me. The biggest thing I noted is that the air conditioning is turned to HIGH in the lobby. It's nice when you are coming in from the extreme heat, but sometimes it does get a little chilly so be prepared! The restaurants seemed nice, but were extremely expensive and some were closed due to hurricane damage. We did eat at the little restaurant in the Galleria and while the food was ok, the service was extremely SLOW. We also did brunch on the patio out by the pool and the food was really good, but I really don't believe it was worth the high cost. The rooms are very nice and were very clean. The beds were comfortable and there were plenty of places to sit and store clothes/luggage/etc. All in all, I would return to the hotel, but would definitely look for other places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Mogcyh
Reviews.Content: Located not to far from the airport, with an in house casino (not that I cared), a couple of restaurants, a couple of small shops and more importantly a gorgeous pool side area and beach attached, our three days here were fantastic. The bar area inside is gorgeous and this seems to be the place to be on a Saturday evening. Compared to the rest of San Juan, prices here for food/drinks are probably ridiculous and indulging from the mini bar is probably not a good idea. Having said that, prices are in line with what you would pay for a hotel of this caliber anywhere else in the U.S. Pina Coladas from the pool bar are fantastic and we were quite happy sitting on the beach, with an umbrella and a bucket of beer. Definitely would come back here!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HONEYMOON”
Reviews.Author: maria c
Reviews.Content: We went for 8 days for our honeymoon & it was the worst service, the people who worked there were so rude & didnt want to be bothered it seemed if you werent a local. the rooms were ridiculously over priced got charged a resort fee of 15 dollars a day for what we dont know then never knew about the complimentary breakfeast until the last day from othere guests. we would never reccomend this place they all need to take a class on how to be polite. we payed alot of money to stay there on top of all the money we spent there and i would have rather benn in mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great pool area”
Reviews.Author: Maria_M_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights to attend a friend's wedding. The hotel itself was very nice - great lobby bar with fantastic atmosphere (salsa dancing on the weekends!). Check-in was very, very slow. I checked in after 3pm and my room was not ready yet - I was told to come back later and to wait in the lobby. Every time I asked if the room was ready, the check in people kept saying it would be only 5 more minutes. Over one hour later, my room was finally ready! The room was nice enough. The pool area was great. Overall quite a pricey hotel but i am not sure it's quite worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Better Hotels in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Jabowski
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel without a doubt, from the hotel's lobby the guests can get the sense that this is a beautiful place to stay, the aminities are as good as 4 star hotel can get. I am more amused by the pool area, where there is a built in bar inside the pool, which by the way is right off the beach. As for the room, I stayed in a City Vista room, it is a good size room on the 4th floor, less than descent view, clean and comfortable but it is not particularly breath taking. The rooms are decorated just like you see them in the posted pictures, do not expect anything more. The bathroom is small with a stand in shower. I'll grade the rooms and the bathroom 3 out of 5 because of the bathroom, the bedroom is a 3.5, and the lounge area, the pool, the club in the lobby and the fact that the hotel is right by the beach is a definite 4.5 out of 5. Bottom line is, This is one of the better Hotels in San Juan. You will love it if you are not too overly demanding, I'll stay in El San Juan again if I plan on going to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: katie h
Reviews.Content: I will simply say for the money spent on the ocean front lanais room, I was extremely disappointed. It was out of date, one of the lamps did not work, the shower dripped water, their were gnats in our room, the bed was NOT comfortable, the lanais below us was more than an eye sore...dirty, rusty view looking below. For over $500/night, i have received WAY more in a room. Not to mention the fountains on the resort property were not turned on for a portion of our stay (however, i was mindful that hurricane Irene passed thru the week prior) the pools were dirty and not updated in my opinion. I could go on about the disappointment but I am going to exert the rest of my energy on writing an awesome review on the Ritz Carlton, San Juan. We checked out on 9/2/2011 and into the Ritz....and what a beautiful and near perfect experience! I am so glad we did!

Reviews.Title: “Still one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Kacee25
Reviews.Content: We go regularly to the El San Juan and it is always pleasing. I am always swept away into a world of elegance upon entering the hotel. Immediately in front of you are two gorgeous and inviting bars. The lobby area is kept spotless and invites you to relax. The staff greet you and are anxious to please. Checking in was a breeze. The room was Spartan and I do believe it is time for the Hilton to update their room decor. However the room is nice in size and very clean. Comfortable beds, small bathrooms and good amenities. We spend our days by the pools and they are gorgeous. The pool service was a bit spotty on this trip. We veered away from the beach because of the "no see'um" bugs. However they do offer bug spray and numerous guests took advantage of the gorgeous beach. The hotel was filled with families and they all seemed to be having a great time. After a hard day of working on our tans, we took advantage of the bar scene. Wow! They have Latin music in the lobby area of an evening and it feels like the entire city turns out for dancing and drinks. Everyone dresses smartly for the evening and by 10:30pm the place is hopping and I do mean hopping. It is exciting and fun! The casino was full. The slot machines are a tad old so if you are used to the latest equipment, you will be disappointed. We took a cab down to Old San Juan one evening for dinner. Cab rides average between $20-25. Always a fun adventure. Old San Juan really gives you the experience of being in Spain or Portugal and is full of excitement. The hotel with it's polish and vibrancy is always inviting and we are making plans for our spring visit.

Reviews.Title: “RELAXING VACATION...BEAUTIFUL RESORT..BUT BEWARE WHEN BOOKING TOURS...MAKE SURE THEY ARE PART OF THE RESORT !!!!”
Reviews.Author: RORO0565
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation to the El San Juan resort from Jet Blue vactions and got an excellent deal! Price around for the best price before booking! We stayed at the resort for 6 days....we received a call from jet blue 2 days before our trip advising us that the resort had no electric and had some minor problems due to Hurricane Irene. We were in contact with the El San Juan and the day before we were supossed to leave the electric was back on so we decided to take our trip as planned. I was a little worried about going to the resort right after the storm and also concerned about the negative reviews. I did not find most of the negative reviews to be true ...... and the resort was up and running. From the minute we pulled up to the El San Juan and opened the taxi door we were greeted by the friendly staff. Angelo was one of the first staff members that we met. He was outside and had another member of the staff take us to the front desk. The front desk staff was amazing.. We had a early flight and arrived at the resort at about 10:30 am...they checked us in and we were in our room within 5 minutes. We had the City Vista Room...which looks exactly as it is posted on the web site...the room was white with tropical bright colored decor. I was not crazy about the bathroom...it was small and I thought it should have been nicer for a top rated resort, We did have a problem in the shower when some tiles fell off the wall along with the entire shower bar and shower head that was attached to the wall...my poor son was in the shower when this happened. We reported it to the front desk and it was fixed very quickly..Thank God nothing too serious happened to my son...we were offered another room but decieded to stay. There was also alittle mold in the bathroom....they were having some problems at that time because the hotel was without air for a few days before we arrived..but other than that the room was always kept clean and Isabel our maid was great. she tried to give us all the comforts of home during our stay. The hotel grounds were beautiful and well kept...the pools were great...alot of lounge chairs and sun decks...and if you donot like the they had plenty of shaded areas too. The beach was also nice and clean, although I never found Puerto Rico to have the nicest ocean water. The had a pool bar and other bars outside....a little expensive, but we were not surprised not much different than New York prices. If you wanted lunch when u were at the pool you could also order it..I had a greek salad outside one day and it was great..It was $10.00. This is not an all inclusive resort so there is nothing really going on by the pool or beach...no activities at all. They had a D.J. at the pool on Saturday that played great music....It was very relaxing! We went to a supermarket called Publeos and bought some water, beers, snacks etc...the liquor was cheap in Publeos. We even bought a cheap foam cooler and I also brought a cooler bag from home to bring to the pool/beach. We did not eat in any of the resturants at the resort...just at the cafe where my son had pizza and a burger for lunch and they also had great gelato. We loved the resturants that were in walking distance...: these are to the left when you walk out of the el san juan: Plato's was our favorite (we ate there twice) , Metropol(next to the cock fights) was great too, Don Jose(we had breakfast..it was ok) and Pia Bella(breakfast,,it was ok) to the right of the resort across from the Intercontinenat Hotel Mi Castia....it was greast for breakfast and dinner..we had Ruth Chris at the Intercontinental it was great too. Chillis across the street. Carols, Martin at Kamil and all of the front desk staff were great including the managers. They always answered any questions and gave us great tips about the area. The towel girls were also nice. The concierge staff was great Carlos, Raphael and the rest of the concierge were always helpful too. The lobby was beautiful and the weekened parties in the lobby were amazing...Jimmys BBQ resturant was closed due to damage from the Hurricane and they had the 3 year anniversary party on a Saturday night in the lobby...omg..what a great party...D.J.'s, bands playing and dancing all night..it was amazing!! The Casino was also great alot of slot machines and game tables. We never heard any noise in our rooms from the lobby or disco. ****The only major problem we had was when we booked a tour to the Rain Forest which should have included 3 stops to local beaches and unlimited beers, soda, water , rum punch , pina coladas and a lunch. When my husband and I were on the elevator in the El San Juan we met a man from HIGHLANDER TOURS. He was getting on the elevator from the 6th floor...he said he was a tour guide looking for his guests that were going on a trip that day. Since he was in the resort we thought that he was part of the tour company at the hotel...he gave us the information and everything sounded great so we booked a tour for the next day. It was $75 per person and let me tell you it was a horrible experience. He told us that we could go on a 15-20 minute short tour of the rain forest since my husband had a problem with his leg and that we still could see the rivers and the pool river . After a long ride he took us to some area that I don't even think was the rain forest..some private area...there was another couple in the van..to find out later that they were staying at another hotel. He told us that if we didnot want to take the long tour we could take the short one and then have coffee and pastries.......My son who is a teenager wanted to go on the long trail..donot ask me why but we made him go...the tour guy then tells us to wait where he dropped us..we thought it was going to be a tourist waiting area and go to find out it is someones house up in the woods....he said it was his Aunt's house...the lady was very nice...she didnot speak much english...but we did not pay to sit in some strangers house with roosters and dogs running all over...she had no electric and no water due to the Hurricane...He had the nerve to leave us with an opened bottle of water that was maybe 1/4 filled. The lady offered us fresh coconut water. We waited there for 2 hours in the heat, praying that our son would return safe...which thank god he did. I begged my husband not to fight with this man because we did not know where we were.Before we got there Alex told me that we were about 53 miles away from the resort. It was some experience..we travel alot and never experienced anything like this before. He took us for lunch and then he wanted to get paid....he stopped on the way to pick up a 6 pack of beer....then he took us to Loquillo beach...omg what a slum it was...I donot even think it was that beach..it was dirty...disgusting...a disgrace! No signs saying the name of the beach...no chairs to rent like we read on line....he had his own folding chairs in the back of the van. When we asked him where are the pina coladas, rum punch etc...he said he never told us that (but he said he had rum in the back of his van if we wanted some..lol..crazy)..my husband finally couldnot control himself and had words with him.....my son was looking forward to swimming in that beach and he was even upset about it. Finally when we left that beach he said that he would take us for pina colada's since we must have misunderstood him...which we didnot misunderstand anything...he said he was insulted that my husband told him that we didnot pay to sit by someones house for 2 hours..he said it was his aunts house and it wasnot..the lady told me he was just a friend (I understand some spanish..which he didnot know..he even thought that we whould give him extra money so he could tip her because we stood with her..can u imagine the nerve of this guy!) Well we went to someplace for pina colada's...big deal and it was near a beach..but not a swimming beach..we were just able to look at the view of the beach and we never went near a 3rd beach. It was just a disaster. We advised the resort and made a complaint....we also felt that this man should not have been able to be on the resort property and that he lied and also put us in danger! The hotel manager said that some areas of the resort are opened to the public..which we knew but what was this man doing roaming aroud trying to book tours when the hotel has their own tour company and we only booked the trip because he was on the resort property....security was also contacted and it was the talk of the resort...we were just happy that we returned to the resort safe..his driving was also a horror...most of the time he wasnot even looking at the road...and he also had 2 beers and even stopped for gas on the way back...some tour guide. So please be so careful when booking a tour..thank god we were lucky and returned ok...but some other family may not be as lucky . Well other than our tour experience ...WE ENJOYED OUR STAY AT THE EL SAN JUAN RESORT.... we were even able to get a late check out.....many people from New York also had their flights cancelled due to the Hurricane Irene and were unable to fly back to New York because no flights were available due to the damage in New York ..they said the the resort was very helpful and gave them good rates to stay a few extra days until they were able to return home. My family and I were lucky because our flight was not canceled and we were able to return home as planned. (They also kept us informed on the weather and Hurricane Irene that hit in New York etc) If you plan a vacation to the El San Juan Resort I am sure you will enjoy it...have fun and most of all relax and enjoy spending time with your family or friends! Feel free to contact me if you need any other information!

Reviews.Title: “Issues can easily be avoided--Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dimanchewb88
Reviews.Content: After visiting PR last year, and making ,multiple trips to this hotel to party, I knew this hotel was the place to be for my trip. I actually found an amazing deal on Expedia and I was able to book a room for very reasonably priced. I saw that a hotel employee (Susan Wilkerson) was responding to reviews on trip advisor,so I sent her an e-mail to check in on my reservation and to find out what additional fees,if any, would accrue during my stay. She was very accommodating and quick to respond. We arrived just a few days after Hurricane Irene and we were able to get a room upgrade to the main tower. Oblivious to me,my Expedia reservation included a daily resort credit,so my friend and I put that to good use at the swim up bar lol Our room was pretty nice. We were upgraded from a garden lanais to a vista room. Obviously white furniture doesn't stay white forever,but I wasn't too picky about my room because I was in freaking puerto rico! I did not visit the island to stay cooped up in my room all day! Housekeeping was pretty thorough and my bed was always made and towels always replenished. I never ate at any of the restaurants on site (plenty of others nearby that are much cheaper) and the drinks at the bars can get a little pricey. Thursday Night-Saturday Night the lobby of this hotel and Brava Nightclub are the hottest place to be! I was very happy to be there in the middle of all the action and only have to stumble a few steps back to my room after a few cuba libres :) The hotel served its purpose for my vacation. I'm a fun-loving 23 year old girl that was looking for some good drinks,good dancing and good company in PR. El San Juan Hotel delivered.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: fmagriz
Reviews.Content: I would stay there over and over again. People are so friendly in Puerto Rico and especially the staff. The atmosphere is vibrant, it is elegant with such great energy. The lounge has spanish music and it gets so busy on the weekends. The people in Puerto Rico know how to party. I am thinking that is where everyone goes on the weekend. Instead of a club they hang out at this 5 star (actually I think it's diamond) hotels. The pool....OMG gorgeous and the service spectacular. I highly recommend this hotel, it is exquisite but expensive. You get what you pay for and you will have a great experience there. I know I did.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time...Felt Like Home”
Reviews.Author: TwistedInNYC
Reviews.Content: I just got back on Wednesday 8/31....The staff was superb...Some people complain about the staff...I can't see how. Everyone bent over backwards to make your stay enjoyable....Make sure you meet Angelo(bellman)...great guy...Carlos(bellman)...great guy also....Carlos and Kamil at the front desk also excellent.....Michael in security...another stand up guy....Enough about the staff...The hotel....for a 5 star hotel and the price you pay for everything at the resort....I felt the rooms should have been nicer...The only thing that did upset me was that when you did complain to the hotel about the mold growing within the room ceiling and the tiles that fell off in the shower that hit my son.... they didn't compensate anything for that....Other than that, it was an overall good time.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Ldcallah
Reviews.Content: If you pay for the breakfast buffet, the servers EXPECT a tip. They do nothing except bring you water when you first walk in. I had a waiter tell me if I didn't tip, he'd charge a tip to my room(this was our first day there.) Excuse me?! We sat ourselves, got our own food, and you brought me a water then ignored us the whole time. I was sooooooo turned off by this. Also, we had to stay an extra day due to poor weather in Atlanta and our travel agent arranged for us to stay an extra night. We came to our room around lunch time to find we were locked out!!! We had prepaid for the entire trip and we were locked out in our bathing suits. Also do not pay for the excursions. We chose 2, one was cancelled the last minute because "not enough people signed up" and the other was a shopping trip in which we didn't shop we just drove around old San Juan in a van with no air conditioning filled with 13 people. Oh and this was my honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun, lots of people...lots of women...lots of dancing ;)”
Reviews.Author: omarefren19
Reviews.Content: I've been to Puerto Rico 4 times now, but this was the first time I stayed at the EL SAN JUAN HOTEL in isla verde. It is simply amazing! People from all over the world visit the hotel's lobby because - Wednesday to Saturday...9pm to 3am - they play live music (salsa, cumbia, merengue, etc) so it makes the perfect complement to the 3 large bars the have there too and if you add the casino on the side you find the full combo for young and older people. Club BRAVA is next to the lobby (one of the coolest culbs in PR) so that just puts the cherry on top of the cake. The most beautiful woman make an impressive parade as they lign up to enter the club and some of them end up in the lobby as well. Great place...you won't regret staying there or visiting even if you are not a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay with an Amazing Beach Front and a Great Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: AgentCayey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Juan Hotel & Casino from July 25 -27, 2011. The hotel has a great location in a the touristic area of Isla Verde. First, it is located less than 10 minutes from the airport so a Cab RIde cost you about $10. If you want to drive yourself, they have a parking lot that cost around $20 per day and if you want Valet parking if will be $5 extra per day with unlimited in and outs. Rooms has a modern decoration prevailing the white color among the others. Rooms are very comfortable in space and service is great! Lobby area is wonderful and always because of the light effects, you feel at any time that you are in candle lights. The hotel has a huge pool area that includes at least two big pools and one of them has a swim up bar. In addition, the property posees several jacuzzis with water at different temperatures. Tehre is also, a pool that looks like a pond on a river. This area was my favorite!!!!! The beach is a a great sandy one. It is public but the hotel has a separated area with chairs and beach umbrella for hotel guests. It is a wonderful beach with waves, perfect for the whole family. In terms of food, the hotel has several restaurants and bars, all of them are delicious. However, they are really expensive. So if you want an idea, I was speaking with a guy from Las Vegas and he said that the food is more expensive than in California. They have different options: COCO (Modern Caribbean Cuisine with a Rum Bar), BORTHER JIMMYS BBQ (Souther Style Sport Bar), THE PALM RESTAURANTS (A Steak House), YAMATO (considered San Juan's finest Oriental restaurant, featuring a sushi bar and an authentic teppan-yaki table), LA PICCOLA FONTANA (presenting fine Northern Italian cuisine in an exquisitely appointed, elegant ambiance ), LA TERRAZA (casual-elegant dining offered in a breezy tropical setting, overlooking the pool, tropical gardens, and Isla Verde beachfront), AND GALLERIA, PIZZA & TRATTORIA (Pizza, salads, and sandwiches). There is also a Starbucks Coffee in House and room service is available from 6 AM to 11 PM. However, if you are not planning to spend a lot of money on food, there is a lot of options within walking distances in a very safe area. Places such as Chillis, Dennys, Ponderosa and Fast Food Chains such as Burger King, Subway, Churchs Chicken, Kentucky Fried Chicken, etc are just steps awya from the hotel. This is a great place to stay and I will be back! If you have further questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at jmartinez@empacaquenosvamos.com.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip we have taken in years”
Reviews.Author: Michele L
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. The service was great, the food was delicious and the accomodations were very comfortable. We had a great time, the days were lively and the evenings were fun. I would definately go back, and recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Great People”
Reviews.Author: lschrags
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 nights at the El San Juan. We had a great time and could not have asked to be treated any better. Do not let the negative reviews hold you back from staying at the El San Juan. The front desk people couldn't have been any more accommodating. I was not happy with the first room they gave me and I asked to be switched and in 15 minutes I had a room that I loved. Susan Wilkerson is truly as asset to the El San Juan. The TripAdvisor reviews that praise her are true. We ate at the hotel only one night -- at The Palms steak house. It was delicious. The pool area is great. The cabanas are like beds. The drinks and the food, I thought, were reasonably priced. The cheeseburger and the foot long grilled hot dogs were delicious. I look forward to staying there again soon. If you are looking for a RELAXING place to go ...then book yourself a room at the El San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around and just as wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cookiesnel
Reviews.Content: We visited in May, fell in love with this property and decided to come back for our birthdays. Beautiful room on the 8th floor overlooking pool grounds and ocean. Again, theentire staff was gracious to us. Everyone isextremely helpful and they go out of thier way to make your stay comfortable. Jimmy's BBQ on 10th floor is fun with great food and service. The breakfast buffet overlooking the pools is fabulous! It was quiet this time which made it even more relaxing. The weather was beautiful. The casino is really great w/complimentary drinks and sandwiches while gambling. We will definetly have a return trip in the near future. Special thanks to Carlos Gonzalez.

Reviews.Title: “more pros than con”
Reviews.Author: karan o
Reviews.Content: My family and friends stay at the El San juan Hotel and Casino for five days....the first thing i must say is that altough we arrived very early my room was ready way ahead of time but not the other room....The people at the front desk was very accomodating. I found the lady at the the enterprise rent a car to be very rude. The first nght there it seemed very desolete, but the following night which was friday, the Resort was really packed with people having a great time..overall i would say my stay was great. The downfall is that the rooms can use a little more deep cleaning, for example the windows, the ceiling fan and the balcony needed deep cleaning....

Reviews.Title: “We Absolutely Love it, and will keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: BerniceP916
Reviews.Content: Our stay at El San Juan Resort & Casino was beyond marvelous. The grounds were well kept, the staff was great, and the rooms were impeccable. The hotel had live entertainment nightly and the ambiance was marvelous. We will be back in a couple months, and definetly will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “TRAMATIC EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: joeNeve
Reviews.Content: Dirty Rooms, Threatened by house keeping man, & my credit card & I.D. got stolen by valet, We arrive at the hotel at 3am Sat 8/13/11 the lobby is in full swing. There is no one at the desk we see security and ask him if there is someone to check us in. After waiting for 10 minutes we finally get someone to check us in. She give us room 628. We took our kids and want up to the room. To find the room with dirty sheets rice grains & pubic hairs on the sheets and on the bathroom sink. We go back down stairs to complain she gives another room 917. Once again we take the kids, bags and all and go back upstair to find a very dirty bathroom. Now you must understand it's about 4:30am with 2 kids no room back and fourth we are tired and frustated. Front desk apologizes & says she will have the housekeeping supervisor meet us at 917 that they will clean it right away. We go back upstair to find a lady and a man in 917 cleaning the room the Lady apologizes, & apologizes for the conditions of the rooms. I have now decided to video this nightmare to show the GM Monday morning. The man comes out to the hallway and asked me if I was videoing the events & I said yes I want to show your boss what my family & I have gone through. He begins to yell No I'm not at fault here I have nothing to do with this & becomes very threating. My husband tells him to relax and walk away cause we have the right to record our events. The supervior Luz runs out of the room & tells him "Jose" you are wrong the guest are right please leave the floor and go downstairs he yells & screams the whole way to the elevator about what he is going to do if we show the GM the video. We couldn't believe what had just happened. Thank god I have it all on VIDEO!!! So we go back down stair to ask for a manager. NO manager on duty. Security doesn't do anything we go outside to call Jetblue to see if they wil change our hotel cause we booked with this family vacation with them. They won't do anything. We come back inside to find security laughing with the housekeeping man Jose. We know we were not safe here but didn't have much of a choose until the morning our boys were tired we figured we just lock ourseleves in the room & we would some how wake up from this offial nightmare. The next moring I go downstair to speak to the Manager Noelia she apologizes tells my they will take care of situation that this man will not bother us nor go into our room. I also call the GM's office & left him a msg to call me. Now please understand we decided to stay because we had other family flying in and check-in to the dump because of us. So Monday I go out I take my drivers license & credit card and go to the supermartket to get some stuff for the beach for my kids when I return I give the car to valet & I forget my ID and Amex I relaize once I get to the room. I run downstairs and you guess it. It's gone I didn't complain at the desk. I called the cops they 6 officers & Sgt. show up they to all the info. & they went to valet. Later that night at 10pm we get a knock at the door. My kids were asleep already My husband was watching t.v & I was already dosing of. It's security that there was a noise complain from our room and we had to go to sleep if not if they had another complain we had to leave. I invited him in and showed him my kids were sleeping that they was no noise coming from our rooom. I asked him where were they when I complained about the party that the guest were having in the room next to us. They didn't stop it. I told him to tell his supervisor to please come up to my room. The same supervior from Saturday morning came up. He began to threaten us like we were lil kids & it was pasted our bed time. Are you kidding me We must be on bunked there is no way this is happening. We told him to leave our room. We decied to pack out belongs & leave the hotel. We checked into the Conrad were I told the manager what happen & he felt that the security i our room was because we call the police. Stay away we didn't listen to the reviews. The hotel is a big party place on the weekends not kid friendly, with parties in the rooms, Music coming from all direction. Rooms are very dirty. Maids are nasty they dont clean the rooms right. I could deal with out dated but not dirty. Gaurd your credit cards!! GM Mr. Garcia never called me. I wouldn't never stay here again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste time reading negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn G
Reviews.Content: Don't waste time reading negative reviews as I read 900 reviews before I came. Here is a breakdown from check in to out. Arrival- we were greated by a bellman out front Named Angelo who was extremely friendly. Check in- the front staff was nothing short of welcoming. The lady even walked us over to the bell counter to assure our bags were held while we waited for our room. All the people who complained room wasn't ready...read your check in guidelines before you book. This hotels check in is 4 pm and we were aware of that. Our room was ready by 3 pm. Room- we stayed in ocean lanis and our room was awesome. The furniture is NOT outdated. It is not Miami like but the wood furnishings were gorgeous. You have to have a taste for nice would furnishings to appreciate it. The room was spacious and our sheets were always clean. House keeping- I wish I knew his name because he was great. Our room was always cleaned before we returned even if we were gone an hour. I left jewelry out and nothing was touched. Despite what I had read by other trip advisor reviews. Pools & grounds- the pools were clean and the grounds as well. We never had a problem with wait staff at the pool. Another crappy review I read. Towels - yes you need to give your room to obtain towels but I don't see why everyone complains about that. You are also expected to return them and give your room number again. So what's the problem? Nothing the towel girls were also super friendly. Food- I am a foodie so I was not a fan of the local spots recommended by cab drivers as well as Angelo. The hotel restaurants are expensive but not anymore expensive then eating in Nj or Ny at a fine restaurant. The Palms was fantastic! I wanted to eat there every night. We also ate at the Italian place which also had great food and romantic atmosphere. We ate at Yamato (sushi & japanese) (my husband is Asian) this was the only disappointing restaurant. It's very over priced 18.75 for a special roll and not the best. This was also the only restaurant that included gratuity for a party of two after we tipped over20%. We actually has to complain to get it corrected. We always tip over 20% but a 42 tip on a 116 check is a bit much. Overall staff- no one we encountered was rude. Staff were always saying hello and a handful of times I looked lost they stopped to see if I needed help. I couldn't find a working ice bin and a lady from house keeping came, knocked on our door and even walked me to a working one. They couldn't have been more helpful. Costs- everyone who complained on here didn't read before they booked. Yes they charge if you use the mini bar in your room. BUT guess what,,,it says it right on the mini bar menu sitting on top of it. The Palms is an expensive restaurant regardless of what state your in. It's vacation and if your on a budget don't eat there. Noise & lobby- I stayed in the second building which noise was not a factor. We also spoke with a couple who stayed in the main tower 6 th floor and had no noise complaints. Friday and Saturday the lobby is crowded but a good crowded. It was fun to people watch as everyone does salsa. There are locals but who wouldn't come for great music. If you want a quiet no atmosphere hotel this isn't for you. By no means was the lobby so crowded you couldnt walk. It was entertaining and lively. This hotel was clean, nice staff and a ton to do. Tips for money savers- a ton if places to eat within walking distance with meals under $10.00. You get what you pay for. Mi casitas to right of hotel packed but horrible service. Several places to the left of hotel. Very inexpensive but must like local food. Don Jose, luipis, platos and others. There is also a walgreens to the left of hotel about two blocks.
