Even a chilies across the street which was better then local food. We ventured into old San Juan and ate at racies recommended by Angelo. Again not big on local food so we thought it was terrible,. Try Dragon fly in old San Juan awesome sushi! I wish more people would write good reviews. It seems people like trip advisor to vent yet everyone we encountered at hotel was having a terrace time.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is average with pros and cons.”
Reviews.Author: susan1971
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night getaway. First you notice the street side of the hotel, not very appealing. Isla Verde Avenue is run down and not very inviting for a tourist. On the beach side it is very nice. The sand is cleaned daily, the use of chase lounges is nice too. The water is warm and calm. Our room was in the main hotel and while clean the shower was in need of repair and had mildew. It would also have been nice to be able to use the frig without a charge. The drinks that were offered in the room were crazy expensive! It was nice to have a Walgreens and a Puebla supermarket within walking distance to get drinks and snacks. Because also at the beach and pool everything was very expensive. You can buy a six pack for less than 1 beer at the pool. The pools were spacious although could use some updating. Also the lounge chairs and covered chairs are in desperate need of replacement, some were torn or broken. The landscaping is very nicely kept. At night we enjoyed the casino and spent time listening to the live entertainment. The music was great and so was the people watching. Puerto Ricans are such great dancers! It was nice not having to leave the hotel for this. The hotel has this 50's art deco vibe going on. Every staff member that we spoke with was very friendly and accomadating. The buses were very easy to use to get to Old San Juan (T5 or 53) there is a stop just down from the hotel and they will get you a taxi if you want. Overall we had a good time but couldn't give this hotel a 5 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Adios Forever!”
Reviews.Author: Bambunney
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went to Puerto Rico for a good friend's wedding at the El San Juan Resort & Casino. First off, let me start this off by stating that the wedding was absolutely perfect. It was held on the roof of the hotel around sunset. Although beautiful, I firmly believe it was as great as it was because of the people attending the wedding. This was the best part of the trip. Another "pro" of this hotel is the lobby area. So beautiful! The cons: -The price is ridiculous. This is at best a 3-star hotel. -The pool is like a party gone wild at some sleazy low-class hotel in Vegas. You are lucky if you find a place to sit down. I heard several people getting into arguments over lounge chairs. Not a way to start out a vacation. -The rooms are old and in need of updating -The food is overpriced and nothing special -The clientele mostly consisted of inconsiderate drunks. It seemed a lot of the men were looking for trouble. There was an actual bar fight at the lobby bar on one of the nights we were there. Fists, drinks and F-bombs were flying everywhere!! Women were screaming. Men were cheering! Overall.........stay someplace else!! I would definitely stay closer to Old Town!

Reviews.Title: “I see why the reviews are mixed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Daddy_R
Reviews.Content: I can totally see why the reviews are mixed about this hotel. A litttle background I stayed here as a part of a wedding party. So the hotel would have had to been really terrible in order for us not have a good time. The good: This hotel has a lot of amenities easile for you to take adavantage of workout room, multiple pools, and night club on site. Most of the people I came with stayed up until 3am or 4am noise wasn't a factor to us. The Bad: Wow!!! Everything was super expensive at this hotel. A beer was $7 and mixed drink was $11. There was nothing you could buy to eat less than $12. However, Publeo was a quick 10 minute walk away where you could things very cheaply. I had a great time but when I go back will look for a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Complete Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: StefnJeff
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3:30pm and were told our room would be ready in thirty minutes. Two hours and a $19 bar tab for two beers later we were given our room key. When you pay $300 plus a night for a 5 star hotel you expect a bit more than what we found on the other side of our third floor, double room. First of all, the lamp was broken and not working, and the windows were so high you couldn't open them let alone see out. The "white" couch was so stained we didn't even want to put our luggage on it. Furniture, lamps, alarm clock were obviously dusty. And the bathroom... Wow... Poorly designed and very small. The shower was moldy and appeared to have not been thoroughly cleaned for quite some time. Tiles missing and falling off. Not to mention the random hairs in the shower floor. Be sure to take out a loan before you attempt to use the well overpriced understocked mini bar. There is a nice selection of cold drinks in the fridge, but if you choose to store your own beverages in there, be prepared to pay $10 a day to do so. A huge disappointment in every way. Don't waste your time or money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: AMS21
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel after a bad experience with another hotel. They welcomed us with open arms. Everyone we met from the resort was polite and made us feel special. It was like they actually wanted us there! The pool was beautiful and clear. Plenty of lounge chairs, shade or sun. The hotel had chairs available on a beautiful beach with umbrellas available for a nominal fee. The beach is great for a long morning walk. The rooms were clean. The decor was modern white with bright colors. My son accidentally kept ordering movies which we did not watch and the hotel took every one off of our bill without hesitation. I would highly recommend this resort! What a difference from out previous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cathie S
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this resort was one of the most pleasant that I have had. I travel a great deal for business and this was a very wlecome family pleasure trip. Ali Martin, the guest relations manager took very good care of our entire group, the hotel staff could not have been more accommodating and professional. The resort is beautiful and extremely clean, someone is always walking around and making sure that the entire resort is pristine! The room we had overlooked the ocean with a lovely balcony. The rest of our family stayed in the main building and were all very happy with their rooms. We all had a wonderful time and would and will continue to come back to this resort! We highly recommend it!!! Thank you Mr. Martin!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: JKullak
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. When I looked at the reviews I must say that I was a bit nervous based on the money I was paying, however, it was all well worth it. The person who helped me the most was a very kind and helpful lady named Susan Wilkerson. She is in charge of making your stay as pleasurable as possible and she absolutely did. I wrote her an email with my concerns and she turned my concerns into a relaxing vacation. Please email her or call her and she will make your stay a great one like mine. Great hotel and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, Room Vandalized... Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: 100countries1life
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is beautiful and well-maintained, but the rooms, beach, and pool are not. The front desk staff was not inviting or polite and appeared almost annoyed that we were bothering them with questions and check-in. One staff member was even vocally annoyed at the length of our last name, as she would have to type, "all these letters!" The beach is covered with sand fleas. We came home covered in itchy bites! The atmosphere at night was terrific with a live salsa band and dancers, but it felt like we were staying outside of a mall or bar or something. Very strange. Our room door/hallway was vandalized during our stay, and the staff did not realize, nor did they respond to our concerns when they were told about the incident. For the level of rules, regulations, and dress codes- I expected a nicer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with Hidden Costs”
Reviews.Author: InventoMan
Reviews.Content: This casino is likely the best Hotel in all of Puerto Rico. The grounds and the room is very beautiful. The room is modern, clean and the bed is the best bed I have ever slept in. The grounds has three pools, swim up bars and a wonderful hot tub. It has a club, casino and the lobby areas have several bars and cool places to hang out. It does have shopping and excellent restaurants. There is 24hour beach access and the beach is awesome! It really is incredible. There is a dark side you should know about... It has.. <dun dun> Hidden costs! Seriously, it has a lot of hidden costs. If you rent a car you will have to pay ~$17 a day for parking (guest price), you have to pay $3 per local call and $24 a day in an additional Resort convenience fee. The room service was $20 for a small bowl of soup, which is ok, but they tacked a $14 service fee, which makes is a bit of a spendy bowl of soup. I have to say it was quite delicious though. At the end of the week, eating else where and incurring no other costs, we still ended up spending an extra $300 for the week in hidden fees. So all in all it was a wonderful place, incredibly beautiful. I would suggest going there, but I have to give it a a four out of five because with an extra $300 bucks we could of had about 6 more excursions around the island.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt stay there again unless its DEEPLY discounted”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_R0m3r0
Reviews.Content: The grounds were well maintained. We loved the pools and the easy acess to the beach. Unfortunately we are use to good customer service and we didnt receive any at all! We stayed an entire week and we never felt welcomed. I was really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect or hope for based on the Waldorf name”
Reviews.Author: gstove
Reviews.Content: The rooms were decent, but the hotel could definitely use some updating. We got a great deal through Travel Zoo, so was ok for the money. However, they were hosting a prom the first night of our stay, so there were tons of kids and their parents taking over the pool area during the day and the entire lobby later that night. Would have been nice if someone would have mentioned that when we booked our room. The amount of noise we had to deal with all night from the kids in the room next door was unbearable (music and singing at the top of their lungs). We called the front desk several times and only after my husband threatened to call the police, did they finally get the kids to quiet down. We asked to have our room moved, but because of the prom, the hotel was fully booked that night. They all seemed to head out the next morning and it felt like a totally different place after they all left. Much more peaceful and had the pool to ourselves most of the time. Day two...our shower stopped draining. When they came up to take a look, the guy said, "that's not good" and turned around and left...they eventually moved us to another room...this time right outside of the elevator, so again a little noisy at night as other guests were coming and going, but still much better than the night before. They did give us a credit for the inconvenience, though neglected to apply the daily food and beverage credit that was part of the Travel Zoo deal until we requested it. They also appear to have double charged our credit card, so we are currently working on sorting that all out. As with most hotels and resorts, the food and alcohol prices were ridiculously expensive. It rained on an off every single day, but obviously that wasn't the hotel's fault. I just wouldn't recommend a trip to PR during this time of year, as apparently this is their rainy season. We tried to make the best of it, but probably would not return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “PRIMO Class ALL THE WAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: SassafrassFamily
Reviews.Content: The El San Juan has something for everyone~and our family of 8 (parents and kids in upper teens and twenties) the beach was breathtaking, the pools were amazing, swim-up bars, poolside bars, bar/lunch service brought out to beach and pool...fantabulous breakfast buffet, (which was included in our room/plan) sizzling nightclub (brava), exquisite lobby (four bar/areas, live salsa music and dancing in lobby several nights), exciting casino, and five-star restaurants of every kind! And only a short hop to the 'old san juan' attractions, el morro (fort) and shopping in condado, all within a ten minute cab ride. Airport five minutes away. FUN FUN FUN, glamour, elegance and lots of rest and relaxation in a natural tropical wonderland. The spa (his and her massages) were second to none I have had stateside, and the rooms were sparkling clean, comfortable beds/bedding, no complaints. Service was five-star all the way~and we had an exceptional vacation. WOULD DEFINITELY GO BACK!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My Absolute Favorite place to stay in Isla Verde, since back in the 90s!”
Reviews.Author: azeelnovo117
Reviews.Content: I've Been frequenting The El San Juan Hotel and Casino since the early 90s. For me there is no other Isla Verde Hotel that offers so much value for your $. The Lobby almost always offers Live entertainment starting from the early evening. In the lobby there are several bar areas with ample seating. Either at the bar or on a luxurious lounge chair. You can sit back enjoy one of their delicious signature sangrias, mojitos or your cocktail of choice. While there you can enjoy the live music, atmosphere or people watch! The hotel also has a casino and a Club. As a guest in hotel you have free admission, in and out access to lounge and Club Brava. All others pay entrance fee. Around $25-$30. From thurs-sat night the club is the place to be. From Beautiful local people to tourist, when in club Brava you are sure to rub shoulders with the either famous celebs, models, or tourist whom from word of mouth heard about this trendy hot spot. One thing is for sure Dress code is enforced! In the evenings you will need to step it up a notch to Party like a rock star with the sexy people! There are 2 starbucks in hotel, also several Restaurants to choose from. I enjoyed the Palm restaurant several times. The food was incredible. Also the bar @The palm offers happy hour appetizer specials that are half size and price you will find unbelievable. $5 appetizers etc. After eating and enjoying an amazing dinner we became aware of that happy hour special and became regulars at the bar! Lol The rooms are immaculate. All white tile floors. No rugs! The beds are so comfortable that you will have a hard time getting out of them in the morning! ,just knowing the Beautiful ocean is a short walk from your room out the door, will motivate you to wake up and enjoy the tropical weather. Granted, it is a city beach. You should go through out the island to find amazing beaches. The convenience of hotel being situated on the beach is why I make this my favorite Hotel. There are 2 nice pools, several jacuzzy areas. Some very secluded, and yes you are able to use the pool facilities at night! From the moment you step out of your car in hotel entrance, from the Door man, Valet, to the service at the check in desk to the Lobby , pool Bars, the Beach chair guys etc you will experience professional service with a smile! Granted you may once in awhile experience someone whom is not having such a great day. That is no excuse to us, the customers. Though few and far between. My good experiences at This hotel out weigh the bad. When this kind of situation may arise. Always remember you have the option to speak to a supervisor or a manager who will be happy to hear your concern and try to make you leave with a positive experience. The one time that I need to speak with a supervisor , I was never given the run around. Ms. Yvonne Ramos came to me to hear my concerns and offered reasonable, expedited solutions. In my case was a computer glitch in booking room, not the el san juan website! All around the El San Juan Hotel is my favorite for the beautiful grounds, Beach front location, 5 minute cab ride from airport, $15. Also excellent walking distance from 24 hour grocery store called pueblo. There you can purchase anything from food, fruits, liquor bottles, toiletries, etc. also a chilis across the street, a lot of local bar & grills . (my favorite is The Alambique Bar on beach, same block as the Water club hotel. There you can enjoy a delicious Churrasco with mofongo for $17. Also The Third base bar small and right next to El alambique. There you can buy $1.50 can of beer or $2.50 bottle. all day price. Yes, the taxes and resort fees each day add up. Just remember you are getting Location, entertainment, shopping galleria, Beauty salon, restaurants all in this hotel. If you chose to never leave, you have it all at your convenience! Either a week vacation or a quick gt away! I will always return to the El San Juan Hotel and casino. I was just there in june and already looking forward to my next quick recharging get away. Hopefully September? ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool & Beach But....”
Reviews.Author: daizey
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the garden lanais from 7/24-7/31 which are large but have outdated bathrooms. They were very quiet until Friday and Saturday when the bass from the club thumped until 5am. Saturday nights are very loud and people knocking on our door at 2am and calling our room phone (we finally took it off the hook!). But earlier in the week was very enjoyable. The pool is nice and you do have to get there early to get a good chair. The beach is also very nice and they always had chairs available. We ate at Jimmy's BBQ it's good and nice people working there and the view is great. Actually, everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the pool and beach but I gave it average rating because of the noise on Friday and Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT go to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: chilisbud
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of my least favorite Hotels. First, and most importantly, two of my friends' credit card numbers were stolen/hijacked after we checked in. The first happened when a friends fiance called the hotel to order snacks and beers to the room as a surprise. To her surprise her credit card ended up being used around PR. The kicker was she never stepped foot in PR. The hotel's response: she must have lost her card here in PR. Absurd. Another friend after checking in, ended up with thousands being charged to his card in internet purchases. Not exactly sure what happened there, but seems odd that two people in one weekend had the same problem after their cards went through the hotel. When I complained about it, the hotel had its security goons surround us like criminals and said if I want to complain, I should call the police; which is exactly what I did. I was told by the police that if I wanted anyone to do anything, I should fly my friend's fiance down to PR so she can complain. They all made us feel like they were going to arrest us, so we just decided to leave and never go back. Truly, the hotel management could not care less. The other main issues we had were failed promises made by the hotel. Despite promises of upgrades (we had 10 rooms) and promises of a free pool cabana, we were given nothing. Again, when I tried to talk to someone, I was repeatedly told they were in a meeting. They seriously could not care less about customer service at this hotel. Additionally, you must check your bill carefully, as there were numerous bar charges on my room...the only problem is, I do not really drink so I knew they were not mine. They did take those off. The hotel is a ascetically pleasing, but if you are looking for professional hotel service, look elsewhere. Truly one of the least friendly hotels I have stayed at in quite sometime. I would recommend the Ritz next door. This is was my second time at the hotel and would not go back if you said I could go for free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice play to eat, dance, play and relax!”
Reviews.Author: Coffeemac
Reviews.Content: One of the more complete hotels in Isla Verde. THe hotel lobby is second to none and it has 3 different bars, live music and easy acces to stores, casino, restaurants and clubs. You can select between 2 night clubs, BRAVA which is nice for dancing trendy music and is always pack until 5 a.m. and D'Rose wich is more of an mature atmosphere where people 40+ usually go. The casino is one of the biggest I had ever seen and its staff is super friendly. I loved the pool area, it is HUGE. The restaurants where good specially Palm restaurant. Brother Jimmy's isn't that great. I preferred the baby back ribs from the Chijis across the street, same taste and less expensive. If you are traveling on a budget ask for a City Vista room, this rooms where remodeled recently and everything is new and modern. If you don't have breakfast included and want to save some extra bucks there's a Dennys walking distance. Last but not least try subscribing to Hilton Honnors, its free and they give you a separate line for check in so you can be in your room faster.

Reviews.Title: “Good times, but all rooms are not created equally.”
Reviews.Author: MontegoRae
Reviews.Content: A crew of guys went down for a little guys weekend vacation. The club at the hotel is the life of the party throughout the week and especially on the weekends. Despite the HEAVY rain our entire trip, the pool area was still fun. The pool staff and bartenders where incredible and helped keep the party moving. I was in the main hotel and the rooms were simple and stylish (Miami beach lite) but my buddies were in a first floor cabana or casita and it was pretty crumby. There room was a little ways away from the action and seemed like a dark cave. All in all we had a great time, minus the lost money on the tables, and lack of sunshine... One thing note take serious note of is that the guys who went on the beach got bit by sand fleas... Yeah... Pretty nasty, but I still gave the hotel 4 stars so go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place..!”
Reviews.Author: bajuma
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in July 2011. To be honest, I was invited to go by a friend, so of course I accepted!! I had usually gone to all inclusives...so this would be quite different. I had read many reviews about this hotel before I left. To be completely honest, alot of them had me quite concerned! I had this vision of it being "party central"...noisy, dirty etc. To my surprise, and relief...I can really only say positive things about the actual resort itself. I found it very well maintained, both the actual hotel, and the grounds. The pools were also clean, and nice and warm! The beach was decent, but somehow lacked the appeal of some of the beaches I have been to in Cuba for instance, where the water is a vibrant blue! Here it seemed somewhat murky...but very warm. The staff seemed very accomodating as well. Always a smile! Perhaps the only negatives I can think of...and this is coming from someone who as said earlier, usually goes to the all-inclusives....is the price of the food and drinks in the resort. Definitely worth your while to venture on a 5 minute walk to the nearby Walgreens pharmacy and pick up some cold drinks, snacks etc. We only ate at the hotel once..and that was the breakfast buffet on the very first morning..(as we had no other ideas at that point)....and that was $25 per person. Bit expensive for breakfast every morning...so we soon found a Denny's down the street, which wasn't nearly as fancy..but certainly satisfied us..and at a much cheaper price! There are many steak houses along the main street, as well as other restaurants, and also a plethora of Wendys..Burger King...etc. The Friday and Saturday evenings were very busy with the nightclubs in the lobby...quite entertaining just to sit there and watch all the people streaming in! We were on the 5th floor of the main hotel..and apart from one middle-of-the-night fight in the hallway..we heard nothing else. I would suggest that you go at least the 5th floor and up! There is quite a fun open air restaurant on the top floor of the hotel. In fact during our stay we had the most wicked thunder storms (never experienced tstorms like that before)..one so bad is caused a power outage...when we were dining there! That was almost fun! The hotel quickly had generators working son no panic..and the power came on a short while after. In conclusion...apart from the price of eating and drinking there (which could be very well the norm in these types of places)...I loved this place...!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Lobby”
Reviews.Author: melodya79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at El San Juan, 4 days for a family reunion trip. We had an awesome time. The hotel is beautiful, specially the lobby area and the pools. Lobby bar is very elegant and pool area very inviting with nice day beds. The room looked it was remodeled with a contemporary design. I found the bed and pillows very comfortable. My room was cleaned and restocked every day. Staff was very nice and friendly. The only thing I found needs improvement is the building maintenance on the outside. If you look at the building from the beach or the street, it needs to be painted. This is such a beautiful hotel on the inside and I think that it should be kept the same on the outside. Overall I had a nice stay and wish I could return there very soon.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't believe how bad we were treated.”
Reviews.Author: boogie79
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in absolute disarray from all of the repairs it was doing and the quality of the repairs/ changes to the entranceway, carpets, rooms, hallways and elevators was sub-par. The hotel management was condescending - actually arrogant and ignorant - and they clearly failed to understand the concept of service to others - we were made to feel that we were being honored by them simply acknowledging us. The restaurants, poolside and indoors, served food that was simply terrible - and that's by any and all standards - no real chef - then again, they had a Palm steakhouse (nothing like getting more points) and a place for ribs but NO BUSINESS CENTER. The spa was mediocre. Lastly, the casino lacked....bodies? Excitement? Stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing trip! We will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Lshep82
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I have to say I was a little apprehensive about staying at this hotel after the mixed reviews I read on Trip Advisor, however we just returned from our stay and I am so glad we stayed there! It was a FABULOUS HOTEL with GREAT SERVICE. The trip started so great from the get-go. Before we arrived, I emailed Susan Wilkenson, the hotel manager to ask about an early check in becasue our flight arrived at 10:45am. Once we arrived our room was ready for us and we checked-in immediately. Upon arrival we met our housekeeper Mireya and she was in one word - OUTSTANDING! She offered us a cooler and gave us some great tips on the area and fabulous places to eat. She was ALWAYS ready and willing to help out in any way she could. Mireya was great - the best customer service I have seen in a really long time and I have traveled all over the world! Keith at the pool bar was also very good! He gave my fiance helpful hints on where to eat what to do, even where to propose! He even gave us a complimentary drink to congratulate us on our engagement! The hotel was beautiful and kind of pricey but expected. We ate at the italian place in the hotel the night we got engaged and the food was absolutely spectacular! Definitely a must-go. We also ate at Jimmy's BBQ however I would say save your money and go elsewhere. It was $70 for two of us and we didn't even have any alcoholic drinks! It was no better than a Sonny's BBQ here in the states. We did go off-site for quite a few meals - for breakfast, we definitely recommend Mi Casita on Isla Verde. You literally walk outside the hotel to the right and it's a 5 minute walk on your left. We ate there 3 times, very cheap and very delicious. Our dinner at Ruth's Chris was one word - PHENOMENAL!!!! So great, pricey but so well worth it! Stay away from Lupis to the left of the hotel. I thought it was gross but edible. The chili's across the street was good with prompt service. We went to the Yunque (rain forest) which is a must-do, however rent a car for $45 at the hotel and see it yoursef! Its an hour drive but we were so glad we did it. We also went into Old San Juan and were amazed at the history. We took a bus for 75 cents each way or you can take a taxi for $20 each way. If you take the bus take the 53 or T5. Also we ate at a wonderful place called Raisas (not sure of the spelling) and it was wonderful. They offer authetic puerto rican food and it was delicious. Very moderately priced and highly recommended. A little tip, drinking every day at the hotel can be very expensive. There is a supermarket not far from the hotel called the Puebla and they have all the beer and liquor you could want and very cheap. Stock up and put it in a cooler - you can take it down to the beach! Our last day we had a late flight and the hotel was great!! We got a late check out of 1pm and they held our bags while we went and enjoyed the pool and cocktails for a few more hours!! I hope this review helps, I am not sure what everyone is talking about when they say the hotel is loud and service is poor. We had an outstanding stay and experienced excellent service. I will return and tell all my friends about it too! Thanks Susan, Keith, and Mireya for make our stay memeorable. We hope to see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “My BIG 40th BDAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: kkelly1003
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my 40th birthday bash at the El San Juan Hotel and Casino in October 2010. Since then I have referred numerous of my closest friends and family to the hotel....they all loved it as well!!! Just recently, a group of friends were down at El San Juan and said the customer service was outstanding and they had an enjoyable time. I am returning this August - can't wait to finish celebrating my 40th all over again!!! Awesome hotel, great pool area with swim-up bar, hot tub and beach access......great food at the restaurant KOCO and the Japanese restaurant.....mini shopping mall w/boutique stores right inside the hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, both 35, stayed here recently for 4 nights. ROOM Our room was in the Garden Lanias. Nice room, it was very big, double sinks, couch, view of pool. The room could use some ninor upgrades but overall was very nice. Only noise at night was birds chirping. The garden lanais rooms are separate from the main tower (where the nightclub is located). POOL & BEACH The pool is great, nice grounds, comfortable lounge chairs, swim-up bar. On Saturdays they have a DJ who played good music, but the rest of the days there was no music that I we then missed. Drinks at the pool are very expensive, 2 daquiries cost about $27. The do have a good deal on a bucket of a 8 beers (local beer, Medalla light) for $30. Its a good beer and more alcohol than the American beers. Beach is nice with great sand, and the water is nice but not clear like most other caribean islands. The pool and beach are crowded on weekends, but not so during the week. FOOD Overall, drinks and food at this hotel are very expensive. Most days for lunch we just walked across the street to Chiles as its the same lunch food at the Hotel but a lot cheaper. One night we ate at Brother Jimmys which was a complete rip off. We ate at the Italian restaurant, Picolo, which was very good and great service. It is expensive but they do offer a fixed price menu ($30) that is a pretty good deal. We were going to eat at the steakhouse, Palms, but we next store at the Intercontinental they had Ruth Chris which is our favorite steakhouse. A 5 minute walk from the hotel is the supermarket Pueblo if you want to pick up some drinks and snacks. NIGHTLIFE Thursday thur Sunday the nightclub is packed with very good looking people for the single people out there. The lobby is very nice and big with 3 bars and live music, we hung out here for drinks. During the week it's a lot quieter. GAMBLING Every night we gambled at the Intercontinental next store as they had poker for me and cheap limit blackjack for my wife. The poker was $2-$5 no limit and I did very well as most of the players were locals with a lot of money who did not know how to play. The casino also gives you free food when you gamble! ACTIVITIES There are plenty of activities to do but we just mostly wanted to relax. We got massages at the hotel which were great and reasonably priced (cheaper during the week). We did the jetskis which are always fun but I couldnt convince my wife to go ziplining. One day we went to Old San Juan which I thought was a waste. We waited 45 mins for the bus and then another 45 minute ride there, meanwhile the cab ride back took less than 10 mins. The gym is an above avg hotel gym and running on the beach was excellent. Overall I liked San Juan and I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Truly paradise!”
Reviews.Author: JoeyB77416
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely GORGEOUS! The grouns are incredible, the bars and restauraunts, top of the line. The casino is great, the surrounding area is perfect to go out and get something to eat or go food shopping etc. Frozen drinks by the bool are out of this world!!! Last but not least all of the employees were very friendly and accomodating and even switched our room and gave us a free 75$ credit because they gave us the only room without a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Considered Sleeping on Airport Floor Instead...”
Reviews.Author: applax
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that my wife and I love camping, and I have spent 2 individual weeks sleeping on the side of rivers in Utah, and have no problem "roughing it" when that is what is expected. We both get our hands dirty frequently. We spent the first 2 days of our honeymoon in Vieques Island (east of PR) at the W Retreat (freaking awesome!) and had initially planned to say at the El San Juan for the remaining 6 days. We may have been divorced had that happened. If you are looking for a fraternity party scene, the ESJ may be for you. Our shower had spots of mold on the floor and curtains, the bed had an orange stain on the comforter and sand between the sheets. We were woken up at 3-4am by yelling and cursing (all perfectly audible) and every slammed door rattled our own room door, due in large part to the paper-thin walls. The shower's water never surpassed 85 degrees. The El Yunque hiking tour we booked and paid $140 for the day we arrived, somehow happened to be full the next morning, something we found out as we waited an hour outside the hotel lobby. This led to mass confusion with the money we paid and the consolation trip that was thrown together for us afterward (in which we did not get the tour we had paid for). The man who booked our tour, Ricky, was not at the hotel the morning we were scheduled to leave, so the left foot didn't know what the right was doing. Which brings us to the customer service...the girl (17/18?) we explained our tour mishap to (not Ricky) had no care whatsoever about our situation, while the hotel manager, Marangeli, had trouble looking up from her computer as we explained in detail what had happened over the 24 hours of our stay. She even basically told us that some of the tour companies the ESJ deals with are people she cannot vouch for. She promised to "take care" of us and upgrade us to a Lanais suite, but having seen the ESJ beach (trash, beer bottles, minimal swimming area due to excess ropes/buoys for jet-skis), we decided to leave after 2 nights. We never received a follow-up call. We can certainly second the comments about a complete facelift being needed and the noise (if I was in college, I'd have been fine with all of it). The area the hotel is located in is very downtrodden, with broken bottles and fast food restaurants galore lining the main street. I've never been to a Waldorf hotel, and neither my wife or I has lived in the lap of luxury, but considering the Waldorf's reputation, the ESJ affiliation is nothing more than a complete joke.

Reviews.Title: “Travelers Beware!”
Reviews.Author: EMBFlorida
Reviews.Content: We extended a business trip thinking...wow...posh hotel on a beautiful beach in Puerto Rico. Ultimately, we were very disappointed with the hotel and its facilities. Hotel staff was OK, but scarce at certain times of the day. Not having been to Puerto Rico in years, we found the hotel offered very little information on activities for vacationers. No brochures. No maps. No mention of the island's history or attractions. Taxi fares inconsistent. Ask before you go. Carry cash...not all cabs take credit cards. VERY PRICEY for hotel rooms, meals, drinks and amenities. Expect to spend a lot. Quality of food wasn't great at the hotel restaurants either...we were actually served a plate of potato chips with a cup of salsa for "nachos" at a poolside bar and grill and got charged for it! Not all restaurants/pool bars are open simultaneously during the day. Hotel has a popular disco that is a major attraction to the locals which made many lobby/pool areas in the evening crowded and noisy very late into the evening. Security is questionable as locals have access to the hotel pool areas off the beach. One woman had her purse/beach bag stolen while she was swimming in the pool. Overall, the hotel is in dire need of a facelift although we were told they had recently renovated their rooms. I observed several rooms during my stay...dated furniture and decor once outside the main lobby. Torn mismatched drapes and old, beat up furniture. Our room air conditioning was almost nonexistent after first day. Even a fresh coat of paint or steam cleaning would probably help one's overall impression. Going to the beach or outside pool areas? Be sure to pack plenty of bug juice. The no-see-ums are carnivorous! Poolside towel desk does provide a spray can of OFF to use while you're standing there...so I recommend bringing your own insect repellant. You'll need it! I frequently travel for business and upon completing this trip, I honestly could not fathom this property being remotely associated with the Waldorf Astoria/Hilton chain. We had the chance to visit some nearby hotels that seemed so much more appealing by comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive for a Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: RoseAlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel, overnighting for flight connections on our way back from Martinique. I picked this hotel (we usually stay at the Radisson) because of the reviews and the Waldorf name, and I wanted to have something a little nicer for our last night in the Caribbean. I got a decent rate from hotels.com, but there was a 11% or $21.35 "resort fee" tacked on our final bill - I didn't read the fine print. The rate also included breakfast, but we had to be at the airport early and breakfast isn't served until after 7:00am - not even a cup of coffee. The hotel is a little dated, but still very nice decor. The room was fairly large, exceptionally clean, and the bed very comfortable. Taxi fare from the airport is $10 + gas surcharge + baggage or around $15. We don't gamble so can't comment on the casino, but it looked fairly large. We had dinner at La Piccola Fontana Restaurant in the hotel which was a delight! All-in-all, we paid a resort price for just an overnight stay. We will continue to use the Radisson for our overnight stays, and would stay elsewhere (we're not resort travelers) when we come back for longer stays on the island. Larry & Kelly, Georgetown, TX

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria Hotel? What a joke!”
Reviews.Author: NYRude
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 4 day/3 night stay @ what used to be a beautiful hotel. Was sent to the wrong room @ check-in. Was told that I misread the room number, eventhough the key worked to the "wrong room". Mini bar was hot and not working. They delivered one that worked but it was empty, so I had to remove products from one to the other and wait for the beverages to get cold. Asked to have my daughters' room on the same floor; never happened. I had a reservation for two rooms but they could only find one. Security @ elevators during the evening but guest floor corridors out of control with noise, running and yelling. Housekeeping staff likes to stay outside your guest room, eventhough the doorknob hanger says, do not disturb and carry on their personal conversations. Guest room patio had discarded chicken bone and toothpick on the floor. Hotel in general needs a makeover except for the lobby bar which is a timeless treasure. Wait. staff was friendly and hospitable. Hotel has a great Friday & Saturday night life. As a Hilton Diamond member, this is a major disappointment, next time I'll try the Caribe Hilton or Conrad. This experience was not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: Marsha14057
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days at the El San Juan (March 31-April 2 and April 9-11) . It was another splendid visit. I had responded to a hotel email I received that offered a room upgrade, if one was available upon arrival. I was SO surprised when we were given an ocean front room (see photo for view). Not only that, but there was a card in our room that said, "Welcome home!" How cool is that??? The staff here really do their utmost to ensure that guests feel valued. It's clean, well-kept, and has MANY activities both in and out of the water. The restaurants are excellent, although a bit pricey. I especially like the Palms where the servers treat you like family. There are several good local restaurants within walking distance, though. The thing that I like best about this hotel is the music. On Thursday evenings, a live band in the lobby bar area plays the best Latin music in the area and is a pleasure to watch the locals and guests dance up a storm! Give this hotel a chance if you are going to Puerto Rico. It's a good place to arrive and depart since it is only about 5 minutes from the airport. It's locale makes it also fine for a lengthy stay, close to the Old City as well as a beautiful stretch of beach just to the east...Pinones where you can rent bikes, hike, sample great local food, etc. Can you guess that I am a loyal fan of the El San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: dforbes01
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in this hotel and it was amazing... We had a Garden Lanais room that was just off from the main building. The room was great and the hotel was beautiful! Staff was polite at all times and the 3 pools to choose from made sun bathing a great experience. The hotel also has a private entrance to the beach with hotel employees making sure you are a guest of the hotel. Rooms are clean and the houskeeping staff were very pleasant and offered their services whenever you ran into them in the halls Overall, we would DEFINATELY stay here again....and SOON!!

Reviews.Title: “Expecting Clean Rooms and Quality Service? Keep Looking.”
Reviews.Author: Dupre80
Reviews.Content: This hotel is large with beautiful public areas, excellent pools and hot tubs, and wonderful beach access. But the rooms were far below expectations and not thoroughly cleaned. The hotel was remodeled in 2007, but the bathrooms are still tiny, and it is apparent they did nothing but paint the bathrooms and install new fixtures. The bathroom has a pedestal sink with no counter space -- totally unacceptable for a resort hotel. The room has tile throughout, so be prepared for the cold hard floor. The service was poor, and no one seemed to care. Even the concierge offered little help. The mini bar is stocked, and a tiny sign informs you that personal use of the fridge will cost you $10. Compare prices carefully, and if this hotel is a great deal, then go for it, but come with realistic expectations. If you can get a different hotel for a comparable price, then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Three night stay-will never be back!”
Reviews.Author: nanalorca
Reviews.Content: I advise that you don't leave anything valuable in the security closet while waiting for your room or in your room when you are not in it. My husband and I checked our bags and were sent to the bar with a coupon to wait, "the room will be ready in just a minute..." Much later we were told that the room was ready and proceeded to the elevators. I saw my bags coming from the elevator area and was told there was a change of room and it would be another few minutes. An hour later we were taken to our room. I discovered several pieces of jewelry missing from my bag (it had been a carry-on to the point of checking into the secure closet) Hotel detectives were not helpful and the hotel did nothing to compensate. My mistake for trusting.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Hilton/Waldorf standards!”
Reviews.Author: eelSeattle
Reviews.Content: We are Hilton Diamond and wanted to experience the Waldorf property while visiting San Juan. It was not the worst experience but certainly far less than we expected of a Waldorf Collection property. As might be expected, everything on property was pricey. However, there were numerous good dining choices for any meal within easy walking distance. We were given coupons for use in a restaurant on property which they never told us was closed during our stay. The alternative choice was only open certain hours, but we were given incorrect information that it was available for lunch which of course it was not! We went out to the beach by the hotel. There were no attendants so we each grabbed a lounge chair ourselves. We were given nasty looks when the two attendants returned after about 15 minutes but nothing was said. However, when we asked one of them for the time, we were very rudely ignored. We will never again return to this hotel but are certain it is not indicative of other Waldorf properties. In fact, we will visit the one in Phoenix area soon. The El San Juan is neither worth the hassles or the money!

Reviews.Title: “I had a fun time at night here!”
Reviews.Author: PGirl08
Reviews.Content: I'm glad I chose this hotel for my stay in Puerto Rico. It is definitely the place to be at on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday nights. The hotel has a casino, restaurants, shops, and a club called Brava that is so fun. The hotel staff is not very friendly though. The bartenders at the pool are very dry. Also, I was questioned as if I were a hotel resident or not by the elevator guy, which really upset me. Other than that, the hotel is nice and clean. The food and drinks are very expensive. Be prepared to spend a lot of money at this place, unless you plan on eating in the area outside of the hotel. The pools are really cool and pretty. The beach is so-so....the water is definitely not blue. If it weren't for the night life here on the weekends, I would possibly choose a different hotel, but since I love to watch salsa dancing and hit up Brava (the nightclub), I will choose this hotel during my next visit to Puerto Rico. I had a massage done here, and it was AMAZING! Make sure to ask for a view of the pool. I got a city view and it was a view of the top of another building. Pretty lame. Ask to be on the 5th or 6th floor. You don't want to be below the 5th floor, because the music from the lobby will be so loud that you won't be able to sleep. You also don't want to be on the 7th floor because that is too close to the 8th floor where the BBQ restaurant is which is also really loud at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: TRNW
Reviews.Content: Average is being kind. Check-in was a complete dabacle. We did not get into our room until 7PM (we arrived @ 2PM). Everything was very expensive which I don't mind if the service and food were good. The staff was not accomodating at all. The friendliest staff we encountered during our stay were the bellman. They closed one of the pools during our stay and didn't let you know until you arrived at the pool! This hotel is close to the airport about a $16 cab ride (one-way) to Old San Juan (which we enjoyed). I would think twice about this hotel. The website is accurate when it comes to descriptions and pictures. Read reviews on travel websites - I took them for granted! Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Nice on the surface but very dirty”
Reviews.Author: rp1272
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some girlfriends and definitely would not stay here again. There are many other places to choose from in San Juan, that would have turned out better. One of my friends had bug bites everywhere, and we still aren't sure if it was bedbugs or not. I took at the precautions incase there were. Beach was great, KoCo was great, Brava was fun. The pool is open 24 hrs, which is was pretty cool. There were some positives, but im sure there are better places to stay. Ritz had a nice spa, I've been to better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the Waldorf Astoria name fool you, this is very low class service.”
Reviews.Author: juli778
Reviews.Content: We had the option between the Ritz Carton or the San Juan Hotel and Casino. Since I had stayed at the Ritz before (HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!!!) I figure we would try another hotel and with the name of Waldorf Astoria, how could we go wrong. Well, it has been the worst experience in service I have ever had. I will be writing a letter to the Waldorf Astoria corporate offices to tell them that they need to reimburse my moner for that vacation because their name led me to a 1 star hotel. The first night 3: 30 am there were these people next door (and the connecting doors are hollow) playing music, eating pizza (yes we could smell the pizza) and smoking pot, we call the front desk several times without any answer, I called the HELP line, NO ANSWER, I called the bellhop line and someone finally answered and we were told they would relay the message to the front desk about the unruly people next door. 45 min went by without anything changing, I call back and they answered and said they went up there and did not hear any noise, I said I can aim the phone towards the wall and you will hear it, you don't have to come up. And why aren't you calling their room to tell them instead of supposedly coming up here and not hearing anything, they did no come up they would have heard it coming up the elevator. The front desk attendant said that security wanted to come up and talk to us becuase they did not know what we were talking about, NOW how odd, wrong and scary is that!!!! I said, WHAT??!! it's 4 am, I am in my pijamas, I am being kept awake by the next door people that are stiking the whole place of pizza and mariguana and you want to com and talk to me??!!! about what?? they said to see what I was hearing!!! I said absolutely not, they said we are trying to help but you are not cooperating. At this point I am already worried because of the quality of people I have seen in the lobby that night and I am feeling like the people next door are somebody that cannot be bother because of who they are, when we asked to be moved the next morning we were told, -Well, they are just going to be there one more night and then they'll be gone. We said we don't care we are paying just as much money as they are, give us a room were we can sleep at decent hours. they gave us a room underneath their rooftop bar an grill and we heard stools screetching and tables being moved until 4:30 am. The lack professionalism and negligence in this place is so aweful. I wanted to cry but was afraid of making a big deal with the resposes we had gotten so far. This place felt so wrong. Long story short we were moved one more time after that, the same behaviour continued in the 3rd room, we did not call the front desk it was our last night and we knew what the attitude woulf be so we decided to get up at 4 am pack and get the hell out of there. We did heard the phone ringing before we left in the next room and someone yelling "They want us to quite down!!" So we knew that another couple or family were in for a long week and a waste of their vacation and money. The lobby is impressive, you can tell that it used to be a grand hotel in the times were customer service meant something. At night you see all the seedy people come out and wonder about the lobby and it is worry some because anybody can go up the elevator and wonder the hallways with the supposed security just watching all kinds of people going up and coming down. I still feel horrible because I was the one who told my boyfriend, no let's go to El San Juan it is a Waldorf Astoria!! WHAT A SCAM!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor service!”
Reviews.Author: Vert_PR
Reviews.Content: On my reservation I paid for a pool or ocean view room for 2, and what do I get?, a room on the first floor with no ocean or pool view at all, what I got was a "balcony" with a 7 feet wall blocking any view, almost looking like a jail, I can only see the sky LoL. I quickly went to the lobby and asked for a room change... Ok they gave me a villa near the pools BUT, that room had a strong cigarette smell, not even when I opened the doors made a difference. I called room service to fix the problem, they never came. Only after I when ones again to the lobby that they sent someone to change the bed sheets, but the smoke smell never left the room. For an "Waldorf Astoria Collection Hotel" this hotel has a lot to learn about service...
